1.description: So group of friends trying to get together and have some food.My friend suggests that we come here and so we did. Get there and park in their parking lot.Service is nice and attentive. Food is ok/good. I had the Carne tampiqueña and it was good. I also tried the chicken with poblano peppers, good as well. The rice was bad, really bad.I believe they have a full bar, did not order any alcohol though. It is a little pricey, around 20 bucks for a tampiqueña, plenty of other places in this hood with equal or better food and cheaper. Great service, full bar, ok food, pricey

9.description: I want to like this place, I really do. Sadly, there isomer to not like than like. The service is horrendous, often leaving the dining room unattended to 10-15 minutes. The food is inconsistent. On a good day, it's worth going out for, on a bad day, I've had better in a school cafeteria. Most of what I've had here could use better seasoning, rice and beans should never be bland and tasteless. You can get a good meal here, but I couldn't tell you if you would with any certainty.

12.description: So happy they are back its my favorite restaurant around.. Not only is the food great the people are so nice ! I am never ever disappointed when I eat here!

21.description: I have ordered take-out a few times from "El Tarasco" and my order has always been correct. The food has always been delicious and better than home-made. Check Elizabeth P.'s profile and you will see she is a very negative person. I find it completely unfair and wrong to rate this restaurant one star because she is only getting takeout. Elizabeth should try sitting down to eat for a change and then maybe she will get the customer service that she rarely encounters (per her other reviews).The food has always tasted perfectly cooked and fresh. Complimentary tortilla chips with red and green sauce are a great start to your meal. The "carne asada" and the "steak fajitas" are my favorite but I have tried many other items from their menu and I have never been disappointed. Hand made corn tortilla's are a great treat with your meal. This is also a good place to bring your kids if they are picky eaters because of some of the good kids choices on the menu.The beer is less expensive than many other restaurants and the price difference from domestic to imported beer is also less than other places. I will always recommend "El Tarasco" for great Mexican food!

16.description: It has been a couple of years the last time I ate here. Only reason why I went was due to lunch after a funeral. Was not impressed with the rice or the beans. Chicken Fajitas were ok, yet the guisado was good.  Tortillas were cooked in the microwave or at least they seemed like they were. I don't think I would go back.

17.description: I absolutely love this place. The sopes are amazing. Their service could be better but the food makes up for it.

10.description: I just became a huge fan of El Tarasco, who knew that this place will have such a good food.  I've tried El Pollo Suizo and by far is one of the best I've tried if not the best in Chicago.  Also you should try Las Gorditas de Barbacoa, they're excellent!!

5.description: Nice place, I frequent this place quite a bit. Very clean and organized. Staff can use improvement they take a little long to serve you but worth the wait. Great Micheladas. Recommend this spot.

11.description: It's reopened and it's as good as it ever was! The molcajeteada especial de la casa is amazing! Grilled steak, chicken and cactus is delicious. The drinks are big and delicious and the staff is quick and helpful. We were worried it'd be different after reopening but it's exactly the same and looks even nicer inside! Best taqueria in the area hands down!

22.description: I've been here many times (because of the close proximity to work I might add) and have come to one conclusion.  They do not strive for customer satisfaction if you are picking up your food.  I lost count as to how many times the orders were wrong, but I can't say that the food was all out terrible because it isn't.  It is desent and for lunch specials you could get your money's worth depending on what you order.  But I would overall only recommend this place if you get smart and check your order over before you leave the place.  They have yet to correct their mistakes, but again I end up back there because I feel it ends up being healthier than eating a hamburger everyday.  The people aren't unfriendly either they just don't really pay attention I guess.  It is worth it to try it once and see for yourself though.  You might get lucky, and it's never busy so you never have to wait to get your food.

0.description: I absolutely love there molcajete it's a must try. I enjoyed the service and there margaritas.

20.description: Agree 100% with Elizabeth they will mess up your carry out order 85% of the time. I have mixed reviews about the food. They seem to make decent good fast food. Tacos, burritos, tortas and sopes. Everything else is crappy and not well served. I have tried breakfast and I ended up barfing my chilakiles. I tried Menudo/Pozole both were lacking effort. I have always said that when a restaurant has a big menu they are not good at making anything. This menu is ridiculous I was surprised I didn't find pizza and sushi on this menu. We have ordered other dishes and they lack major effort. I ordered a caldo de mariscos and it was so poorly made a seasoned and the seafood was lacking freshness. I was so mad but I keep ordering for delivery. Yes they deliver and their fats food is not great but it's good. When you want something delivered the list is short. Pizza Chinese Sushi (If your lucky) Being able to add decent Mexican food is a great advantage. I would not waste my time eating in this place. If you are out there is at least 50 other places in the area making way better food. If your drunk, tired, lazy or high.... This place can be god sent when the food gets delivered to your doorsteps.

19.description: Great tasting food. (1 visit - Dine in)

2.description: Well...Ive been back 3x now and their Steak Tacos are AWESOME! VERY FLAVORFUL! I think they make their flour tortillas homemade...BUT..I stopped in and ate in on Sunday and their tacos were DEF" storebought...what gives? Their Chicken tacos are VERY GOOD as well as their Chili Rellenos! A decent place to eat in or get some takeout on the way home from work!

18.description: Agree 100% with Elizabeth they will mess up your carry out order 85% of the time. I have mixed reviews about the food. They seem to make decent good fast food. Tacos, burritos, tortas and sopes. Everything else is crappy and not well served. I have tried breakfast and I ended up barfing my chilakiles. I tried Menudo/Pozole both were lacking effort. I have always said that when a restaurant has a big menu they are not good at making anything. This menu is ridiculous I was surprised I didn't find pizza and sushi on this menu. We have ordered other dishes and they lack major effort. I ordered a caldo de mariscos and it was so poorly made a seasoned and the seafood was lacking freshness. I was so mad but I keep ordering for delivery. Yes they deliver and their fats food is not great but it's good. When you want something delivered the list is short. Pizza Chinese Sushi (If your lucky) Being able to add decent Mexican food is a great advantage. I would not waste my time eating in this place. If you are out there is at least 50 other places in the area making way better food. If your drunk, tired, lazy or high.... This place can be god sent when the food gets delivered to your doorsteps.

13.description: I'm a HUGE fan of this place.  They have the best and hottest chilaquiles in all of Chicago.  I have been a regular here for years but it wasn't until recently that I started checking in and finally today I review it.The service is always perfect, the waitresses are very attentive and friendly.  There is always plenty of seating available regardless of what time you go.  Price in the single dollar sign range ($).  I have tried their guaraches, tacos, carne a la tampiquena, all have been great.  Go ahead and check it out for yourself, you can't go wrong with anything you order.

4.description: This place has some amazing tacos and huaraches! Price also not bad. I like to get the taco with chicarron and top it off with sweet horchata! Will definitely come back here in for more.

6.description: Very cute and very close to being a somewhat authentic Mexican restaurant. I would give it four stars at least however the owners should hire more staff. The front of the house should never be left barren since the person also has to work the back of house I. E. Kitchen....Since the few staff members on board were so busy my order arrived and it was nothing like the actual description. I wasn't going to complain since it would probably take an eternity to rectify the situation. Other than that if your en route to midway airport or just happen to be in the area try the "comida" it's well prepared & the service from the two people that were on staff was nothing less than superb.

15.description: Visited El Tarasco yesterday because it was recommended by friends.  However,  I was not that impressed with the food or atmosphere.My wife ordered the Carne Asada.  The meat itself cooked two different ways.  One piece was cooked well. The other piece was under cooked.  Either pre-cook their food and warm it up, or something else is going on there.  I ordered the breaded steak dinner.  The steak was rather thin and just average.  The rice and beans were not impressive either. The michilada was okay. A little bit to much clamato. The place was very cold.  There was music playing from the restaurant and there was a loud thumping sound from the basement where a party was going on.  This made for a very ackward experience.  I think the place and food was just average or below.  I would not go out of my way to visit this place again.

7.description: Hubby and I love this place because it's close to hope and great price. But, besides the convenience the food does taste like Mom's homemade cooking! Awesome Chilaquiles and home made tortillas!

8.description: Is this place opened again? It was shutdown because of a fire. I like the sopes de azada and the nachos. That's it. Everything else that I've ordered has always been decent. Nothing out of the ordinary. It's an okay place if you're in the neighborhood.

3.description: Should of ordered extra steak! The food was warm and the tacos were bare. Not enough product from the cost! I should of went to Subway

14.description: Came here with the family & they have a pretty decent shrimp cocktail; 3rd best (my mom's is still #1).  Everyone liked their orders & the staff was nice.  We will definitely go back

1.description: For what it is I will give them a three star. I ended up joining their program as far as regards so I have a year to get discounts. I've used the discount card at least 4 times and basically it has paid for itself. I like the fact that this location doesn't allow for funnies! Story goes like this; I went in on a Saturday and basically everything was so close together, when I grabbed an item, all the other items came crashing down! Moral of the story, this place is not big watch what you touch!But I still enjoyed the fact that the workers didn't laugh (so hard).

0.description: The service was great  the guy answers all my questions so  I give 4 star .!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

3.description: This hidden gem is a great secret tucked away in archer heights. Located in a little strip mall you can't miss it with its bright lights and parking lot full. They offer authentic Mexican classics at a great price. From the classic tacos, tortas and gorditas to carne asada and huaraches. Really good salsa verde. Service can use some improvement. The interior might push some people away, this place is far from fancy. A little bit of a dive if anything but overall good food. I recommend this place and encourage to try it out

1.description: One of the best al pastor tacos I've had! We order late at night from outside. We have had great service and then not so great service but I'll keep going there.

0.description: I discover this place because of my father. He loves the tacos from here. From tripas, lengua, and carne asada with cebolla and cilantro. He also likes purchasing his menudo here.I've been buying their lengua and carne asada tacos lately with cebolla and cilantro and I have to say they are delicious!! love the guacamole hot sauce that comes with them. We Just do pick up and have never dined in. They also have delivery if you live within their delivery boundaries. There's a minimum of $15.00 purchase and they charge you a $2.00 fee.Parking is scarce as its located in a small strip mall which they share with a banquet hall that they own and a temp agency. Best bet is finding parking along 47th street. They close late on friday and saturday at 3 a.m. they open a food trailer that's connected to their main restaurant.They do set up tents with tables and chairs for their customers during warm days. After reading feedback from other yelpers, I will definitely be requesting the home made tortillas too! :-D

2.description: I've been here a couple times with my mom, twice from breakfast and once for dinner. You can't go wrong with the huevos rancheros for breakfast and some coffee. They give you pan dulce, chips and salsa which is a plus. For dinner I've picked up some tacos de asada and al pastor, both have been delicious. It's authentic Mexican but the establishment isn't the nicest. It's very clean but it's not the most beautiful restaurant. Bring cash or eat more than $10 so you can pay with a credit card.

5.description: Favorite taco place. The restaurant has limited parking, some of which is occupied by a taco trailer, connected to the restaurant during the winter. In the summer theyTake up even more parking for an outdoor tent with extra seating but it's really nice to walk up & be waited on outside in the nice summer nights. Everything is good here. Love their chips with the guac-salsa, the hubs like the salsa al molcajete.. Their fajitas are good, the pork tacos from the truck outside are delicious (add onion, cilantro, & pineapple), we also love the chicken salad which is deliciously seasoned grilled chicken on a bed of fresh veggies, and we also like the sope de chorizo y frijoles, lettuce and tomato. Delish! The place looks kind of bogus yes, but the food speaks for itself. I almost don't want to post this so ppl don't come but it's good and the world must know. Lol try it! Guac-salsa they give u with the chips is bomb.

6.description: The food was good. Their salsa was spicy and had great flavor. Unfortunately didn't get to try homemade tortilla didn't know I had to ask for them or was given an option by staff I only knew about that by the reviews which I read too late. The kids enjoyed their tacos and they also had fries most Mexican restaurants don't have which worked out well because my kids always ask for them. The horchata was ok drinkable. Will come back for those homemade tortillas!

7.description: I was so happy to discover this taco place so close to home! I was hesitant at first but as soon as I had a bite I was hooked!!! There meat is tender and tastes great! Their tortillas are made of corn and you can pick the regular factory made or hand made!They are both great depends how fast you want to feel full. Their green sauce is amazing!!!! I have been coming here for tacos for two years now! When the weather is nice they have an outdoor eating area! Only thing is you must order more than $10 to use credit card and you must show ID! Don't forget when you go!

8.description: Love this place. You can almost miss it if you are not looking for it. Great food, clean service. affordable.  They have homemade tortillas for the Azador Tacos. Try one. The lunch specials also rock.

9.description: We contracted this place for a taco party on 7/19/2014.Basically they come out with the meats, side dishes and drinks and serve your guests. The servers are there for about 3 hours once the time is up they are supposed to leave all the left over food, since you did pay for it. Well let me just give you a tip....watch them closely!!! We had paid for a party of 100 people and about 40 showed up. Yet apparently by the end of the 3 hours NO FOOD WAS LEFT!  They even told some of our guests that they ran out of tortillas!! When they were packing up their thing we asked to see what was in the sealed aluminum trays under their grill. The servers told us it was just trays of grilled onions. We asked them to show us. So the tray was flung on the table and when we opened it we saw that it was a full tray of chicken there was another full tray of rice! Needless to say the servers looked like fools and we were upset considering that the same thing happened 3 weeks before on (6/28/2014)when we had contracted this place for another family party. Unfortunately we we didn't catch the servers from the last party but numerous guests told us that they had seen them put the extra food in their vehicle when they packed up at the end of the party. After the party on 7/19 some of more of our guests told us that they had gone up to ask for more food and the servers had told them that they were out of tortillas!!!!! Yet at the end of the night when we asked them to leave us everything that we PAID for they took out about 15 dozen tortilla packets from under the grill that they lug around to all the parties they cater. We called the owner to inform him about what his employees had done in TWO of our parties. He seemed very shocked but he did say that the only food the servers are asked to bring back are the tortillas?!? So do we get a refund for that??? Because according to their contract we paid for them! Let me tell you having them come out and serve at your party is not cheap, we paid $700 for 100 people 3 years ago we paid $480 for the same amount. So you know that these businesses are making a huge profit especially if they are keeping the extra food you paid for.  So taco lovers beware if you want to have happy guests and get your money's worth then keep an eye on the servers or you will be ripped off and have hungry guests! But just to be fair I will say that the food is actually pretty good no complaints about that.

10.description: El Asador is my go-to place for tacos de cabeza. Not alot of taquerias offer this on their menu. Their barbacoa, asada, and pastor are great options as well. We hired them twice for taquiza's at a party and all of our guests raved about the tacos. The owner is very friendly and will work with you to make your party a success. Their green salsa y to die for! I think they add avocado to it, but make sure you have a glass of horchata or another beverage on hand because it is hot. They provide free chips and a small cup of fideo soup when you arrive. He sets up his taquiza outside under a tent which is popular as well. There is even a small hall attached to the taqueria so you can throw your own party. Before I forget, you have the option to ask them to make the tortillas for  your tacos. It will cost a little bit more but it is very well worth it! The tacos are huge and very flavorful!

4.description: A hole in the wall place but food is pretty good. The tacos are pretty good but a little dry for my taste. Regardless, the food has good flavor and the salsas are great. The salsa as a topping adjusted the dryness.

28.description: Excellent Pizza for the price :) very yummy and prepared rather quickly!  LOVE IT!

1.description: Just A Pizza has been so good the last severaltimes. Consistent flavor and crispy crust each and every time!  Can't wait for next week to order again!!!!

9.description: I am an avid pizza lover and though ive tried the rest my family seems to think this place is the best.  Been ordering here since the broasted chicken days.  This is not your fine dining restaurant this is a straight Southside pizza joint so dont expect Starbuck customer service you order pay and get out after all its just a pizza

29.description: A classic.  Best traditional pie in the city.

23.description: Best pizza for the price. It's cheap, it's great. Need I say more? It's a local place that adds a certain charm to the area.

5.description: Excellent tasting thin crust pizza with very fast delivery.

31.description: I'm giving it TWO stars because the pizza is DELISH .... HOWEVER the service and the phone people SUCK BIG TIME!!  I ordered a pizza at 10:07 and it came at 11:35 with HOT REGULAR RC instead of COLD DIET!  After he told me I can't guarantee anything!  I said what can't you guarantee?  The diet?  Or the Cold?  He said I can guarantee the diet but not that it will be hot.  The guy wrote it on the menu they just never follow thru with anything!  This is my second try after coming back to them from years ago!  Now I know why I must have quit going long time ago!  There won't be a third time you're out!  THEY'RE OUT NOW!

25.description: The pizza is delicious! It is an old fashion pizza parlor. They even have old style vending machines. It is a tiny place with an outdoor patio (weather permitting) Keep in mind: they do not accept Credit cards.

12.description: I came here couple years ago when I barely moved in to this area and the pizza was delicious with fresh ingredients and great taste. We ordered just about every week up until the pizza started to taste like frozen pizza. Then we stopped coming. But recently I decided to give it another shot because I had a coupon for a party pizza for 12 bucks. Hey I love a good deal.The name really does represent the taste. The prices are very good but the taste is just blah. It does not taste frozen anymore but theres not much to this pizza pie. If you like super thin crust, this is your place. But as far as flavor and cheese go, I am very disappointed. I will keep ordering from my favorite spot, Pop in Pizza. This is truly just a pizza and nothing more.

21.description: I love there pizza! There thin crust sausage is covered in sausage and cheese. I ordered and pick it up, it was super hott just out of the oven. The only downside is they dont take cards!

16.description: I ordered this pizza last night, actually two, delivered.It had been about six weeks since I ordered from here because I like to rotate among several pizza places.  I've been eating Just-A-Pizza pizza forever.But this last order may quite possibly have been my last order.The pizzas when they arrived were barely warm.The pizza was extremely dry and the crust was very tough and chewy, a real workout on the jaws.The sauce was almost nonexistent.  The cheese, not even half of the cheese that is normally on there.  I don't know if they have a new cook or what the problem was, but not once in 20 years of ordering from here have I ever had a problem.  And the pizza always arrived hot, even when I lived farther away.I didn't tell my brother, he loves this place, but I'll give it a few days and by then he should have ordered from here.  If his pizza is the same as always, I will forgive this, what I hope is a one time big time screwup and order again.  If not, I am sorry that I will have to part ways with Just-A-Pizza.

17.description: The pizza is delicious! It is an old fashion pizza parlor. They even have old style vending machines. It is a tiny place with an outdoor patio (weather permitting) Keep in mind: they do not accept Credit cards.

10.description: I had my sister place an order so that I could pick up on my way from work. As I pulled out my debit card the guy told me I had to charge $20 on it. He insisted I add more to my order. I declined because I wanted to go straight home. He said if I didn't order more he would have to place a $2 service fee on my total bill. I told him I wasn't gonna order more or agree to a service fee. He then grabbed the pizza and took it back. I don't know if they're trying to get more money out of ppl but I won't return there. I noticed some reviews on here where ppl say they don't take cards. However my sister has ordered there before with a sum total less than $20 and had no issue. This seems shady to me if ppl are being told different info at checkout. I'll take my business to Pop N Pizza on 59th and Lawndale. Greater servings + better taste at an awesome price without the hassle.

11.description: I ordered a pizza on a Friday at 5:30 or 6:00 and was told the wait would be an hour and a half.  I ordered a large all green pepper, half ground beef and he other half Italian beef.  One half had onions too.  After an hour and a half I called, because the pizza had not been delivered.  I was told it was in the oven and would be done in 15 minutes and I would have a hot pizza.  When it was finally delivered, it was not hot and it did not have onions on it.  I called back and still being nice told them.  They offered to make another one or give me a credit.  I went with the credit.  I did a couple things before I warmed the pizza up.  I was pulling it apart to give my dogs some and realized I did not have sauce on my fingers.  I pulled the cheese up and saw that there was no sauce on it.  I took pictures of it.  It is now 8:30 and I'm mad.  I called back and the manager argued with me that there was sauce on it.  He said he rolled it so he knows he put sauce on it.  I told him honestly there was no sauce.  He told me there was sauce, but probably not enough for me.  I told him he might have used a tablespoon of sauce on the entire pizza.  I asked him to call me back when he got the pizza and tell me if he saw sauce on the pizza.   I requested a new pizza.  I pulled the cheese up on every single piece of pizza and took pictures.  After waiting another 45 minutes to an hour.  I called again and asked where my pizza was.  They said it was on it's way.  I was so upset that the manager argued with me about the sauce and I was past being hungry that I put the old pizza outside on the table and taped a note on the door telling the driver to take them both back and refund my money.

26.description: Attitude served fresh daily. They keep the 'OPEN' sign turned on (even when they're closed) and there are no visibly posted hours on the outside. Don't call to ask if they take cash and/or credit because you'll just get a smart answer from what sounds like a small man who's awfully smug about running a sub par fast food place that resembles a place you're more likely to get mugged at than be served anything you can possibly consume.

27.description: Ahhh this pizza is just soooo good! It's half a block from my aunts house and I love it. The only bad thing is that they take forever but it's worth the wait. One of the best thin pizzas I've eaten!

0.description: Omg I love Just a Pizza because they bring me bags of food right to my hotel room and I love the gravy bread and large cheeses pizza and those liters of RC I haven't ate all day!!!!!

20.description: I do not care for this pizza. I went there for the first time. The crest was like chewing on gummy bears which the dough was not cooked all the way. I will never go there again. Very bad experience.

19.description: Live down the street from here and if it wasn't for that convenience I probably wouldn't come back.  I thought it was pretty shady when they recently raised their prices but failed to provide updated menus.  Only to be stunned when you asked when you picked up the pie.  I understand that raising prices is a part of running a business but maybe I'm of the old school of thought where quality should match said price increases.  The pizzas aren't bad and they do have a variety on their menu.  But when ordering for pick up, make sure you give yourself an extra 10 minutes beyond what they tell you because they always drag.

33.description: Just-A-Pizza is hands down the best pizza in Chicago. I don't get the other reviewer, but don't believe either of us. Order a thin crust Special and decide for yourself. You won't be disappointed.

2.description: This place makes really great pizza! Zesty sauce and crispy crust! Unfortunately it takes forever to get your pizza here. There is a huge sign on the side of the building advertising slices, but every time I come here for one they tell me it is at least a 20 minute wait. I once called ahead, but was told I cannot they don't make slices for phone orders - that I have to come in to order slices. Luckily I live down the block. So I come in and they tell me 15-20 minutes for slices. Very inconvenient. Every time I am here there are people waiting for food and the phone is ringing off the hook with no one answering. They definitely need more employees/trained employees because things have been the same over the 2 1/2 years I've been coming in. Great pizza, but extremely frustrating experience.

34.description: I'm a northsider at heart.... recently moved to the southside and pizza down here has yet to win me over.  Pizza is ok. The pasta dishes are horrible.

32.description: This is by far my favorite pizza joint in Chicago. I wish they accepted credit cards, but I'll make a quick run to the ATM for this pizza. They're open late and the pizza's awesome! I wish they would deliver to Lincoln Park because the only thing around here is Sarpino's which delivers late, and even though they're good, their prices are wack and they don't give you a free RC or a coupon with each order which (when combined with 19 coupons) will get me a free pizza! Also, they're not AS good.

18.description: Attitude served fresh daily. They keep the 'OPEN' sign turned on (even when they're closed) and there are no visibly posted hours on the outside. Don't call to ask if they take cash and/or credit because you'll just get a smart answer from what sounds like a small man who's awfully smug about running a sub par fast food place that resembles a place you're more likely to get mugged at than be served anything you can possibly consume.

13.description: Sadly, this is now just an average pizza. What happened?!

4.description: I was visiting a friend and she ordered pizza for dinner and it was gooood :-) So I got the info and picked up a pizza the following week for my family and they loved it. Nice crispy crust and the mushrooms were fresh. I didn't see anything wrong with the staff either.  I mean it's not Giordano's dining you're rating.  Definitely gained a new customer.

24.description: I'm giving just a pizza a 2 stars just because there pizza is good. Other, then that I had a bad experience with them. It was a late night came from drinking & decided to stop by at just a pizza. When, a couple of minutes they where about to close the guy in charge he was nice & came through to came us a pizza just before they where getting ready to close. He also gave me 2 extra slices because I had mentioned an article that was on the local newspaper. So, I waited for the pizza to be made & none the less my partner & I ate in our car close by to the location. There had happen to put a bunch of hairs in our pizza. I don't know if the reason was because they had to make before they left or just because we where handing them back & they where ready to leave. I couldn't go back & complain because it was already close. This was a couple of months ago & don't plan on going back. I was drunk but when I felt the hair immediately I became sober.

6.description: Customer service is, by-far, the worst. At first, I thought it was just me, but then when I experienced it first-hand, I knew it was true! So, after having ordered and paid 55 minutes in advance, I arrive to find out that my order had been handed to someone else, who I was advised by another customer, "was unaware the food had already been paid for and wasn't able to provide a phone number," but the "front -end" manager didn't seem to catch on and continued to give them a free pizza. Here's the kicker; the manager, owner, whoever, came to the front and offered that they deliver our order and give us half off our NEXT order! This was insulting for I was the inconvenienced customer, yet I was going to be fully charged while the other person walked with MY free pizza!!! My family has been loyal for 39 years! Me and my younger generation will no longer part-take in making this local business prosper! Bye! If I could give a zero star I would!! That's how upset/frustrating this problem is to me. Thank you for reAding!

22.description: I ordered this pizza last night, actually two, delivered.It had been about six weeks since I ordered from here because I like to rotate among several pizza places.  I've been eating Just-A-Pizza pizza forever.But this last order may quite possibly have been my last order.The pizzas when they arrived were barely warm.The pizza was extremely dry and the crust was very tough and chewy, a real workout on the jaws.The sauce was almost nonexistent.  The cheese, not even half of the cheese that is normally on there.  I don't know if they have a new cook or what the problem was, but not once in 20 years of ordering from here have I ever had a problem.  And the pizza always arrived hot, even when I lived farther away.I didn't tell my brother, he loves this place, but I'll give it a few days and by then he should have ordered from here.  If his pizza is the same as always, I will forgive this, what I hope is a one time big time screwup and order again.  If not, I am sorry that I will have to part ways with Just-A-Pizza.

15.description: We ordered a pizza a few days ago and it was awful.  I thought I'd let it go but I can't.  It was the wrong size,  was only bArely warm on arrival and not near enough cheese.  Also, asked for mild gardinera but got hot.  We used to order from this place for years and quit it as the quality went down.  Recently tried it again but it's just not good.  The cheese doesn't even cover the pizza and it's just not very good anymore even tho I like their crust, it's what's on top that counts.  Sorry, I'm done with you.

7.description: This place is lucky I can't give them no stars. I place a order for Super Bowl Sunday. I am a very unhappy customer. I place an order for delivery and was given a 2 hour wait. I expect a longer wait time because the game was on (totally understandable). Two hours later no pizza so I decided to call. When I called I was told my pizza is in the oven with 15mins to go. My family was really hungry otherwise I would've canceled. So we kept our order and was told the pizza would be on its way. One hour later still no pizza. Now, not only I'm I hungry but also frustrated because I have to call once again. This time I was told the pizza left and is on its way. The pizza came 30mins later. I waited a total of 3 hours 30 mins for JUST-A-PIZZANever again will I order from that place. GET IT TOGETHER OVER THERE PEOPLE !!

8.description: The pizza is great. Have been getting this pizza for years and nothing has ever gone wrong. But I will say that lately there have been a few issues with the wait for the pizza and being told incorrect times for pick-up. Result:frustration. But other than that I definitely recommend.

30.description: I don't get the hype.  The pizza is OKAY, but really, the low price is the only reason I occasionally order.  Just because it's cheap doesn't mean it's good.However, the last 10 times I've ordered from them, my order has been screwed up.  Their "Write your order in scribbled shorthand on the back of a menu" system sucks, to say the lease.  Ordering Garlic cheese bread? You won't be getting the cheese. Want a side of Garlic dressing? It'll never come.  French bread? You won't be getting butter.Every time I order a pizza from them pie cut, it never arrives that way.  When I specifically asked for it last time, the guy said he "couldn't guarantee it."  They can't handle a simple specialty cut? Come on.I even wrote a letter to the management months ago and never received a reply.  Obviously, they don't care at all about their customers.

3.description: Not a good first impression at all. Before arriving to the airport, we decided to grab a slice on the go. We found this spot and decided to give them a shot.. We had to park on the street and unfortunately there was trash all over leading us to the door. Although, their neighbors are just as responsible as they are, the entrance really looked unkept. I'd usually leave when seeing something like this, but with limited options and time, we walked in. Once you walk in, the lobby is extremely small and you are greeted with a sign that states cards are only accepted with a $20 minimum.. That's an automatic turn off for me. If it wasn't for us traveling, we wouldn't have cash on us period. We ordered two slices and were told that it'll take 20 minutes.. seriously?!?! Needless to say, we ended up leaving without trying anything.. And no apologies from the guy. So would I come back? Doubtful! For being the only by the slice spot close to the airport and within miles reach, I'd suggest they step up their game.

14.description: I always order delivery from here ( I don't recommend eating there no room)  the pizza is always great my boyfriend likes the thin crust, it's ok, but not enough sauce for me. I like the deep dish, delicious!  I recently tried their spaghetti, it was amazing! Lots of it, with lots of sauce and herbs if you like it that way. All their food is great! Always on time too.

12.description: This is a pretty decent place. It's not the best ever but it's not too bad. Steak taco is really great. Chicken taco not so great. Spicy stuff is super spicy! I kind of don't get the club atmosphere they are going for here with thumping dance hits playing while you eat tacos...maybe it works on the weekend or at night with a different crowd but that's not really what I want to hear at lunch on a Tuesday. If you ask them to turn it down they will, so that's good.

3.description: I love their burgers, the portion is huge as both my son and I ate off of one. I've also had tacos de asada and al pastor. I'm picky when in it comes to al pastor but this one was delish. The steak burrito is also great. My husband loves the carne a la tampiqueña. One thing though they have delivery yet every time I've called they don't have a driver, so that's a big minus.

1.description: Almost 3 stars but gave them 4 since their staff is super friendly.  Food is decent but if I ask for something to be left off or extra with my order it's almost always wrong!  Free parking (if you can find a spot).  Prices are average.

2.description: I had the steak torta. It was delicious. Great bread , good crunch to the crust. Also there is an avocado salsa verde on the table that was delicious. I would definitely come back. Great customer service also. First photo was of the carne asada torta. Second of the avocado salsa verde

9.description: I've been here twice, once when they first opened and once in the last 2 months, both for dinner with my family.  They changed something for the better because my chicken flautas were perfectly crispy and the guacamole was delicious.

10.description: Stop in yesterday with my gf for the first time and we ordered a milanesa and a barbacoa torta . Let me tell you we where impressed both tortas where delicious and we will defenitly go back  ;-)

13.description: Good food. Good customer service. I'm giving 4 starts because the sauce used for the chips is too spicy, I like spicy but this is just too much and has no flavor.

16.description: I have been to this restaurant several times and every time I go i get the same great service , ! every time !! , super  friendly , fast , and super clean , I just love everything about this place and , the food its awesome ! mmmm the tampiquena out of this world !!!!, I just wish they would stay opened a little later .

6.description: Horrible service! I order food to go and waited more than 30min. When there wasn't even customers to attend. What I dislike was that my order had been sitting in the counter for more than 10 min. Until i went and told them about my order. I order gorditas which they are not good at all flavor wise, and they are pretty small too. I would recommend  Pinoleros on 6693 w Pershing, they are the bomb.

15.description: Just opened up a few months ago. Was impressed. Owners are nice. Definitely making it a regular spot for me.

0.description: Nice location. Went once quick to buy tacos and a gordita wasn't a big fan of them. But this time we checked out yelp and saw photos of the pulpo al gusto and looked good so we got that and filete relleno and both were very good! Great BIG portions. It's byob we took a bottle of wine but they had no wine glasses so they gave us regular plastic cups. Not cool we took rest of the bottle home. Loved the festive chips!!!

5.description: A variety of Classic Mexican dishes. Try the Gorditas-very tasty. The ceviche appetizers were plentiful & fresh. I had the grilled Pulpo en Ajo n butter-served with a salad,rice. Very good. Tortillas are hecho a Mano.-Handmade. The guacamole was abundant & very fresh.  Try the jamaica drink-nice and strong. Great service and very accommodating. Come hungry.

11.description: For starters, I went here thinking it was a pizza restaurant (it was before...lol)  Seeing that I was already in the parking lot I decided to check it out.  I agree with the other reviewer stating that the atmosphere is somewhat "clubby" but I was busy on Facebook to let it annoy me.I ended up ordering the gorditas and I will say this, they are pretty close to the gorditas that my mom makes.  That is how good they are!  This is a nice change of pace seeing that there are so many taquerias in the area offering nothing but tacos, burritos, and tortas.  Their hot salsa is the way I like it.  HOT!  If you don't like hot salsa, don't eat it...lol  The service is really fast and very friendly.  I will need to bring my mom here to see if the gorditas have her seal of approval.

8.description: Best burgers ever! Even taste great reheated. Delicious, also their green sauce and chips is the best!

4.description: This is the only place outside of la comarca lagunera that I've been able to find a Durango style hamburger.  Amazing with a thin beef party, cheese, ham, bacon and all the fixens.  The staff is friendly but sometimes you have to get there attention to come back after the meal is served but overall a great place.  One day I'll have to try some if their other food I suspect it will be as good as the burger.

14.description: Favelas is hit or miss depending on what you order. Although I've never sat in to eat  the place has a modern look and looks like a fun place to dine in and BYOB is always a plus.. I've ordered for pickup 3 times and for delivery twice and 3 out of the 5 they have messed up my order in some type of way. Wether it was forgetting to pack everything for my pick up order and charging me for it or delivering an incomplete order without charging me for the missing item (and won't forget to mention over cooking my food or including a hard old piece of bread instead of tortillas with my caldo de camaron). The caldo de camaron is awesome , and the el presidente platillo is one of my faves comes with bacon wrapped shrimp! how can you pass on bacon wrapped shrimp!. I've also had the humongous Favela burger which can feed 4 people which is ok but i found the top bun to be a little dry and almost 3 inches thick (too much bread and they should have thrown the top bun on the grill for a minute) also had a torta which also seems to have too much bun on top kinda dry and crumbly. overall decent place some stuff better than others but the average things that should be on point are not so to each his own give it a try

7.description: Love there avocado salsa verde, so spicy and delicious mmm I love it !I always get there green enchiladas and I love how they have the option either having your chicken grilled or boiled... I choose grilled! Super delish! They ladies there always look cute and presentable, with matching shirts and I've noticed different color a day? Cuties!

0.description: Supposed to be the best of pawn shops in the area. A bit on the small side and the selections aren't the very best. You can find things here and there, but this day I didn't bother. I was next door and decided to just moozey on down here and see what kinds of items I could find. At first I was like, okay, nothing nice here for me to buy, so I just browsed and realized, most of this stuff is so not me. But I am sure if you like things that are slightly used and really cheap, come on in. Although their hours are posted now, it seems like they don't really stick to a schedule. That to me is not a good thing for business, as a few times I have passed here and they are closed when in fact they should be open.

1.description: Fantastic tacos. Makes you feel like you're back in Mexico in a taco stand en la vecindad. Chabelo makes you feel at home.

0.description: Tacos are great! They toast the tortillas just enough for a good crunch. Salsas are very good. They give you grilled onions and jalapeños with your order.. All so very tasty .. Not too hard to find, they've set up a tent outside of Mariscos Luis which is also yum! Just drive by and the smell of the meat on the grille will pull you in. Nothing like having some tacos outside on a summer night surrounded by people from everywhere sharing their stories from back home Mexico. Awesome vibe!!

1.description: STAY AWAY!!! This place is laughable at best. It's dirty. It's dark. It's overpriced. When you walk in, you feel like you're in a dungeon. Except you have to pay a cover fee. HahaSo $10 for the Mister and I to get in, fine, whatever. Nothing on tap. Wait, what? Isn't this a bar?? Umm alright. Two Coronas. $14. What. The. Heck? I've paid less for alcohol in Vegas!! The bouncer gave me a funny look because my license is from California and asked me 3827261736 questions about why I left. Then again, everyone does. The music was hilarious. 90's rap to house music and then cumbia!! Make up your mind. Some drunk guy (kudos baller for having the cash to get drunk here) was harassing the bouncers girlfriend despite her running around like a floozie with her ladies on display. The night ended with the club closing early and us having tamales from the makeshift cart outside. It's the next day and I'm not sick, so that's a win in my book!

2.description: I went her dancing with my girlfriend, nice variety of music, though at times the DJ did repeat songs? Mostly European crowd. Nice dance floor and plenty of tables and free street parking nearby. I will go back in the future for another fun night of dancing.

0.description: The club looks WAY better inside than you would think from it's outside face. Its pretty easy to find parking, and the bank across the street lets you park there. There are 2 bars, a pool table, darts, and a HUGE dance floor, along with plenty of nice seating. Thursday nights is a lesbian night, and it's always packed.  I had so much fun dancing to the DJs music! there are even drag shows and burlesque nights. the bartender, brenda, in the bar near the dancefloor is HOT and shes really nice. If you're looking for a spot to hang out on the southside, this is definitely a GREAT option!
Been waiting for this place to open up. We stopped in real quick to check it out one night. It was pretty clean for the most part, but seems the selections were only okay. Employees were nice.

28.description: Best pizza! Extremely delicious and a great place to visit when you are craving awesome food! Not only that, but they have something for everyone (salads, burgers, specialty dishes, etc). Angelo's goes the extra mile to make everyone feel at home. I have been loyal to this place since high school and cannot imagine going anywhere else. As soon as you step in you get a smile and prompt service. Always great food, good memories, and excellent customer service at Angelo's!

1.description: What happened? Picked up a large sausage and mushroom stuffed pizza and jalapeno poppers.Jalapeno Poppers - They make it with cheese, not cream cheese. They were meh.Sausage and Mushroom Stuffed Pizza - That yeast smell was more faint this time, but the crust was soggy. Barely any sausage or mushroom (didn't even taste any mushrooms). Too much sauce this time.

9.description: This place is a hidden gem!! The guy, who I believe is the owner, was the only person there when we visited and it was so refreshing to see food actually made with care. I debated back and forth between Italian beef (which is basically all I order) and their amazing looking pizza... Alas I ordered the beef and left the pizza to the husband. The beef was delish!! Super moist bread and the meat was well seasoned and tender. The pizza was also really good so no complaints there either. They also have a really well priced specials, something for everyone!

29.description: Hands down, best stuffed pizza I've had in Chicago! Wide selection of toppings available for the pizza and you can see the pizza being made !!

23.description: Stuffed pizza wasn't even good like the reviews say i guess people don't know what a good pizza taste like

5.description: Good, not great. As far as Chicago deep dish, not quite up there with Giordano's or Lou Malnati's but close. Came in today with my wife for the Groupon deal, a deep dish & free appetizer. The pizza had a nice flavor. Top was a little dry but it was packed well and flavorful. The employees were nice. Onion rings were good. I wouldn't mind coming back here in the future.

31.description: Gotta admit, asOne of the YELP elite, I had a great time eating theirStuffed Pizza. Not bad at all. I mean, I am a Giordano's kind of stuffed pizza guy, but this one really wasn't bad. And with a nice cold beverage and jalapenos. OH MY WORD! Try them out and see for yourself.

25.description: I've been coming here since H.S and this place never disappoints. You have to definitely try the stuffed pizza  one of the best on the Southside.

12.description: We had a Groupon for a large stuffed pizza and an appetizer.  The food was tasty. The presentation, not so much. The person behind the counter that took our order came off as rude, but I don't think she meant to be. She was probably just awkward and needs some work on her "people skills". The restaurant itself isn't much to look at, either. The paint on the wall is peeling, the windows looked dirty, the tables and chairs are all mismatched, and there was a mop bucket just hanging out by one of the tables, along with a framed painting resting against the wall on the floor. Overall, I'd probably just drive the same length in the opposite direction to Lou Malnati's.

21.description: Hands down!!! We had the beef and Giadiniera Famous Stuffed Pizza. Pizza was delicious, the owner & staff are very welcoming. Making this my new pizza place!!!

16.description: Ordered some slices of pizza and an order or wings. Horrible service, the girl at the register, even the cook came to the front and was rude to us. Like they were annoyed that we were asking questions about the menu. I used to work at restaurants so I don't like to give ppl hard times, but these guys were just rude for no apparent reason to me. The pizza was ok, crust sucked. The wings were undercooked and bloody. The sauce even sucked. Waste of money, there are a bunch of way better places in the area I'd rather give my business to.

17.description: Drove all the way from the western suburbs to try their stuffed pizza. Was definitely not disappointed! Was one if the best stiffed pizza we ever tasted. The service we received was excellent. Enjoyed talking with them.

10.description: Have been coming here since High School the pizza is great! They have recently changed things on their menu  I've had different things Iv never tried before & I have to say big improvement & great new additions all around! Hard to find parking but great neighborhood place!

11.description: Really delicious pizza! Found this little gem in a hurry around  on our way to watch the Blackhawks game! Delivery was on time despite the flooding and the demand of pizza that night! We will be re-ordering again! Add this to your list peeps!

26.description: Stopped in based on reviews and location suggested by yelp, and I have to say I wasn't disappointed. We ordered a "famous" stuffed pizza with pepperoni and while the wait was the typical 45 minutes or so the pizza was worth it. A perfectly golden, crispy crust, and a savory sauce to top it off! This place loses a star just because the environment isn't extremely dine-in friendly. The only beverages offered are bottle with a small selection of fountain drinks (not sure on free refills), and the guy who takes your order also makes your pizza. But, overall - service is very friendly and food is tasty!

27.description: Best Pizza in Chicago!!! Great customer service. Been coming here since I was in high school!! One of my favorites pepperoni, jalapeños and gyro meat!!!

0.description: This place can honestly give Giordanos a run for its money. Since I've moved to the area my usual place is on 55th but I may start to frequent this place Thanks to a Groupon. Even without the Groupon this place is super affordable, less than Giordanos and just as good a pizza. We ordered the breaded mushrooms which were ok. Nothing spectacular-- I've had better but definitely not bad. The Pizza was delicious! Yummy gooey cheese, the crust was the perfect thickness and the sauce was full of flavor. It had a good helping of toppings, a slightly uneven portion of pepperoni over sausage but still delicious. Overall a really good spot for some deep dish pizza.

20.description: Good, not great. As far as Chicago deep dish, not quite up there with Giordano's or Lou Malnati's but close. Came in today with my wife for the Groupon deal, a deep dish & free appetizer. The pizza had a nice flavor. Top was a little dry but it was packed well and flavorful. The employees were nice. Onion rings were good. I wouldn't mind coming back here in the future.

19.description: Stuffed pizza wasn't even good like the reviews say i guess people don't know what a good pizza taste like

2.description: In order to have a stuffed-pizza feast, I would have to fast the entire day.  Well, options at my mall food court are very limited.  However, the beauty of living in Chicago is that food is abundant, both north and south sides.  After work, I made a phone call to Angelo's, on S. Pulaski in the Archer Heights neighborhood, reserving our spinach & mushroom stuffed pizza.  Luckily, Groupon saved us a few bucks.  Almost one (1) hour after the courtesy call, we have arrived at the destination with no difficulty with street parking near S. Pulaski and 49th.  Oh by the way, friends.  Don't expect Angelo's to be a luxurious, commercial place like Lo* Mal*ati's.  There's no high-end leather seats, high thread-counts tablecloths, and extensive wine-lists.  If you're a street-tough Chicagoan like myself, you won't mind seeing some Chicago city flags, Chicago Bulls autograph featuring the famous #23, and Chicago Bears memorabilia.  On a side note, would you mind keeping a secret that I'm actually a Green Bay's fan?  Please don't "stone" me with my stuffed pizza if some kind of animosity is present.  The Groupon deal called for an appetizer and one (1) large two (2)-topping stuffed pizza.  Our appetizer, jalapeño poppers, were decent.  As we were munching these bad boys, the young man informed us that our pizza was ready.  Ok, please bring it on!The funny thing was their stuffed pizza wasn't that delicious after the first bite.  There was a "baker's yeast" after-taste.  For some reason, I was used to it and finished two (2) pieces in the end.  Hubby and I prefer our usual place (The Art of Pizza) on the north side, but we both agree that Angelo's stuffed pizza is affordable and portioned generously!  Post-Groupon cost turned out to be $7 and some change, with a appetizer, a large two (2) toppings stuffed pizza, and one (1) bottle of pineapple Jarritos.I believe the presence of Angelo's serves the neighborhood well.  Hubby and I had a pleasant experience dining in here, and Angelo will give me a morning call with their pizza tomorrow morning as well (the power of leftovers)!

18.description: I called and immediately told them I had a groupon I was placed on hold ,so I called from my house phone they answered right away they took my call no hold time ( remember I'm still on hold on my cell ) This time I decided to mention my groupon last ,at that time he told me it would be a hour and 15 minutes but groupon clearly states 40 minutes .I get there my pizza was ready I get home and the pizza wasn't worth the gas I wasted to pick it up.too much bread ,not enough meat .I was thinking it will be along the lines of uno or giordanos, but it couldn't even hold a candle to Pizza Hut.  Oh by the way they never picked line back up ...

13.description: I finally went to this place because I was craving pasta. My son had fallen asleep in the car so we were going to order and take it to go. We ended up staying after all. When the waitress came to take our order I asked for a chicken Alfredo and she tells me they've been out of pasta for 2 days womp womp womp. I didn't even know what to order so I got a breaded chicken sandwich. My husband got a beef sandwich. I was so disappointed about the pasta that we asked for the foot to go. We waited for more than half an hour and I was starting to get antsy. We finally get our food and come home. Not to take away from the food though which was great. The chicken was a nice sized breast and delicious. I would give them a second chance just to redeem themselves but 1st experience was not outstanding.

4.description: If I had to choose between having no stuffed pizza, and pizza from Angelo's, I'd choose Angelo's. Not exactly a high bar. I just didn't like it nearly as much as Chicago's Best led me to believe I would. When it comes to stuffed pizza, crust is key. And Angelo's crust is, in the words of Peter Griffin, "shallow and pedantic". I can't handle this much crust when it's as flavorless as they make if here. They need to butter that shit up or something. Incorporate some olive oil, and few grains or sea salt on dat ass. Real talk. Everything else was okay. I could have used a little more cheese and meat. The sauce is decent. Nowhere near on the same level as pie pimps like Art of Pizza, Lou Malnati's, Pat's, & Ricobene's. For a place that centralizes stuffed pizza, a weak crust game debased my hopes of really liking them.

24.description: This place is a hidden gem!! The guy, who I believe is the owner, was the only person there when we visited and it was so refreshing to see food actually made with care. I debated back and forth between Italian beef (which is basically all I order) and their amazing looking pizza... Alas I ordered the beef and left the pizza to the husband. The beef was delish!! Super moist bread and the meat was well seasoned and tender. The pizza was also really good so no complaints there either. They also have a really well priced specials, something for everyone!

6.description: Found this gem on the southside after going to a Sox game 'cause we were looking for a Stuffed Pizza place. After looking it up on Yelp!, I realized that I  had seen it on Chicago's Best TV show. When we got there we saw a coupon for dine in or carry out which was for a 16in. XL stuffed pizza w/ one topping and a 2 Lt. pop bottle for $19.99. That deal was a no-brainer for us. The pizza was delicious. Their was plenty of sauce and cheese on it. We had it w/ garlic and they were big pieces of it in the pizza. The sauce was slightly sweet but not bad or anything and light in salt. It was a win win situation for us. I would def. recommend this restaurant. Service was fine and prices were reasonable. Check it out.

22.description: Taking a trip across the country from NJ, had to stop in Chicago to try the pizza. Really good pizza and the Bella stuffed pizza is a must try!

15.description: I've been coming here since H.S and this place never disappoints. You have to definitely try the stuffed pizza  one of the best on the Southside.

7.description: Pizza- Was ok.. The bread smelt kinda over fermented We ordered two toppings bell peppers & onions but there were hardly any peppersService - Bad. 1.5 hour after placing the order over the phone, we received a call from saying they are out of jalapeno poppers cause they are out of them.. Makes me feel they dont give importance to people using groupon..

8.description: Pretty darn good pizza!I came across this place through Groupon, and I decided to go for it and try something new. I had ZERO PROBLEMS placing an order the same day I bought the Groupon. The parking is a little iffy since it is located on a busy large street and there are a ton of other businesses around there. I ordered the pizza, fries and wings for a party of 5 and everyone loved the food! The staff is quick and pleasant, and the food is delicious. I definitely plan on going back!

30.description: Great food, great prices, great people.must try the stuffed pizza, (call ahead takes about 45 ) their chicken parmesan chicken is mouthwayering, ask for coupons.. they have a great variety !!

3.description: I'll give this place two stars for having a really cheap Groupon deal. However, the pizza wasn't great. It had their thin crust pan pizza and their breaded mushrooms. The food was okay, nothing more I can say about it. Perhaps, their deep dish pizza is better, I don't know. We live in Bridgeport so it was a trek to drive out that way to grab a pizza and breaded mushrooms that were just okay.

14.description: Used a groupon from them yesterday. I ordered a large stuffed pizza and the poppers. The pizza was AWFUL. The sauce they used was disgusting. The only thing worth eating was the poppers. The guy that took my order was rude on the phone and when I went to pick my pizza up, be took a good 5 minutes before he even acknowledged me. They weren't busy at all, there was only one young man at the counter, so there's no excuse. I will never go back to them. Now I see why they are on groupon. They have to drum up customers some how.

58.description: OMG~my favorite cheeseburger!!!!!! I am in love and can't wait to go back. I almost passed the place up; I'm sure I've driven by it a thousand times and never noticed it was there! I was happy to see they had free parking. The bar inside looks nicer than the outside. lol The waitress was friendly and attentive and the environment was relaxing. I could barely get through half my burger, but my son somehow ate all of his. I regret not taking a picture~13 ounces~wow!!! Pure, meaty, greasy goodness. YUM!I was laughing reading someone's review complaining about having to order your sides separately. Big deal~this place is cheap & a great value for your money. Go today!

56.description: I have not been in this place since around 1995. There not a thing changed from the Green River on tap to the enormous cheeseburger.This is one place that every Chicagoan who things he/she knows cheeseburgers needs to go. The quality is of the highest level imaginable with fresh and delicious food prepared with loving hands.The service is impeccable - smiling and attentive.The original owner - Frank - takes great pride in what he does and he does it well.When the trendy/hip little papers like Redeye and New City chat up cool joints - they never seem to get south of Cermak Road. You have to really explore - color out of the lines if you will. Seek out the best. Illinois bar and Grill is one of the best cheeseburgers in Chicago. Add a basket of fries and a Green River on tap and you cannot go wrong.

29.description: You have to have the burger. THE burger!!!!! It's huge and tastes really good. I think they said 13 ounces. The bar is sort of your local neighborhood bar but with a kick ass kitchen. The regulars are really friendly. Parking is easy but I'm here but I'm here on a Thursday. I know so many people that stop here when it's out of there way. I had to try it out.

42.description: 5 Guys Who!? IBG located on the southside of Chicago is my new spot for heart-attack fantastic tasting cheeseburgers - keep in mind I'm from f-ing Indiana so we don't have too many places like this. The exterior/interior is not special but who cares when you can get a great tasting burger. Also, the service got the job done - I rarely had an empty glass of beer. They had many choices on tap if you're into beer.If I don't have a heart-attack anytime soon as a result of eating this magnificant burger, I'll be back...

23.description: Love the burgers, always hit the spot. Decent fries. Good salads. Over all the food is good here in general. I highly recommend this spot. Not to much of a beer guy not sure how tap beer is here, when I do drink beer here is corona so kinda hard to mess up a bottle beer. Good price on the liquor and beer.  It's a little dark but good atmosphere, the service is good depending on whose the waiter/waitress of the day. They do need to fix the ac or crank it up, does get muggy in there. Other than that love the spot.

47.description: I'll bump my rating up since I've been back 2 more times.The second time I came back with a friend. She ordered a regular burger and I opted for the bacon burger. We also ordered cheese fries. I think the bacon burger is the way to go. She seems to like the cheese fries, I still think they are ok. This time the burgers were bigger and greasier. Service was friendlier also.Just went today again and we split a regular burger and got the cheese fries. I also ordered the zucchini sticks. Burger was good and not as greasy. Zucchini sticks were ok, but use the ranch sauce as the red sauce is some type of Pace Salsa. Service was really good too.Get the bacon burger. The saying is true....bacon makes everything taste better. Since you eating here, I doubt you are counting calories, so why not just indulge and make it worth while.I guess the first time was a fluke as I noticed the last two times, it was a different cook and server than the first time. I have to say, pace yourself, it's a heart attack meal here.

8.description: Root Beer I ordered was flat. Asked for a plain burger, teenage kid working the kitchen put ketchup and mustard on it. Very disappointed as I was starving by the time it finally came out the kitchen. I asked for cheese and onions only on the burger. He only put a tiny dollop of grilled onions on a corner of the sandwich. I like onions a lot, so I was pretty disappointed. Zucchini sticks were so greasy I could not eat. Burger was decent though overcooked. I think the kid just did not know how to cook. I hope management can bring this up.

31.description: Great burgers...I can only eat half. They are handmade burgers, which is not common many places. There used to be a Taylor St location and the burgers were bigger there but they are thicker at the 47th st location. I will be back.

34.description: Both the food and service sucked! I guess it's good if you want to wait an hour and a half to get your food or get any service at all.

16.description: I'll bump my rating up since I've been back 2 more times.The second time I came back with a friend. She ordered a regular burger and I opted for the bacon burger. We also ordered cheese fries. I think the bacon burger is the way to go. She seems to like the cheese fries, I still think they are ok. This time the burgers were bigger and greasier. Service was friendlier also.Just went today again and we split a regular burger and got the cheese fries. I also ordered the zucchini sticks. Burger was good and not as greasy. Zucchini sticks were ok, but use the ranch sauce as the red sauce is some type of Pace Salsa. Service was really good too.Get the bacon burger. The saying is true....bacon makes everything taste better. Since you eating here, I doubt you are counting calories, so why not just indulge and make it worth while.I guess the first time was a fluke as I noticed the last two times, it was a different cook and server than the first time. I have to say, pace yourself, it's a heart attack meal here.

13.description: Get it to go. Burgers and fries are really good. Service, not so much. It could also be a little cleaner.

11.description: The service sucks. Good food and drinks,  but you waste at least 15-20 minutes of your life before you even see a waitress. Once you finally get your food you're good. But the service sucks. It's better if you get up and leave your food to walk up to the bar to get a drink,  refill,  or  if you're smart you just get a bucket. The service sucks.

39.description: Pretty cool hood bar with good food.I have been there a few times and in my most recent, I was there with a friend and coincidentally the Black Hawks were playing that day.Burger, chicken wings, fries and a couple of beers. Chicken wings are huge and I've never been a huge fan of them but they were highly recommeded by a friend. They were actually pretty good. they fries are really good and the burgers even better. I need to go here more often.The vibe was super relaxed and that is exacly what I needed that day. The service is ok comaprable to bars of the kind.IBG, relaxed vibe, good food and chill service

37.description: I have found my favorite burger spot! we had hot wings, burgers, chicken strips, fries and fried zucchini. everything was delicious! i wont be at hooters or five guys anymore. As far as service, our waitress was very nice.

0.description: As usual my coworkers and I were hungry and looking for food. A coworker mentioned stopping by this place and really enjoying their burgers, so we figured why not try it out.Walking in, we were told we could sit whereever and the server would be with us. The bar was pretty empty (as expected), so we took our time and laughed as episodes of Maury played in the background. Looking over the menu, everything was straight to the point! Most of us ended up getting the signature 13 ounce burger and a few ordered the 1/3. We decided to also split two baskets of fries!After about 15-20 minutes, the food came out and looked absolutely delicious! The burger, fries and green river were the perfect combination!The food :The burger was grilled to perfection!The bacon was thick and crispy and added the perfect flavorFries were amazingly delicious and they give a LOT!DEFINITELY worth the priceThe service:The waitress was super attentive and friendly!Refills came without even asking!The menu was really simple so not much explanation easy needed even though she offeredNeedless to say we all left stuffed, and will definitely be back for more

38.description: place is nice to catch a game and have a drink .very chill and laid back.burgers made of cheap highest fat quality beef but are great for a hangover (very greasy)but dont skip the bacon (if youre gonna do it , do it right). Fries are good but its hard to mess fries up ..service is the worst..never been waited by such a depressing staff...and the wait time is horrible how long does it take to flip a meat patty and put it in bread...matter of fact im still waiting...

51.description: Great burgers! Fries are amazing! If only I was 21 for beer haha but other wise love it

27.description: This is my neighborhood beer and burger place.  I get the "baby burger" and it's just the right size.  I don't love their fries-they are soggy, especially when you get take out.  However, the onion rings are crisp and delicious.  They recently added more variety to their menu, which makes it easier for a big/diverse group.  I wish they had some better beers on tap-like maybe something from Goose Island.  I general, it is a chill place to grab a burger and a beer.

32.description: Service a lil slow but beer is always cold and food is excellent! Burgers are da best!

54.description: Met up with a few friends here. They recommended it, so I went to see for myself. Must say, the burgers were really good. I was the first to finish it, and I'm usually the slower one of the bunch. Fries were good. Chili was awesome! The waittress was very friendly. She talked and joked around which made it an even better experience. Definitely one place I would like to come back to.

48.description: Great food, good prices on beer, and good looking servers. And to the person who said it takes long for the food. Have you seen the size of the burger patties? Unless you want raw food, chillax and wait =P

44.description: 4.5 StarsA little dark?...yes  A little dingy?.....sure  Amazingly humongous, delicious, bacon loaded hamburgers that will absolutely change your life and how you view hamburgers from that day forward?  Absolutely!You'll probably feel a little out of place when you go in IBG, it not often very crowded during the day, and its normal crowd is more bar type dweller rather then Yelping burger hound looking to add a new spot to their "Best Burgers in the Biz" List for their profile.  But don't let that deter you.  Bring a friend, sit in back, and order one of the greatest burgers you'll have.  It will be greasy, it should have bacon on it, and they can pile on the grilled onions if that's your thing.  The burger itself is a meal all in its own, but you can get some fries too, because hey, whats a burger without fries?  And oh my the bacon, it's delicious cooked to perfection, and in bountiful quantities on your burger.  Prices are super reasonable too.Definitely try it out!P.S. They also have a location in Midway Airport so you can give it a try if your a traveler and want a little better ambiance.

24.description: Was craving burgers and this was nearby so I gave it a try. The atmosphere is casual and welcoming, the wait staff was accommodating, and the burgers were amazing! The onion rings were probably the most crispy that I have ever had. The only thing was that their menu options were pretty small, but since they are known for burgers, that is understandable. So, if you are craving awesome burgers, give them a try!

7.description: My gf and I came with family Wednesday afternoon to hang out and have some appetizers. Illinois bar and grill has been a burger institution for many years here in the archer heights neighborhood. So that being said if you want to try a BIG delicious 13 oz. burger that u might have trouble finishing in one sitting, this is the place you need to come to. Just ask for the famous Chicago burger.FYI burgers and sandwiches here do not come with fries so that will be extra. Also if you want to add american, cheddar, or swiss cheese to your burger it will be an extra .75 cents, and $2.00 if you want bacon on them. My gf and I shared the chicken strips, which were big but ok to me but she liked them. They do come with fries, bbq sauce and honey mustard sauce. This place does get crowded on game days and on weekend nights as they close late. I do recommend trying one of these BIG delicious burgers for yourself. I ended up buying 2 to go that night for family members to enjoy. They are open M-F 10-2 a.m./ Sat. 10-3 a.m./ Sun. 10-12 a.m.

49.description: I don't give a lot of four star reviews because the vast majority of places are just as good as the other places doing that type of food. That may mean that a place is very good but is in a class of very good competitors.  So how does a place that does burgers with so many other places that do burgers and do them well outshine those other places? Well;1) By having an unusual patty like the Illinois at 13 ounces of proprietary blended beef pressed by a machine to a wide circle that crisps up at the edges as it sears on the flattop and shrinks to form a delicious circle of goodness.2) By topping all burgers with their own style of grilled onions.3) By adding the condiments while on the grill to cook them a little and turn the whole package into a succulent cohesive whole.The Illinois does it different and does it better. Go.

40.description: This place was a mistake. We ordered burgers and a basket of fries. The burgers were good. The bartender was not keen to service. It took 5 minutes to get a two drinks the first time and longer than that for our second round. She was happy to serve anyone she knew before me. The burgers came out and the guy said fried would be there in a second. I asked for mayo also. Five minutes later, I went to the bar and asked for the fires and mayo. Still no dice. However, the other three orders I watched go out in the mean time, all had fries. It has been a few years since I've been to a place that upholds the stereotypical treat non-southsiders like crap. This place keeps up with old Chicago traditions. Unless you're a regular here, you should probably avoid it.Chicago's Best was dead wrong on this place.

53.description: The half-pound cheeseburger at Illinois Bar deserves all the awards it has won. It is spectacularly good and, believe me, needs no fries along with it to fill you up.  The beef tastes like ground sirloin and the kitchen always cooks it right. It is simply THE BEST ANYWHERE.

30.description: Best meal you will find In the airport.  If you have time get the wings!!!If it's early you have to get the breakfast.  The pancakes (order a single pancake unless you've got lots of help) are heavenly and the bacon is the best I've had outside of what I special order for myself.  Portions are huge.

46.description: This place failed health inspections in March and a few weeks ago. Disgusting!!

1.description: Discussing placeThe cook was't wearing a hair net while coocking my burger and pitcher had all this dirt on the top part as if it wasn't washed. When i complained to the bartender she said "well I can show you they are all like that and no one complains"

55.description: WTF is wrong with you people? This burger was on par with McDonald's, nothing more.  Definitely nothing claim worthy whatsoever.  Cheap? Perhaps.  Good?  Not really.

9.description: Best burger in the south side of Chicago!!!Everything is on point!!!Def worth the trip to this place...

25.description: This is one of my go to places for a beer and a good burger. That being said don't get anything from the tap. That stuff is funky every time I have asked for something from tap.

12.description: It's a pretty chill spot with amazing burgers. Try the bacon burger with fries. You will not be disappointed with the flavor or size. I give it 4 stars only because once in a while I do take out and every time I've gotten my fries they are too crispy and I have to throw about half away. What I started doing now is mentioning it and checking the order at the time of pick up. If you're looking for a night out with friends this is the place.

59.description: See if Frank the owner is there... he will pour a pint for you.  Get your burger with grilled onions and feast!  The best meal you will eat.

21.description: Best burger in the south side of Chicago!!!Everything is on point!!!Def worth the trip to this place...

17.description: Speed of service is hit or miss but always polite. Crowd is diverse enough and there are plenty of TVs playing various sports.  Nothing special but hits the spot for this part of town.

10.description: Honestly the Best Burgers of all time! Now I know that is a pretty bold statement but they are Awesome. This place has been around since I was a kid. I remember the burgers being huge! Now I don't know if they have shrank or if I just got older but either way they are still Amazing!!
