I usually get the baby burger with grilled onions, bacon and cheese.  Have I mentioned how amazing these burgers are?!? LOL The fries are pretty great as well,  hand cut nice and crispy.  You can't go wrong with IBG it's a typical bar atmosphere, the bartenders are great and very friendly. You gotta try this place!

5.description: Went here on a recommendation of our hotel. Place is known for their burgers and did not disappoint!! Great Chicago Burger very reasonable prices for burgers and beer. My 16 year old was equally impressed by the burger. Would definitely recommend to others.

3.description: Great neighborhood spot for a burger and beer.  Wonderful staff, friendly patrons.

35.description: got the bacon cheese burger , fries , and a order of wings..the bacon cheese burger is pretty good and it's nice and juicy!the fries i could of done without.. there was TONS of small little pieces like its from the bottom of the bag...the wings was pretty decent.. got a good kick to it!dint mind coming back here for the cheese burger tho! its worth the trip!

19.description: Pretty cool hood bar with good food.I have been there a few times and in my most recent, I was there with a friend and coincidentally the Black Hawks were playing that day.Burger, chicken wings, fries and a couple of beers. Chicken wings are huge and I've never been a huge fan of them but they were highly recommeded by a friend. They were actually pretty good. they fries are really good and the burgers even better. I need to go here more often.The vibe was super relaxed and that is exacly what I needed that day. The service is ok comaprable to bars of the kind.IBG, relaxed vibe, good food and chill service

28.description: Great food, good staff and overall great experience. Just please please fix or get ac in there. Saw people sweating at the bar.

45.description: These just may be the best burgers and wings you will ever have. The wings are full and meaty. The burgers are fresh and perfect. (always throw bacon on them). The price is even better. They always have a special going on and the employees will remember you after going in a few times. You won't be disappointed here. It is definitely a dive bar so no worries about dressing up or a cover or anything. They have a ton of beer on tap too, including modelo which is hard to find on tap.

33.description: wait time is too long, small burgers, very greasy. Immediately felt gross after eating it.

43.description: If you like a good burger this is the place you need to be. The bacon cheeseburger...sigh...typing that just gave me a fat boy flashback. The burger was great this was my second time meeting the burger and both times it didn't disappoint. Not real crowded but I did go in the afternoon and people were coming in as I was leaving. It has a nice atmosphere. When I was leaving I glanced over at another customer an saw that he had the chicken wings so now I have to go back and try them out. I really wasn't blown away with the service though. The bartender/server really wasn't on top of her game we had to ask numerous times to get salt and pepper and water that we never received. In her defense I think that she had too many customers spread out around the place she needed a little help. Other than that they would have got 5 stars. Keep up the good work!

2.description: There are a few things I just can't say no to, pizza, an old fashion, a burger and fries, hookers and blow, you know, the "essentials" in life.  So when I was in the area for work and was told Illinois Bar & Grill has the *best* burgers I had to check it out.  Illinois Bar & Grill is what you might call a dive bar.  It's definitely got some history and charm.  We ordered a few sides and appetizers that were all good, your typical bar food; fried and tasty.  You can get either a "small" burger here, which is still more than enough food, or you can get a 13 oz burger.  I don't think I could eat a 13 oz burger over the course of 24 hours.  So I didn't try to do it at lunch with clients.  The small burger I did get was good. Best in the country?  I don't think so.  But still good.  If I were in the area again (which I most likely will be sooner or later) and I needed to be fed I might end up at Illinois Bar & Grill again.  I won't be going out of my way though.  Want to eat a burger the size of your head?  This is the place for you.

18.description: Was craving burgers and this was nearby so I gave it a try. The atmosphere is casual and welcoming, the wait staff was accommodating, and the burgers were amazing! The onion rings were probably the most crispy that I have ever had. The only thing was that their menu options were pretty small, but since they are known for burgers, that is understandable. So, if you are craving awesome burgers, give them a try!

41.description: Horrible service. If they mess up your order, you send it back, and don't want a remake, the will still charge you. No supervisor/manager working. Server never checks on her tables unless you are doing the wave. Four customers lost. Never again!!

52.description: From the outside it looks like any other dive bar in the neighborhood. On the inside they have cozy, clean and friendly atmosphere with benches, tall boys, pool table, juke box and....AMAZING BURGERS! I'm serious, you would not expect burgers from a place like this to be that good but they are! They still run like a small bar and scrumptious burgers aren't done in 2minutes so you may have to be patient.  Go there, have a drink and definitely have a burger.

50.description: Burger, beer and appetizers r the best . Better than 5guys & Epic for 1/2 the price

4.description: This place is good for a burger and a beer. The chicken tenders are also pretty good. If you're looking for an average place to watch a game and have some food and drinks then give this place a try.

6.description: Nasty old patty for my baby burger. Yuck I can still remember the nasty taste. You can tell when meat has been in the fridge for too long yucky. Smh everything should be fresh.

22.description: Well, I went there exactly a week ago. I just recently turned 21 on the 11th and I decided to go get a beer and a burger and what's convinient is that it's two blocks away from my house. So upon arriving, I scanned the place and it was cozy. I sat on the wooden booths that are located immediately on the left upon entering the establishment. I waited roughly 5 minutes if not a little bit less and got greeted by a fairly young looking lady. She was very friendly, so I asked for a menu and got it. The menu seems a bit different than the one that's available online. So around 5 minutes into looking at the menu she came back and asked if I was ready. And I got their famous Chicago burger or whatever it's called with bacon and a side of fries and a corona. I got the corona right away and it was nice and cold with a lime wedge. It did take quite a bit to get my order but there was a lot of people who ordered prior to my arrival. It took around 15-20 minutes but it's no biggie. I really don't care as long as I get my order correct. So once I got it, my jaw dropped. It was humongous! And the fries looked delicious. Now, at the time I got my order one really polite chick came to give me my order. She was also fairly polite and amicable. This was literally one of the best burgers I've had. The fries are good. But the burger. Wow. My end total was roughly $20.80 and I gave 15% tip. So it wasn't that bad. 4$ per corona. The only thing that I didnt find attractive which is why I didn't give it full stars is the fact that small children are around an adult environment and the fact that neither one of the servers/bartenders asked for an ID when I requested liquor. They can have that establishment closed if they continue to do that regardless how old someone looks and that would be a huge disappointment to have it closed because of something like that. Other than that I will be going on occasion when I'm carving a hamburger that can satisfy my craving for a good month. (Jk)

15.description: Still the best burger on the south side . Still very neighborhoody, great food cold beer , and casual environment.

57.description: My last to visits have been disappointments.This place suffers from a corporate mentality.  They have tried things like a metered pouring system for draft beers.  This may be OK if you are getting some lite,  but if you are the first fool in a week to order Sam Adams (which is likely)  you will get warm,  over fermented swill. The fries are still the best in Chicago hands down.The service is lackluster,  when I lived down the street there was a Polish Duo that always took the best of care of me.  I haven't seen one of the woman in a while.  The other,  seems to be zombified.  Many times in the past I have had a trainee or new server,  they were always eager,  but within a week or so they either quit or hated the place.  I am sure there is a serious management issue.If you are nearby there is a great chance of getting a great burger and fries.  This is certainly not a destination place anymore.

20.description: This place deserves 0 stars!! Their service is BEYOND HORRIBLE!! This place is the perfect example for hiring trash... The waitress and the cook have HORRENDOUS attitudes, the type of people that go in there are just ghetto!!!  Burgers are excellent, I give them that, but I will NEVER step a foot in there!!  The place is dirty and so are the tables.

36.description: Awesome place for a burger and beer, classic American hole in the wall. Staff was friendly

14.description: Great food and cheap prices!! I love the music they play as well. The only complaint I have is that the restaurant seems very understaffed and dirty. No bus boys in sight and customers have to clear their own table before sitting down... As much as I like the food and atmosphere I am a waitress myself and I don't appreciate having to bus my own table and sit with a bunch of garbage on the floor.

1.description: Cleaned up my beard and made sharp lines.  Moo did it without Larry or Curly's help.    Hahaha. I would come back for sure.  $10

9.description: Mike is the best on the Southside.  His attention to detail is unlike any other. He is a Pro!

23.description: These guys are solid!!  Professional and really know what they are doing. Prices are great and they are open 7days a week and open late.  Have been coming religiously the last few months. Can't go wrong.

12.description: I've been getting a haircut by mike for a long time now and he's the best. The haircut is always amazing and the atmosphere is just as good. The service is outstanding and I definitely recommend trying this barber shop out.

21.description: great barber. very nice guy.  very professional. knows what hes doing.

16.description: Mike is great ! Great vibe unlike some other barber shops.. Ha!  Clean Fresh Fades, Been coming to him since he first opened ,very versatile Barber he can pretty much do anything you are looking for I change my hairstyle every time I come in.. When it comes to Barbers I AM VERY PICKY!!! As well as the other Barbers Moe and Kal if Mike is not available I trust them as well, Great location too ! Right next to a bar if you have to wait a min... Ha!

17.description: These guys are solid!!  Professional and really know what they are doing. Prices are great and they are open 7days a week and open late.  Have been coming religiously the last few months. Can't go wrong.

10.description: Well, as my rating indicates, I am a big fan of Mike and his place.  I discovered it while staying with a family member for several months while on disability.  I did a search for places on my phone but found this while walking down 95th street.  I am so glad I did.  Extremely friendly place with some quality hairstylists.  Plus, you have a whole range of services to keep up on your grooming needs.  Mike has given me many precision haircuts that grew out quite nicely.  The main reason I ended up there, however, was to get a nice trim and shave of my facial hair.  My right arm was under strict orders to be held stationary and I just could not get a clean shave to my liking with my left arm only.  I called the shop and spoke to Mike on the phone and he was already extremely welcoming. When I entered the shop, it was very modern and clean.  Again, very friendly staff and Mike was extremely engaging.  A true gentleman and interested in meeting my needs.  He ended up giving me the cleanest shave I think I have ever had and a great haircut.  I was impressed by the services.  Over the following months, I made it a point to visit him every few weeks and along the way, he introduced me to a steam shave.  I loved it.  I have to say, he spoiled me with these great shaves and I always enjoyed our conversations during our sessions.  Mike also introduced me to one of his facial sessions.  One of his other staff members gave me set of great treatments that left my face feeling, younger, fresher and smoother than when I walked in.  It was fantastic.  I miss being in Oak Lawn and have gone a few times from where I live close to the inner city.  Let me tell you this.  It is certainly worth the trip.  Not only are you getting expert services, you are getting them at great prices and with a very capable staff in an engaging and inviting environment.   I highly recommend Style 95.

5.description: I live in Denver Colorado but come here for the haircuts. No lie. No joke. I just flew into town last night, but I'm going there tonight to get the best fade haircut in the entire country.  Mike always makes you feel at home and I would highly recommend this place to anyone looking for an amazing haircut. See you tonight Mike!

11.description: I got my haircut with Mike the owner and I thought he did a great job. My hair is really thick and I think that's given other barbers trouble. I got a gentlemen's cut and I'm really picky about how straight my blend on the sides are and Mike really listened to me on that. The guy really seems to know what he's doing and as long as you make it clear to him what you want, he'll listen. Ask him for his advice too if you're unsure about what you want. $15 for a cut, straight razor on the edges, and shampoo. I'll definitely be coming back while I'm in Chicago.

22.description: Good barbers, friendly and good atmosphere, makes you wanna come back highly recommend

0.description: Wow mike really knows how to sculpt some hair. Strangely for my gentleman's style cut I was searching for months maybe even years to locate a hair stylist to give me the look I truly wanted. For all that time the previous places simply got the job done but nothing that I'd walk out of the store with any excitement. With machine precision, Mike tapered all facets of my sides to a perfect blend. I'd easily go back for another trim!

20.description: I'v been going there for a long time and I take my little one now, Great people very friendly and experience thumps up and highly recommended

19.description: Best barber shop with talented guys.  They pay great attention to detail.  Great price for the service that I got.  Great experience!

2.description: Mike is the greatest barber in all of Chicago land Area and then some. I been going to him since 2001 and had to see other barbers when I was away and that helps me appreciate his skill even that much more. I definitely trust him with my hair and he always delivers. Be sure to go to this place I never seen anyone leaving that place unsure or unhappy with what they paid for. Excellent customer service and very welcoming, cordial and inviting.

18.description: Good barbers, friendly and good atmosphere, makes you wanna come back highly recommend

13.description: Great barber shop, Mike makes you feel as if you're visiting friends instead of a place of business. always get an awesome cut...the conversations good and the other barbers are friendly as well. My son and I can go to the same barber and get exactly the cut we want...I recommend Style 95 Barber Shop in Oak Lawn, IL five stars! Keep up the great job fellas!

4.description: Great - thank you.Mike's customer service is absolutely excellent and the place is lovely. Clean and professional.Very competitive pricing.

6.description: Best Barber Shop you can find in the South suburbs.All the stylist are great!

15.description: I've been to this place twice.  Same barber, so my opinion may be bias and I'm black, so my review may be irrelevant. My hair cut only took 10 minutes, but when I left I noticed that my hair was uneven and had to return.  Later I recognized more inconsistencies in my hair that I had to attempt to fix myself.  I got what amounts to a military cut and beard trim at $25, you can decide whether or not you find that pricey.  I also tip and even though I have short hair, attention to detail is a very important attribute in a barber for me.

7.description: This was the worst cut of my life! I'm going to try and stay calm as I write this, but I can't guarantee it. Let's start off by saying that I had a very beautiful beard, the kind people would get jealous over. So I walk in sign in and sit the barber calls me up and I get in the chair I tell him "I like the length of my beard, I just want it cleaned up, I feel like my chin hair is just a little to long" what's the first freaking this he does... Takes more then half of it off in the first cut!!!!! I'm warning anyone with a nice long thick beard never ever ever go into this place!!! I don't grow my beard out for 6 months to have some stupid barber who can't listen to his client chop it off!!! I honestly wish I could give u a negative star and get your hair cutting license removed!! You lost a client and now you will have some who works with ppl all day warning them never to go to your business. Oh yeah I almost forgot to mention that when I left my neck was bleeding like crazy from his straight razor!  I got this yesterday and my neck still burns...

8.description: Clean, Comfortable, and Quick.  All great reasons to continue going to Style 95 Barber Shop.

3.description: Mike is a true pro. Great cut with high attention to detail.  Am definitely coming back!

14.description: The most professional and best hair cut experience I have ever received. Mike and his crew go all the way to make sure you leave with the style you want. Never seen so much dedication and focus from a stylist. If your a first timer or a regular, you are treated with upmost respect. Very classy! I will continue to go here for my gentleman style haircut. Thanks Style 95

1.description: Smelled like dirty feet and dirty dog when I walked in. I almost walked back out but I am cosmopolitan so I gave it a chance.   some chick with short hair cut my beard.  but she was very rude. first she would tell me let my hands move your head, then she would tell me to stop moving my head after I let her move it.  And she never used any lather or lubricant.she raw      dogged me.  I walked out feeling like my face got cut up in some bad prison movie.  Skip this place unless you like it rough. haha

0.description: Best barbershop I've ever been to! Edelia is very professional and will make sure your haircut is exactly as you want. There is always some music or a cool movie playing in the background which makes the experience more pleasant. I highly recommend to everyone to go check it out!!!

1.description: It's located inside the Super Mall, within a walking distance from the CTA Pulaski Orange Line station.Once you get inside of the Super Mall, head all the way to the very back.  Thrifty Tienda is a store formed by four (4) separate kiosks.  The store itself didn't have much to offer.  The setup almost resembled a yard sale in the neighborhood.  If you aren't happening to be at the Super Mall, it wouldn't be worth of your time and energy traveling all the way down to Archer Heights.  I don't consider this as a full-sized thrift store, as Unique, Village Discount, or Salvation Army.

2.description: I called on a Dresser that I liked.  I spoke with Grace over the phone.  She was the most pleasant person I think I have ever spoken with.  I was told the dresser was $400.  I scheduled a time to come take a look at it and something came up and I couldn't make it.The following week, I spoke with Grace and she remembered me.  She said "oh, yeah, is this Jay..."  I was real impressed.  I asked if she would take $300 for the dresser and she said.  "actually we just lowered the price to $250".I know a lot of people would have said "$300....Sure, you can buy it for $300."  But she was real honest in the price.  I really appreciated that.I got there and had the pleasure to meet Grace in person.  Very helpful and showed me the dresser.  I also got to meet Terry.  I don't say this often, but Terry is one of those guys that you meet and you just know he's a kind hearted guy.  He's got your best interests at in mind, not his own.  I brought my van to pickup the dresser and guess what....It wouldn't fit.So, what does Terry do?  He says, "where do you live?  I'll drive it to you!"I could not believe my ears, this guy was going to take a hour out of this day to drive this dresser back to my house for me.  He certainly did.  He would not accept any more money from me or for me to buy him lunch.  Terry goes above an beyond for his clients.I simply cannot wait to do business with them again!  Thank you Terry and Grace for your amazing dedication towards customer service and business ethics.  Being a business owner myself, I hope every transaction that we perform delivers the same experience that you have provided me.  Bravo Terry and Grace, Bravo!

0.description: I never really frequent the Super Mall of midway, however on a recent trip with a friend, I stumbled on this interesting thrift shop.It seem they are the biggest shop in the mall, due to various department store-like layout & eye catching knick-knacks displayed all around. Though I did not buy anything, I did speak with a friendly sales person who explained that they get new/gently used items in every week, & for the most part they are open to discounting their prices. Over all, this seems like a cool place to visit often, plus, they take debit/credit cards, which I think is the only store that does in the mall.

12.description: The place is ok but for some reason yesterday the counter guy was rushing me out. He really  wanted to go home no matter what. He messed up my order and would not stop arguing with me, he wanted to be right. I didn't want to argue, he kept approaching me to prove a point!

3.description: The food was great...orange chicken was the bomb....favorite spot on the southside to eat Chinese food so far....

1.description: This was my first time coming to this restaurant today after having passed by this place so many times driving in the area or going to the surrounding stores mainly Dollar Tree. I ordered an orange chicken with rice and crab rangoon. It was pretty good but the orange chicken could have used some extra sauce on it because it didnt taste like orange chicken without a smidge more sauce. I was kind of surprised when I came in and saw someone at a table breaking ends off edamame-if you don't know are underdeveloped soybeans that are used in asian cuisines they resemble string beans. You would think if you're preparing food you would be in the kitchen where it's clean not out at a table in plain view of customers preparing what could be served to customers. It was pretty quick since it was at the start of the dinner rush so people were coming in to eat and my food was made quickly and correctly which is what I like because I was getting ready to jump back on the train to go home and wanted to make sure my order was right and it was. I also liked how they didnt add MSG(Monosodium Glutamate) at my request because I am highly allergic to that stuff. Overall, the experience was a good one.

2.description: It was 9:43 pm and they told us we couldn't dine in because restaurant closes at 10pm. What!! Are you kidding me! A good resturant stays opened until your last costumer has left. There were two other families already dining in. Didn't get to try their food, nor will I come back due to bad customer service..too bad.

9.description: People on these sites are to harsh. I have ordered from this place regularly for over a year now and I love their food. They have great prices and large portions (especially for their lunch combinations . They do have a hard time understanding you one the phone when you order and I wouldn't suggest ordering with a card by phone since they did mess up once on me (although they fixed the problem right away). If your looking for good food at a good price give them a try.

10.description: A lot of the reviews are negative towards China Ho and  that's not the case China Ho offers the best Chinese food in the area.The owners are very nice hard working people trying to make living. The food here is cooked from the heart and offer a lots of goodies. This place simply is the best. PS-smoothies are the bomb!!

4.description: Absolutely love this place! Huge portions for a small price, super cheap especially during lunch! The servers are very friendly and they always thank everyone before leaving. Delicious authentic food, definitely recommend.

6.description: Walked in on a weeknight with my mom  there was only one other family there and the lady took 10 minutes to give us our tea and water. The menu items were quite pricey and when she finally came to take out order we were rushed and she was rude. I wanted to get an idea of how large the portion size was and if it would feed two people her response was, "Well I don't know how hungry you are"I tried to use my hands to get an idea and she snapped and said "Well it isn't huge!"Needless to say we decided to leave but wanted to pay for the tea. She wanted to charge us $3 and we'd only had a few sips sip, I left $2 and left. Never again.

15.description: not good at all! never eat here

0.description: I love this place! I went with my family  had the chicken, fried rice and orange chicken. (I sampled from others plates lol) everything was delicious and the waitress was so nice and sweet. She kept complimenting me and my outfit. I also recommend trying the oolong tea! Addicting!!!

5.description: The food is great! Each plate is about two serving. I love how they give you the option of tea. The atmosphere is dull. The owners are nice enough, but come in late and stay late and you'll be a little rushed. My new thing is the Mandarin Shrimp  I have been here about 3 times and will go again.

13.description: regular chinese place. Large portions for not that much money. Nice workers and some decent smoothies.

11.description: Wow. Well I was expecting a sub-par experience since our regular go-to Chinese place does not open on Mondays (Hong Kong on 55th/California) and yelp did not seem to favor this restaurant in terms of stars, but everything went better than expected. Food was fantastic and ehh decent prices. Portions are pretty big though. Waiters were very nice. They even gave us a strawberry/banana smoothie sample that tasted fabulous. I would def go again!

8.description: My family and I have been ordering from here for 5+ years and love the food. We've tried other places and they don't compare. The fried rice is the best. They also have Thai dishes now. The people working here are super nice. The food comes out in a timely manner. I would highly recommend!!

14.description: If you need Chinese food and your options are limited, they make it.  But it's nothing special.  They have all the standard food options of a Chinese restaurant.

7.description: Love the food here. Authentic Chinese food. Kung pao shrimp tastes so good here. Must try. Meal portions are pretty big. You're definitely getting your money's worth. The staff is really nice

3.description: Best Carnitas around!!!! No lie u gotta try them ,only on weekends but its worth the wait. They usually pass around tacos of carnitas, if theres a long line which there will be, but you can't find any carnitas this good around this area but in this place.

1.description: Heard about this place from a friend. Isn't  that how it is with the best places? Went this morning around 10:00, everything was warm and fresh. The food is located in the back of the grocery store. It's take-out only and only on the weekends. We went for the tamales and wound up also buying carnitas, rice, guacamole, and chicharrones. Everything tasted amazing! The rice was fresh, fluffy, flavorful, and unforgettable! The carnitas were perfect. We got a dozen tamales and only tried the cheese and chile type and they were great! They gave us a carnita and barbacoa while we waited. Yum! I couldn't wait to get home to enjoy it. We didn't try the Posole, as I didn't know they had it until we had already ordered all that other stuff. I'll be back and I'll be a regular!I can't say enough about the food.

2.description: Best Carnitas in the area!!!  Don't need to drive to far, especially early Saturday or Sunday morning!!!

0.description: Bomb Carnitas!!!! It's a hidden gem shhhhhhh don't tell anybody about this place. Most good carnitas places are packed to the 9's on Sunday's and if you go to late you get the bottom nasty salty carnitas. This place is really good and they have good salsa's. The have super loud music you would feel like you entered a bar lol Who care's you can get beer and carnita's in the same place.

12.description: I am addicted to this place. I make the trip about every 2 weeks just to eat there. The steak burrito and tacos are fantastic. They also serve free chips, salsa and hot carrots if you dine in. The place is tiny and the opposite of fancy, but the food is great and cheap.

3.description: Great food served with a smile. This is place is a winner. If they had a place near me I'd come or take out once a week.

1.description: Single worst tacos I've ever had. I took one bite and the meat was horrible. This was single handedly the toughest meat I've ever bitten into. My teeth hurt now i couldn't even finish one taco. I had to swallow whole pieces of meat because I couldn't chew it throughly. WORST MEXICAN RESTAURANT EVER! I recommend El Tarasco instead and it's less than a mile down the road.

2.description: I've lived in Archer Heights for a little over two years now and have been missing out on this place. Great steak burrito!  Give them a try, you'll be pleased. I went consecutive days as I was that pleased.

9.description: This is my favorite in the area for sure! You must stop in sometime, great staff and great food.

10.description: Great service. Small place, but very family oriented. I met one of or the owner and she is a very nice lady and I can tell loves to offer great customer service. I've gone here more than once and will continue to go back.

4.description: This place is an insult to Mexican food! The carne asada had no flavor and was tough... A total waste of my money! Only reason I'mGiving it a star because it's required for the review!

6.description: Went looking for a bite to eat about 10 pm and found this place--it was just right for what we wanted.  Fast, personable service; clean and pleasant interior; food cooked immediately when we ordered and came out piping hit and delicious.  DS had tilapia plate (came with rice, salad, tortillas) and raved about it.  I had chicken taco--fairly ordinary dish but this taco was excellent.  The chucked was grilled and super tasty, the corn tortilla was excellent. Happy customers!

0.description: Great place for a quick bite and mid day craving. Great service and the food is the best.  Fuck the haters.

5.description: Order 3 pork tacos and a can of crush to go. Cost $7.37Got home. They gave me 3 steak tacos. They were small. 4" size. Bland. Bland. Bland. I don't like putting sauce on my tacos. Had to this time since there was no flavor. Over priced and bland food.

13.description: Nothing bad about it. Nothing particularly great about it either. Pretty standard mexican burrito/taco place. Oh, yeah they grilled them, that was nice. Coke in glass bottles was a plus too, and the kinda racist episode of Bonanza they were blaring on MeTV was pretty dope-- I really liked the argument between little john and hoss about which one did or did not know the difference between a matador and a macarena... I think i might have just realized that i really don't like burritos all that much-- maybe I like super tyte ones made by bourgeois californians with fancy shit in them-- but as for your standard mexican stand type, I'm really not that big of a fan and should stick to tacos. I'll get tacos next time.

11.description: it is okay, the only thing it is small it seems like it not very clean in the back and by the sink by register. You do not know if the chef is picking his nose because there is a closure which you cannot see the chef preparing your food. I really do not like that specially if I am going to pay a lot money for food. Service can be better, I feel like I am talking too a cold fish.

8.description: Cleanliness - Not really (especially the kitchen)Service - FriendlyFood - I ordered a Chili Relleno taco (hoping against hope Id finally found a mexican joint that makes 'em as AWESOME as Taco Erendira in Bridgeport (if you've tried them, then you know exactly what Im talking about) Alas, no such deal - once again, if your idea of a good CR is how Pete's Market makes and sells them, ie, bland pepper, filled with bland waxy melted cheese, egg battered and fried - then you are a winner - in having bad taste buds  ;-)I also ordered an al pastor (marinated pork) I took one bite and had to spit it out. If my taste buds are more geared toward "americanized mexican"...then GOOD FOR ME, cuz that means I like my food WITH FLAVOR.On a side note, I recently revisited TACO BURRITO KING and their Al Pastor was DELICIOUS - oh, and cooked by Mexicans as well...maybe "americanized ones" who know what good food should taste like.

14.description: Good service, nice people. Must try if you live or work in the area!

7.description: This place is small. I remember coming here a few years back for a quick bite. Decided to come check it out again. There are maybe 5-6 tables in there. Service is nice and friendly. We were served chips and salsa, but no spicy pickled carrots. Horchata - The large was huge. It was ok.Shrimp Cocktail - Shrimps they use weren't the big kind. Also, I wasn't too fond of the sauce.Taco Plate - Basically, it's just 6 tacos. I chose 2 steak, 2 al pastor, 1 tongue and 1 chicken. These were good, but not the best I had. I only had the tongue and steak. I asked for just lettuce and tomato, but I think they accidentally added cilantro. I preferred the red sauce over the green. Carne Asada - My guy enjoyed it. I had a small piece and thought it wasn't too bad. He liked that grilled taste to it. Overall, it's not a bad place. Would go back and maybe try the burrito or tacos again. They also have a small parking lot.

1.description: Very nice and quiet restaurant for an enjoyable breakfast. The waitress was very nice and our food came out very fast.

9.description: well today I mean sunday 3-15-2015, me and my fiancée ate breakfast there, We had a nice server, she was fast, the food was good not greasy, We would go back there again.

23.description: They don't serve alcohol anymore, but we just bring in our own beer and sit at Shirley's table.

5.description: This place was one of my favorites, not anymore. Very disappointed with the kids breakfast menu, overpriced and just not enough, a miserable sausage and small pancake for $5 not what I expect.  Not bringing my kids here again, even they didn't enjoy the taste of the food.

25.description: I have been a loyal customer for years, but unfortunately after tonight's service I will no longer go back.  The waitress (Rita) first took rolls from another table and put them back into the warming bin (with her hands!!)  second the hostess couldn't even acknowledge us when we were paying.  She was too busy having a personal conversation on the phone and complaining about the abuse that she takes from customers.  the service has definantly slipped since the new owners/mgmt. took over plus many items have been deleted from the menu.

12.description: I've been eating lunch here twice weekly since I now work in the neighborhood.  Check the board for their specials.  The fish dinners (perch, tilapia) are great.  French toast with bacon will fill you up for $8.00.  Free Wi-Fi.

21.description: This place was good and cheap for a quick lunch. Real clean too.

16.description: The coffee and burger were delicious and affordable. The people who work the lunch shift care. I'm sad there weren't more patrons.

17.description: This place was awesome!  It has everything I like in a restaurant; friendly and responsive staff, good food, large portions, and reasonable prices.  I just happened to have 30 minutes to kill before practice today and thought I could go for some breakfast.  I was concerned that if I stopped, I would not be able to eat in  time and be late but that was not an issue here.  Literally walked in, ordered an Italian omelette and coffee and was out of there in 15 - 20 minutes.  The meal was good with the omelette being the highlight for me...cheesy with a good meat sauce on top and plenty of sausage, mushrooms, and peppers inside.  Even the toast was pre-buttered - a huge plus for me!!  the hash browns were a little underdone for future reference so be sure to order them well-done.  I will come back here now that I know about it and see what lunch looks like.

10.description: Pindos was originally a small restaurant back in day on the corner of Pulaski and Archer. Today it is owned by Donna who ran the restaurant for the original owners back in the day. She is a really nice character and just a delight to see. She is the type of owner that sits with you for a spell and chats about the times of the past but now runs and own the place. The food is old school. Like the Pot Roast in Gravy, although the day I picked some up, they had run out of noodles but she offered spaghetti or other types of noodles instead, plus she gave 2 pieces of her homemade cake, gotta love it. The New Pindos although it was been around for a few years now, still offers old school menu's but with a quality that is so lacked in so many restaurants of the past. Try them, you will see what I mean, just a delight to go to and be part of the neighborhood.

11.description: Cousins brought me here for bfast and I was surprised with the service and the food. The place looked sort of dead for a Saturday morning, so I was sort of skeptical. Our waitress was great and the food came out super quick and the food hit the spot.

26.description: My hubby and I usually order out from Pindo's.  Pancakes are pretty good, monte cristo sandwiches are great, and hash browns are okay.  Typical diner with typical diner food.  It beats out the other diners in the area that's for sure.  Service is fast and friendly too.

27.description: This is a great sit-down family dining restaurant reborn. Formerly Mt. Pindo's Restaurant (see previous reviews) new owners have brought this great little Archer Heights gem back to life. if you are looking for great hearty American-style dining then this is your place.  I loved Mt. Pindo's and love The New Pindo's for their generous portions, great variety, good value and attentive waitstaff.  All of their food is fresh and tastes great even the rolls and garlic bread they give you are fresh, not recycled like many restaurants.  I recently had lunch there with my mom, I had the Corned Beef Sandwich Deluxe with fries which was fresh, good corned beef, not too fatty or salty; my mom had the BLT Club Deluxe with potato salad which was fresh, crisp and delicious. You really can't go wrong with anything on their menu, so please give this restaurant a try and see for yourself! ***NOTE*** They are no longer a 24 hour restaurant, their hours are 5AM to 10PM daily.  The average tab for two is about $20 + tip. They have a decent sized parking lot, but parking gets challenging when they get crowded, but there is some street parking available and they have permission for customers to park in the bank lot next door. They have a full breakfast, lunch, and dinner menu which is available all day long.

0.description: I like good food and appreciate unobtrusive service this place was worth every dollar the slightly expensive menu. I usually go during off peak hours, will come when I am in this area again. I am sure people used to over attentive service .would not adore.

20.description: decent diner.. good breakfast... lunch and dinner are 2nd best for sure. Omeletes are my fav, pancakes are 2nd fav

19.description: decent diner.. good breakfast... lunch and dinner are 2nd best for sure. Omeletes are my fav, pancakes are 2nd fav

2.description: Came in to have a late lunch/early dinner with my kids. The food was good, the service not so good. Being with children Id hope the waitress would be a bit more kid friendly. She was so cold, that alone was enough to kill the experience. Customer service goes a long way, that includes all children.

18.description: Great spot for me n my hubbies breakfast dates. Love French toast, its the only thing I order. He likes the omlets and occasional steak n eggs or crepes.  Never had a bad experience with food or service.

13.description: This is a nice family style restaurant in Archer Heights. Christopher had a good patty melt and I enjoyed a nice BLT Club. We brought mom home some very good home made vegetable soup. If I were in the area again, I would eat here. It is clean and has a friendly staff as well.

4.description: Decided to come for breakfast Sunday. Parking lot was full and had to park on the street. I've been here years ago on late nights, but apparently they aren't 24 hours anymore. Corned Beef Hash - My guy got this, but I guess it was ok. I took his hashbrowns and gave him my pancakes. He said their coffee wasn't really good.Morning Sunshine - Eggs are cooked nicely. Bacon was fine, but the sausage was a bit different than other places. These seem chubbier, but they lacked flavor. Service was ok, but a bit lacking at times. Overall, I think I'll go elsewhere for breakfast.

24.description: Pindos was originally a small restaurant back in day on the corner of Pulaski and Archer. Today it is owned by Donna who ran the restaurant for the original owners back in the day. She is a really nice character and just a delight to see. She is the type of owner that sits with you for a spell and chats about the times of the past but now runs and own the place. The food is old school. Like the Pot Roast in Gravy, although the day I picked some up, they had run out of noodles but she offered spaghetti or other types of noodles instead, plus she gave 2 pieces of her homemade cake, gotta love it. The New Pindos although it was been around for a few years now, still offers old school menu's but with a quality that is so lacked in so many restaurants of the past. Try them, you will see what I mean, just a delight to go to and be part of the neighborhood.

6.description: When you are thinking about standard diner style food, it does not get any more solid than this place.Here are the positives: good food, good portions, excellent value (on all menu items that I have had to date), good service, huge menu selection.The only negative that I could even remotely think of is that the smaller parking lot fills up fast! This is really pushing it for a negative because there is ample street parking nearby. I have been going to Pindo's (original and new) since I was a kid in the 70's. I will not stop.

22.description: This is a great place for a family breakfast, lunch or dinner.  The food is always great and they have a big variety.  What I honestly like the most is the service, the employees here are very attentive.  It's not as hectic as other restaurants so you can actually enjoy your coffee and enjoy your food too!

15.description: Last time I went was the worst. A lot of family and friends said the food  was really good and I agree with them on that. But the waitresses were really rude. I might not go there for a while cause of that reasons only.

7.description: Great serviceGreat hamGood crepesDecent omletsEh hashbrowns

8.description: Solid Old School menu of which everything we've had was ample and good.  The homemade clam chowder was outstanding.  The Rueben on Marble Rye was stacked high, lean, not salty, and tasty with done right fries.  I've had the Turkey and Meat Loaf dinners, as well just as tasty.  If you went out with Mom and/or Pop this is the throwback you'll love.  Many of the staff from Curie H.S. also frequent this overlooked gem with easy and free corner parking for all.

3.description: 4 stars: Excellent teamwork for two ladies waitresses who took care of us!Price fair for diner food. Food Tastes good, enjoyable, but no craving feeling I have to go back. My Mom she dined there when she was young, named place from long ago, suppose to be newly remodeled.Seemed too impulsive that they charged automatic gratuity for 4 adults and two toddlers!!!!  I did not mind b/cuz good service, just seemed unfair. Maybe there is an Asian stereotype to be cheap???! She ended up with less... I tip more than 20% for excellent service.... But I did leave few extra $$s.Two Bacon @ turkey clubs Strawberry waffle w/ whip creamBacon burger Kids chicken tender mealVegetable soup and chicken noodle soup, fries included. Vege soup ok, canned soup? Family said chicken noodle good.=$64+ (includes automatic gratuity. Seamed clean but dated decor.

14.description: Enjoyed our meal at Pindo's Restaurant.  Service was great, people were very friendly.  We had breakfast.  My friend had eggs with multi-grain pancakes and grits.  I had the house omelette with multi-grain pancakes and hashbrowns.  These are some of the best pancakes I have ever had.  These multi-grain pumpkin spiced pancakes are very light and fluffy.  Yum!

1.description: Not bad, tacos , tortas, burritos and the usual Mexican cuisine. The staff is nice and the horchata (rice water) is just right. Located inside the small kiosk of a mall strip what can you say but, hmmm another Mexican restaurant nestled among Game Stop and a Chinese mediocre restaurant. I am not the biggest fan of "typical", especially when you find these here "taquerias" all over Chicago. Fortuntaely for them the place is clean and it has a giant parking lot, although they compete for parking spaces, its still a plus. The tacos were seasoned ok and although a little bit tough, they did the trick. Nothing again spectacular, but I like to help businesses in the area out as much as possible. Would I come here again? Hmmm, that is a good question. Not sure about that but its worth a shot to come try them out.

0.description: A lil pricey- but o so good! ...mmm flautas...

For what it's worth, I'd rather come here then Gilmart.The place is small.You will wait a few minutes to get served since there is no ticket system.There aren't that many products.It feels grungy.BUTYou will get recognized if you come here more than twice.You will get asked about what you need.You will get extras if you need it (sauces, dressings), sometimes free of charge if you have a wanda bouzie. You will have to hold your items close before the one cashier takes care of youAnd you will get checked out by the hired help and get talked about in a positive light if your name is Adrian W.

3.description: This is the best place to get your eye brows done!:) I haven't got my nails here yet because I can't have them due to my job, but I been coming here for almost 5 years just to get my eye brows waxed, and they never mess it up.. I like coming here!. The part that sucks is waiting a long time on the weekends, but its worth it!.

1.description: Ok thus far. Have been twice. Not sold yet. Will update review after a few more visits.

2.description: I love this place! Every time I go somewhere else that's not this place to get my nails done they either end up breaking because they're too thin or the color comes off or they just don't turn out how I want them. My recommendation is to go with Dr. Peter! He is super nice and funny. I often get small discounts for being a regular too. One of the best nail salon in the south side of Chicago! I bring in a picture of what I want and they come out perfectly.

5.description: Excellent service! Great job. Very satisfied with their work and their prices. Never had a problem. Not going anywhere else :)

6.description: the staff is super nice and funny. =) got a nice foot and hand massage.

0.description: Best place I've been to! I highly recommend for you to ask for Peter. Not only does he do a great job but he's full of energy. None stop conversation and laughter with him!

4.description: NEVER AGAIN! The absolute worst experience! The only reason I gave it a star was for the $20 no chip, because I didn't want them to cut my cuticles. They were so unsanitary so all I let them do was paint my nails, it was an emergency on a Saturday afternoon so I settled. The woman that did my nails couldn't stop texting and counting her tips while my hands were under the uv light. I'll never go back!!!

0.description: I brought my son into this place for a haircut this past weekend and I must say that it was a very interesting experience. First off, I gotta tell you that this place is definitely not for everyone..  Please take note that if you are a parent and you want to get your son a hip, urban cut, you better be prepared for your kid to get a "real" urban experience.   The place is actually pretty nice, modern decor, nice size, plenty of comfy seats and several flat screen TVs to keep you entertained.   There are about ten to fifteen barber stations here and each station is occupied by a barber, whom all seem to be mostly in their 20's.. Our barber on this day did a great job fading my son's hair and lining him up..  I can't take anything away from the final product, the barber did his job well. The problem here is that this place is more like a hang out spot than a place to get your haircut.. (guys talking sh*t, ball bustin, tons of cursing, and loud hip hop & rap blaring in the background)   I mean, I am no means a prude and cuss up a storm when I am angry, but I had to talk to my son afterwards about the, cussin and hip hop blaring in the background. I had to explain that their are all types of music that different people enjoy, and that the music is not necessarily bad, but that right now, he shouldn't listen to that music on his own because of the swearing and crude topics.  Believe me..  It is not easy explaining what a b*tches and hoes are to a nine year old, LOL Overall, if you are an adult and need to get your swag on, then this spot is as good as any.. If you are a parent and you want to get your son some swag.. you might want to try the unisex salon down the street!

1.description: WOW - has this candy bar been destroyed.  Only thing I can figure is somebody bought it for the name and is selling their cheap schlock until people figure it out.  Received 3 boxes of their 'chocolates'; fought my way through half an 'almond' bar; and will be throwing the rest away.Such a shame.

9.description: Used to be my favorite sweet treat in life.  If anyone asked what my favorite treat, dessert, or candy was, it was World's Finest.  Not anymore.  The chocolate doesn't have the same flavor it used to, I'm guessing they've started using filler or cheaper product.  The candy bar isn't the same size it used to be, I believe by .5 oz.  That doesn't sound like a lot until you realize it used to be 2.0 oz.  That's a 25% decrease in size.  If someone sold you a cadillac every year for 20 years for $35,000 and you were a devoted fan, I'm pretty sure you'd be upset on the 21st year when you hand them $35,000 and they give you a subaru.  If I wanted a nestle or hershey bar, I'd buy one.  I don't.  I want my World's Finest back.

12.description: Just bought some almond bars that there were no almonds. Do yourself a favor and don't buy from them.

21.description: There's two things to talk about here.First, and most importantly is the chocolate. I think a lot of people don't give the chocolate as much credit as they should because it's primarally really simple chocolate that is sold for fund raising, which is actually pretty awesome by the principal of the thing. But also, have you TRIED their chocolate? It's pretty amazing. They have bars which are normally the fund raising candy, but they also own the Queen Anne line which has chocolate covered cherries and they have little individually wrapped chocolates. Their dark chocolate is a lot less bitter than normal dark chocolate which gives it a nice flavor for people who aren't a fan of dark chocolate in general. They also have an amazing chocolate meltaway, chocolate coconut and chocolate with carmel with a couple other little guys. I'd say they'd make a great holiday gift, or something to munch on at home on a regular basis. Secondly is their factory. I visited recently with a group of people and the management staff was incredibly friendly, generous, and knowledgeable not only about chocolate but about their process too. The factory is laid out fairly simply. You start where they break down cocoa beans into a chocolate liqueur at one end and you end up with finished products that are wrapped, boxed, and ready to ship on the other. I have to give this place a great review, as well as their products.

16.description: The Groovy Gummies Suck, they were so tasty last year...What happened??? Ultimate Sadness:(

17.description: My relationship to WFC goes all the way back to 1975 when I was in high school having to sell the candy to reduce the price of my tuition.  DELISH and worth the price!  Still living in Chicago in the early 1980's and working just down the street from the main WFC store, our employer would gift us with a beautiful personalized box of their chocolate covered almonds on our birthday.  INCREDIBLE!  Then as a lot of us migrated to the suburbs in the 1990's we saw quite a bit of WFC fundraising from the school kids to "The Muscular Dystrophy Society", where you could grab some bars at your local "Service Merchandise" store to support "MDS".  STILL the BEST!  Then at some point I discovered the WFC outlet store in Orland Hills, IL.  Usually fine, but not always...kind of hit or miss.  Of course I noticed the decreased use of almonds over the years, but it was still good...chocolate seemed up to standards.  What I think is happening is sometimes the outlet has older/stale product.  Late fall 2014 I purchased 20 boxes of chocolate covered continental almonds.  They were in a green/red/white box at $.99 each.  I believe the regular price was $4.00.  The low price should have scared me and one would think given the Christmas colors on the box, that they were from Christmas 2013....but I bought them anyway.  It was TOTAL hit or miss per box.  Although the chocolate wasn't horrible, the almonds were mostly clearly stale.  I called the outlet in Orland Hills where I purchased them and they said those boxes had an expiration date of Jan. 2015.  It may well have been the case, but I think eating them so close to the expiration time is not advisable.  What really ticked me off though was, I emailed a complaint to the main store in Chicago and they didn't even have the courtesy to respond even though the outlet store told me that the main store is really good about responding.  NOT!!  So....when I shop the outlet store I just stick to the stock that looks freshest and completely stay away from candy that looks like it is WAY past a holiday date and is GREATLY reduced in price.  Expiration or not....IF WFC is using lesser quality ingredients, then they might not hold up to an expiration date.

10.description: Just awful. Someone gave me bar. I am so glad I didn't pay for it. It was nothing like the awesome chocolate it used to be. It was a mere 1.5 ounces of low quality chocolate that make Hershey kisses taste like premium chocolate. I don't mind paying a bit more for good chocolate but even for  free, it's not worth eating.  Skip it and write a check to the school selling it.

5.description: They've shrunk the bar down to a size that I no longer makes it an enjoyable purchase for me. That's not a loss for me because I have plenty of other alternatives. However, it will be a loss for all those people at work that sell these out of their desk drawers

11.description: Tastes like cheap, bargain aisle at Big Lots "chocolate". Like the other reviewer said, it's waxy. They also go extra skimpy on the caramel bar.

22.description: Wow...I cannot believe that I am the first person that gets the honor to review WFC. Let me start off by saying i've been selling and eating this stuff since the 2nd grade, so i'm no stranger. Upon my move to Chicago, i was taken back that i was in the backyard of one of the best chocolate companies around.From chocolate covered cashews, almonds and raisins to twisted mint melt aways and Carmel whirls, you will be pleasantly surprised at the rich but (at the same time) subtle flavor you get upon putting this stuff in to your mouth. Now It's not in the best part of town, but totally worth the drive!their site is wfchocolate.com

0.description: I did not grow up with these, as I am only twenty four but, I will say, this is a decent chocolate bar... The taste is somewhat reminiscent of a "Hershey's" milk chocolate bar leaving a sweet, mellow aftertaste. All in all it is a decent product, I can't wait to try the almond bar, as long as it doesn't have "dark chocolate".... Haha.

20.description: What happened to the size of these almond chocolate bars? The quality is good but the size has gone down. Sad

19.description: They're customer service is the worst We have been ordering corporate gifts from them for three years. This year they seem unable to get the order entered in their system after having received it 7 days ago. We are now up against the wall for time.We spend 1500.00 2000.00 annually with them.

2.description: This is NOT the WF you remember. The bar is much thinner, the almonds are in bits, and the chocolate is cheap crap. Don't bother, it's not worth the calories or the ruined memories.

18.description: This is a fantastic company.  They're one of only 9 chocolatiers engages in the entire chocolate-making process.  They grow their own beans at a sustainable farm in St. Lucia and ship the beans, still in the pods, to Chicago to become chocolate treats.  The largest arm of their corporation is the philanthropic division, where they sell low-cost chocolate to a variety of groups for fundraising purposes.  The chocolate itself--while not, perhaps, the 'world's finest'--is still high quality.  The chocolate-covered pecans and mint meltaways are personal favorites.You can also personalize chocolate gifts with messages, so if you've ever wanted to order candy with the words "Your MOM loves chocolate!" on it, here's your chance!

13.description: Had issues with stale chocolate and weights being less than stated.  Filled out comments on their website requesting feedback.  Waited 3 weeks, no response from company, will not purchase from again.

4.description: What the frikkety frik did you guys do to the chocolate?! I used to love this stuff when I was a kid, so I bought several bars from a friend for a fundraiser and will never make that mistake again. I couldn't possibly be alone in feeling this way - you guys really screwed the pooch on this one. The almonds are garbage and the chocolate is beyond subpar... thanks for taking a big steaming dump on one of the last vestiges of my childhood. What are you going to do for an encore, burn down a ChuckECheese?

6.description: Anyone who grew up remembers the WFC fundraisers.  Yeah, this company is still here and kids are still shilling the chocolate.The pros:1 star for allowing schools to make 50% of the profits.  The consRemember candy bars used to be thick and looked like bricks?  Remember the almond bar used to have whole almonds?  Well no more.  You get almond chips and the candies are really thin.  Yeah, it weighs less than a Snickers but what can you do?  They never raised the prices (still $1).Candy does not taste like chocolate.  It's waxy flavor.Eh, what can you do?  Your school favors this but I'd rather shill See's.

15.description: I've always sold and purchased your chocolates for fundraisers as a child and for my child and now my friends children.  Today, Valentines Day, my boyfriend and I bought 2 bars from a local retailer for her Childs sports team, I was so excited because I love your chocolate and it's been a while since I bought WFC.  I couldn't believe how disappointed  I was when I tasted it, it was horrible, worse than the generic candy purchased at Walmart or a drug store!!!  What happened to your product? I've read other comments on this and other sites and everyone says the same thing, yet the company is denying changing its recipe???  I'm so disappointed, it would've have been more lucrative to increase your prices than to change your chocolate.  You've lost a customer here.

7.description: Very disappointed in WFC, was once my favorite candy but like many, many, many people have said - the bars have gotten much smaller and the flavor tastes cheap. This puts consumers in a bad spot, the product is no longer worth  $1, yet you still would like to aid the community.  This only perpetuates the cycle and allows the company to think this is OK.

8.description: What the heck happened to World's Finest Chocolate?  This used to be the best chocolate around when I was selling these in school.  Super creamy and smooth, perfect sweetness and whole almonds.  Somebody brought these into work today and I immediately grabbed 3.  They were lighter, but I didn't mind that at all.  Totally to be expected with rising costs and still wanting to keep the price at $1.The issue was when i opened the package.  Before I even tried it I could feel the gritty texture.  The chocolate was waxy, cloyingly sweet, gritty, lacking in chocolate flavor.  Just plain awful.  What used to be an awesome exception to typical store bought chocolate is now several times worse than even Hershey's.  I took the other two bars back to the box and grabbed my $2.  Never again.

3.description: My brother brought home two bars of this chocolate he bought from a co-worker.  Because let's face it. Who else can you corner to buy this stuff. As a kid the bars were much bigger.  What the hell happened?  1.5 oz. Were they at least 6 oz back in the day. They are not even big enough to hold real sized almonds. The quality has changed. They will tell you different. Too the industry allows so many artificial flavors.

14.description: What happened to the chocolate? It used to be so good, it would melt in your mouth like fine Swiss chocolate. I would get excited when I saw kids selling it. Now it's World's Worst Chocolate. Uneatable, tastes like carob.

0.description: The gas is cheaper here than at the places on Cicero near the airport.  The person at the counter was very friendly and courteous though she spoke little english.

3.description: If I could I would give zero stars this place sucks they are very rude and the hairstylist marqetta  was the worst she didn't do my bangs right made them look like I was 12 n FYI she was the biggest bitch definitely will not be returning I wouldn't recommend this place to my worst enemy have a good day

1.description: This is the worst place I've ever been in,the stylist is so disrespectful and rude. The place stinks and it's all dirty. My family and I never plan on coming back. I will let all my relatives and friends avoid going there...

2.description: Great service and only reason why I didn't give it 5 stars is because the lady was by herself and over worked. I don't think she had a break all day. Bad location parking wise cause I've never been to this location when the lot wasn't chaos... What a mess

5.description: My b.f STILL comes here sometimes because it's close by. He has tried a different hairstylist. Hahaha! He is an optimistic person, thinking maybe it's an offday, but they leave him looking like he has bald spots! He threw in the towel finally. The last hair cut he had almost bald patches all in a row across his head. The tome before that was all on his left side and they do his fade way far up, they left him looking like a five year old. He gave up and now goes further away for his haircut. STAY AWAY!!! EVEN FOR GIRL CUTS!

6.description: This place needs some serious updating haven't stepped in there since H.S. I think. I was referred to go with Ana I hear she is the best! She was not working and I was in desperate need of just a bang trim. I walked in the girls were not very friendly with a greeting and I asked for Ana they told me she was not working and told them what I needed and had to wait a bit and at that moment a man was getting his haircut and he did not look happy and told the girl that is not what he wanted and told her a few other things.... he was not pleased! That should of been a sign to RUN out of there but I waited the girl attended me Marquitta I think i showed her a photo of the bang cut by my eyebrows she said ok. She sparyed and just cut across once she cut I knew she did not know what she was doing.... I told her it was fine and she took off my cape and was sending me out with a wet bang! I told her can I blow dry it I dont want to go out with it wet, she was kind of in shock and was like oh yea! and she did a little dry and I told her that was fine . I was very nice and stood calm but my bang was cut above my eyebrows and not even! I paid the almost 7 dollars and gave her tip. I could not be rude at that moment.... I should of NEVER went in there but these girls do need some serious training.

7.description: Although polite, the ladies who work here need some serious training when it comes to professionalism. My color was done at the sink next to the noisy washer/dryer. I've had my hair colored various times at different salons and it was always at a station not by the sink. One of the women was washing something off as I waited and water splashed on me, no apology. A loud woman with bright red hair later on sat next to me snacking on guava another coworker gave her. Later on as my hair was being rinsed the woman who did my color and the woman with the red hair talked about how they can't ever get the same number when counting down the drawers. The salon itself was very messy which surprised me since they all talked about what a slow day it was. Like I said they were nice to me but come off as completely unprofessional. I almost felt like I was at someone's house getting my hair done instead of an actual salon.

8.description: This is the best place to get your hair cut! Ana is the best shes been cutting.my hair for years! The manager amber is the nicest person too and.does and.amazing.Job at cutting hair Carolyn just cut mine and.it was great!

9.description: This is my haircut shrine ;-). Evelia is the manager here, and she will make you feel right at home. The salon is clean and spacious, while also being great for someone on a budget! Who needs a psychologist, just talk to your barber/hairstylist. Again, this is my old neighborhood, where i attended a local elementary school, and the nearby high school. It's always a pleasure to come back, while getting all nostalgic about those 'wonder years' :-)

0.description: Love this place! They always answer the phone and are honest about wait times. Ana is great--she's the only person that can cut mine and my brother's hair the way we like it (mine is thick and long with loose curls and layers, his is shorter, has a tendency to stick up if not cut correctly). The whole family comes to her--Grandma, Mom, 3 daughters and 1 son. Although we love Ana, really everyone here is good and very friendly.

4.description: Evelia is the best!!!!! I read the other reviews and it's too bad they didn't have my experience. The parking lot sucks but I come for the great service.

1.description: Pan dulce! Sweet bread! I grew up going to bakeries on Sunday mornings and coming home and having some for breakfast. Good times. This bakery is pretty good and is open 'til 9pm most nights.My favorite pan is the concha, and this bakery has at least 5 different kinds (love it!). They also offer full cakes and flans for special occasions. If you really want fresh bread, pick it from the carts they roll out to the middle of the bakery (since it's rolled out right after they come out of the oven). Give your sweet tooth it's fix and come to La Central Bakery.

0.description: Great Pan at a great price. Stoped here with my dad to get some pan and when we got home it was the bomb

1.description: Im slowly being convinced by jewels that i can save more with them with name brands. This place has become pretty pricy and I dont feel like I save much anymore here. The store itself is very clean and well stocked. Like the fact that they keep many cashier in front because other Aldi stores only have one with big lines.

2.description: I wish this was the one store I could just come and do all my groceries. I like that it is small. I don't feel like navigating through dozens of aisles at Food for Less to find everything. I also like that they charge separately for bags (ALL stores charge you for bags they are just hidden). My problem is with the quality of some items:Good: Peanut Butter (better tasting than JIF or Kroger brand)MilkeggsPlain yogurtCanned stuffPasta and tomato sauce.Potato chips and other junk food like cookiesCondimentsCanned dog food (canned only which varies in quality from Pedigree to Nutro Max)Bad:Hummus- extremely bland and tasteless id rather pay 1/3 more for a name-brandoatmeal- I had to double check that it was old fashioned felt more like instant!cottage cheese- nothing but milk in there. Kroger or Walmart brand is a lot better.Produce- There was pitch black apples in the net bags and bruisedmeat- other places have better prices and better meat. Though it isn't bad quality.Before shopping here I thought all store brand foods were the same quality as the expensive name brands. This was my experience shopping at Food for Less and Target. But it is not the case here, there is watered down stuff. I'd still come here though. You just have to know what are good buys and what isn't. Just know you will still need to go to Petes Fresh Market or Target up the block.

0.description: I've been to an Aldi less than 5 times in my life I would say. I came here to redeem a free milk coupon I got from the Chicago Fire game. There's only like 4-5 aisles. Some of the item prices didn't really seem that much cheaper than other chain grocery stores to me.Talk about old school, but this is the only place I've seen where the cashier didn't even have a cash register......it was more like those lock boxes (like you see them use in school functions or someone with a lemonade stand) and she used dividers to separate the money.....interesting!Also, there's an award for some suspects for armed robbery and murder posted on the door on the way in. Comforting!

1.description: My son loves this place.. I think it is a pretty good place as well.    The place is tidy, fairly organized, and good customer service.  I tend to hit up gamestop for the hot new games when they are released.  Not so much for used games anymore as I tend to find them cheaper on Amazon or other internet sites, but I would not write them off for used game consoles as they have a warranty for their refurbished hardware. This location is where i normally go, but i must warn you that this shopping center, where it is located is always super busy and parking is horrible.

2.description: The lady that works here is always helpful but the rest of the staff not really. Typical game store overpriced even for used games but place to come if you need a game.

0.description: I went in to pick up what I thought was the Animal Crossing 3DS XL. (The employee that I preordered with told me it was the XL). I didn't want to get it anymore but my boyfriend said that I should. My boyfriend and I kept going back and forth on it until we decided to keep the 3DS. Angel and Bruce were very patient with us, especially Bruce, and I was surprised because I was tired of us. I'm very thankful these guys were there to help.

1.description: Ice cream is good bionicos too (yogurt w/fruits) and stuff but NO BATHROOMS I spent over 40 bucks and they wouldn't let my kid in the bathroom

0.description: Typical neveria with all the basics and more. Nieve, paletas, agua fresca y golosinas, They have a great patio (+1 star for that) were you can eat your icecream or whatever you gotPrices are normal for business of the sort

3.description: Quality and value. Best haircut ever, and I am 27.... going back for sure!

1.description: Horrible service. I was there with my two year old son at 1:30pm on a Wednesday. The manager Michelle said there would be a wait of 20 minutes and that we were on the list and to be back by 2pm.. My son and I went to the car for about 15 minutes and when we got back she said the person who would cut my sons hair would be done in a few minutes. She then proceeded to cut a man's hair who was ahead of us. 2:30 pm came and went. She finished the man's hair and the person who was supposed to cut my sons hair still wasn't done. I figured maybe she'll take my son next because we hadn't been seen yet? Nope not at all, 3:00 pm comes around and not a word or concern from her or her staff. I left and will never return. Should of listened to myself before. Men don't get their hair done at salons. They should get it cut at a Barber and that's where my son and I will be going tomorrow. Never again Hair Sluttery, Super Sluts, Fantastic Scams, or Blowrics.

2.description: Worst haircut ever. My bangs looked like they got bitten by rats. I could have done a better job myself. What a joke. Don't people need to go to school to learn how to do a simple haircut? Never again

0.description: I love this place. My stylist is Connie. Love her. She is able to look at my hair and recommend me the best color and cut for my face and eye color. So far no fail.  I went for color, and corrective cut after super cuts really screwed up a basic layers cut. I am so happy with this place. highly recommended.

1.description: Good taste, but nothing to die for. Don't let the "big quesadilla" hype get you excited because it'll just ruin your expectations. Tortilla too overwhelming and too much, less tortilla more ingredient, please!

9.description: More like 3.5 stars.  The quesadillas were good.  Just nothing special.  Great salsa bar though with the hot sauce being really hot.  I'll go again when in the neighborhood.

23.description: Like many other places, you just have to know what to order and what not to.Service is super nice, they just opened and are kinda busy, so will not take into consideration that the food takes a little longer than other places, hopefully they will get faster with time.Machete huge quesadillas should be the name, 20 inches according to their menu.Few times in here and it's all about what you order. 2 things that I would never order from here is chicken and steak. They are not good at all so don't come back complaining that I didn't tell you because I did.On the other end of the flavor spectrum is the chicharron prensado verde, that my friends is extremely delicious, so much that I honestly felt guilty eating it, and I should have, it was my friend's quesadilla that I was eating.I have also tried the nopales, pierna, lomo and huitlacoche (corn smut). Huitlacoche is also very good. oh and they also have flor de calabaza. The masa is perfectly seasoned and cooked.MBQ, good food, big portions, ok prices

12.description: Was very good. First time trying, quesadillas are huge. Place is bare looking as others said but food itself was very tasty. Service was good, pricing wasn't too bad and wait time was decent. Good spot, not the best but definitely good.

21.description: It is amaaaaaaaaziiiiinnng. Go if you like humongo delicious, quesadillas with flamin hot salsa...and if you're vegetarian and a drinker you're in luck.  BYOB plus multiple veggie options. Liquor store next door and free street parking!

16.description: Huge quesadillas for vegetarians or meat lovers! I love that they actually use Chihuahua cheese and have everything fresh.  The machete originates in the streets of Mexico city.  But, in Mexico they are fried and the size of your table and the fillings are also cooked in a lot of oil.  So, I guess the USA version is the healthier version! Most of the staff is family, so it makes the visit feel like you're at your aunt's house in Mexico or something! I used to complaint about the long-wait until I got invited to see the behind the scenes action from beginning to end.  It is worth the wait!

17.description: Chicago estaba esperando esto !! Las mejores Quesadillas de Chicago , ven y prueba esta delicias

10.description: This is a great place and when your in a hurry you can call and they will have your order ready for you for the busy days when you're just running and the prices are great

5.description: Like many other places, you just have to know what to order and what not to.Service is super nice, they just opened and are kinda busy, so will not take into consideration that the food takes a little longer than other places, hopefully they will get faster with time.Machete huge quesadillas should be the name, 20 inches according to their menu.Few times in here and it's all about what you order. 2 things that I would never order from here is chicken and steak. They are not good at all so don't come back complaining that I didn't tell you because I did.On the other end of the flavor spectrum is the chicharron prensado verde, that my friends is extremely delicious, so much that I honestly felt guilty eating it, and I should have, it was my friend's quesadilla that I was eating.I have also tried the nopales, pierna, lomo and huitlacoche (corn smut). Huitlacoche is also very good. oh and they also have flor de calabaza. The masa is perfectly seasoned and cooked.MBQ, good food, big portions, ok prices

11.description: A friend of mine tagged in on this place on fb and I love big giant quesadillas (that's what she said) so I had to try it out. I had the chicharrón one and omg. Heaven in my mouth. My bf had tinga and he said he would have liked more tinga but I think he's crazy. We took it to go because there was no available tables and I was hangry. Ain't nobody got time for that. Prices are great also. So I would have given 5 stars but there are some things that definitely need improvement. 1. They need a number plan for the tables. I got there and was waiting for a table. Then someone got up and a lady, who got there after me, ran to the table and sat her fat ass down. Not cool. I feel a one day a fight is going to go down. I am sick or else I would have punched her face. 2. The trash can is located next to where they put the quesadillas waiting to go out to the tables. That's a major no no to me3. Wait time is a little long but they're made fresh and it was a Sunday afternoon so that's expected.4. I saw the cooks drinking pop out in the open. Cross contamination people.5.
