If someone has to go to the bathroom they pass the stove where they cook. This possibly can't be safe or clean.

22.description: I really wanted to like this place......maybe too much!!!!  We arrived there and we luckily found  a parking spot in front of the establishment around 8pm on a Monday.  I was surprised how small the place was.  It had 8 small tables and the place was packed....there was nowhere to sit.  When we got to the cashier she said it would be about 45 minutes to get our order and asked did we want to wait?  We decided to wait due the fact that we just bought the groupon to come here.  We ordered 2 Machetes quesadillas  and 2 bottled beverages which came up to $20.51 before groupon discount.  We were really hungry so went into the liquor store a couple of doors down and grabbed some chips and sat in the car.  We proceeded to go back in about 45 minutes later.  Our order was not ready but it was a vacant table available for us to wait.  It took about another 5 or 10 minutes before our order was ready.  We proceeded to get our order and I was somewhat disappointed.  Yeah the quesadillas were long but they weren't big!!!!  The pictures on groupon and on here were a little deceptive.  I wish I would've took some pictures with forks for scale.  I was just too hungry and ready to get out of there!!!  We went to the little accessory bar which consisted of 2 containers, one with lettuce and one with onions, 4 variations of hot sauce, and 2 squeeze bottles of sour cream(which were almost empty).  The food was decent but it definitely could have used more meat.  All in all for the price, wait, and service Its not likely I will try this place again.

0.description: Let's start off by saying this place would be a perfect 5 stars. but simply because of the parking situation I had to put a 4 star review. You gotta find parking right off Archer and sometimes it gets hectic during rush hour. But other than that, the food was phenomenal. Even when the place is busy it would not take more than 10 minutes for your food to reach your table. And the coffee is to die for, I highly recommend it with Mexican bread...

20.description: i called saturday to order and they said there was a 2 & 1/2 hor wait ! sunday i went there and they said 1 hr wait , this place its always too crowded , so that made me think ! these machetes have to be super delicious,,              !!!!!!!!!!!!!what a dissapointment !!!!bad service !!!!!  bad food !!!!masa was too thin and overcooked,   place was way too crowded and the people working there , wayyyy too slow !!!!i really hope they take care of this problems ,, i would really like to see this place grow .no valio la pena esperar tanto tiempo para una quesadilla mal hecha , pues parece que la hicieron a la carrera !!!!will never eat from this place again !!!!!!!!!!!!!!

19.description: Absolutely loved this place. My husband took me and I had the half Asada half Chicharron Majado it was amazing. I will definitely be back for more and definitely recommend this place.

2.description: I'm between 3-3.5 stars. Place is pretty bare looking. I wished the menu was a bit more descriptive. Next time I'll try and load up the extra and eat it that way. We ordered a nopales, pork skin with red sauce and lomo. I didn't try the nopales, but I would order the lomo again. I will return to give others a try. Also, why aren't those Mexican Coke ever that cold?

18.description: I was here on Monday and it was the BEST quesadilla I have ever had. The line was long but it was well worth it. They have a big menu on the wall and they also have mini for kids. Its was nice and comfy inside. Also, they have a place where u can add your salsa and toppings on top.

13.description: Fiiiiiiiiirst!!!!Well, Yelpers, I done visited this place after driving by last week and seeing the hilarious sign hanging outside in a neighborhood I usually associated with the other love of my cultural life: all things Polish. Not too often you have a Polish funeral home across the street from a Mexican ice cream joint and a quesadilla hot spot!Parking was a tad hard to find as it was rush hour. Holy crap I forgot what Archer Ave. traffic was like during that 4-6pm rush. Whewwww! So once that was sorted out, we had the pleasure of looking at the wall mounted menu as two very genteel and polite ladies allowed us to peruse the shop and ask questions. We had no idea what was in store for us. I ordered the Huitlocoche and Rajas con Queso Machete quesadilla, which translates into 20 inches of cheese and veggies with a small salad bar for you to add onions, lettuce, and mild-white-people-friendly all the way to my-butt-is-going-to-hurt-after-this-isn't-it? super hot salsa. We of course, being ever ready brought wine to quench our thirst and spite the sala gods. Franzia is heaven sent, am I right or what?! So, yeah two long machetes and a nice size veggie and squash flower salad later we just sat around laughing and letting all the goodness we consumed work its way down the 'ol GI tract. MMM...MMM..MMM...I kinda wish SPW was there to have enjoyed it with us  ( :_ ( ) as we were laughing our asses off and even took a picture for their Facebook at the maitre's request. Sure, us having fun and enjoying your food? Why the heck not?!They have a wide variety of toppings, veggie and meats, except you won't find menudo on the menu as one smart ass came in asking for this evening. But what we had was quite tasty and well prepared. The ladies and the back kitchen staff were plenty friendly and I will stop by next time I have to attend a Polish wake across the street, or sooner really, cuz this is the only place that I know of that has these giant quesadillas! Wooooot!

4.description: I had never heard of machetes, first time having one. A machete is similar to a sope but way bigger.  This place has great 'tinga' highly recommend it. I can't finish one all by myself, they are pretty big.

24.description: Fiiiiiiiiirst!!!!Well, Yelpers, I done visited this place after driving by last week and seeing the hilarious sign hanging outside in a neighborhood I usually associated with the other love of my cultural life: all things Polish. Not too often you have a Polish funeral home across the street from a Mexican ice cream joint and a quesadilla hot spot!Parking was a tad hard to find as it was rush hour. Holy crap I forgot what Archer Ave. traffic was like during that 4-6pm rush. Whewwww! So once that was sorted out, we had the pleasure of looking at the wall mounted menu as two very genteel and polite ladies allowed us to peruse the shop and ask questions. We of course, being ever ready brought wine to quench our thirst and spite the sala gods. Franzia is heaven sent, am I right or what?! The ladies and the back kitchen staff were plenty friendly and I will stop by next time I have to attend a Polish wake across the street, or sooner really, cuz this is the only place that I know of that has these giant quesadillas! Wooooot!

6.description: Machetes quesadillas is a copy of las quecasSame but double quesadillaSame guisados same salsas Not impresPlain space tables chairsLarge trays for a  big quesadillaI will not miss itYou forget to make red onion super spicy that's it

15.description: It is amaaaaaaaaziiiiinnng. Go if you like humongo delicious, quesadillas with flamin hot salsa...and if you're vegetarian and a drinker you're in luck.  BYOB plus multiple veggie options. Liquor store next door and free street parking!

7.description: Came here today for the first time as my husband works around the area and suggested this place he knew I would like it , let me say I had the tinga quesadilla (you get to add your own topping lettuce ,onion , and a few choices of hot salsa) he had the 20 inch chicken and cheese quesadilla which was delicious as well . Definitely see myself coming back to try their beef quesadillas  after my 22 day  challenge of not eating beef  feeling full

8.description: It's my 2nd time coming here. Let me start off by saying that the staff is very nice and the place is clean although small. I've been to las Quecas before and to another quesadilla spot nearby (I can't think of the name), so I was a little hesitant to try this place because the other 2 weren't that great in my opinion. Let's move on to the quesadilla. The tortilla is very flavorful. I ordered the machete and you're able to put 2 fillings in there. I had 1/2 with chorizo and papa, the other half with pork skin in read sauce. I also had a machete jr with steak filling; all were delicious! Last time I came I had the shredded beef and chorizo with potatoes. The machete is HUGE! The Machete Jr is still big in my opinion. Overall I highly recommend that you try this spot. I'll be back to try new fillings in the near future

3.description: We really enjoyed our meal last night for dinner. There was an option to get a smaller quesadilla but we both wanted a jumbo one to ourselves. I had steak while my boyfriend had the chipotle chicken, both were really tasty and they were made with cheese and then you can add the other things at the salad bar. I wish things were more labeled so were would have been more aware of what sauces were available but there was also a language barrier because it was our first time there so we had no idea what we were doing. But it was still a good experience and our quesadilla was very enjoyable. We also garb a drink each had a jumbo and surprisingly the horchata was just perfect. It did not have such a strong cinnamon flavoring compared to other places. The pricing was pretty reasonable as well. We will definitely be back!

14.description: First that all, I like to write a little more descriptive experience of the places I visit and review. I hate to put four sentences (positive or negative) or use yelp as a way to complaint of bad food or service. This is my experience and only my experienceMy wife, my daughter and I decided to visit Machetes on a Saturday afternoon. They have parking at the bank, but we found street parking very easy. The place was full but found a table. Walking inside the restaurant you can smell the fresh made corn tortillas, the wonderful aroma, and imagine the toothsome texture of nixtamalized corn. After looking at the menu and discussing who was ordering what (we wanted to try all of them), we ordered 3 quesadillas. Mushrooms, half rajas and cactus, and half huitlacoche and zucchini flower, also 2 coffees and water.While authentic quesadillas are greatly different than your typical Mexican grub (Tacos de Asada) that most Americans are use to, I grew up eating Mole, Nopales, Huitlacoche, Flor de Calabaza, etc... As Mi Abuelita and my mom where culinary gurus, this better be an "A" Game!My wife had rajas and cactus and she swears that it was the cherry on top... My daughter ordered the mushrooms quesadilla and she really cleaned her plate... I had the squash blossoms with a nice sweet flavor.  The huitlacoche was as expected with a funky fungi/mushroom flavor with a hint of smoke and corn.Quesadillas were tasty and good size. Not the type you get from Mexican taco places with good quality cheese and not the greasy giant oozy cheese kind that lead to obesity, more the kind that makes you happy eating it because it hits the spot without making you feel like crap later. I have seen other quesadilla places make them with cheap cheese like Food, Nuestro Queso, and El Mexicano which are low quality and too greasy to use in quesadillas. Also, there's a condiments bar with salsas, chopped onions, etc. that we really enjoyed. Some of the salsa are very very spicy... But we went for more.Vegetarians, have no fear, there are good vegetarian options as well as cheese-less to take the full flavor of the fresh made tortilla with your favorite filling... All are VERY good. I've tried various spots in Chicago area including Little Village, Pilsen, Cicero, etc... and this one did not disappoint us. The prices are competitive, employees are ok, but need to work with their people skills, the place needs more decor, and bathrooms in the front. But I'm there to share good food with my family and not to have a conversation with the employees or admire art on the walls. I'm very picky about Mexican cuisine, and this is the best quesadillas I've had so far... we will be going back very soon.

1.description: Been going here for years and the establishment is finally showing its age. The cushions on the seats and benches is basically worn away. Even the goldfish in the pond are gone. The bathrooms need major upgrading. As for the food, it was better a couple of seasons ago. The quality has really gone down and that's a shame since this was a favorite, bi-weekly place to eat. Too many under 10 yr old kids running around, dropping food and self serve ice cream and dried crud on the tables.Goodbye All Style Buffet!

9.description: Lets just start by saying that you're better off coming in with prewritten cards in Chinese with questions just in case you need to ask them something about whatever, because no-one will understand you. What they do understand is $ "and howmany ppl"?  They have nothing but mexicans in the back cooking your "authentic chinese food". Lol... The table cleaner only comes around once thru your whole meal. So do expect to have a stack of plates on your table. One more thing is dont expect padding on your seat, cuz you wont have none. The food is very mediocre so i honestly think its overpriced for the whole experience, but thats just me. I dont really write down my thoughts on food and locations but i tried today bcuz the wife wanted to try this place out, so i looked it up thru yelp and i had told her iit had said it was bad considering thr reviews on yelp. We still went and we were both disappointed. Better luck next time i guess.

23.description: ur run of the mill buffet excellet decore friendly staff yummy yummy sushi and yummy

12.description: I've had better. Simply having good service and nice decor don't really make the cut. I don't think the food was good at all. I tried the buffalo chicken and it only tasted like bbq chicken. The egg drop soup tasted like thickened soup with egg (plenty of sulfur taste). The roasted chicken was dried. The mashed potato was plain terrible. I don't know how they can mess up the basics. One thing that shocked me was the five spiced beef.... I can't describe the taste because it was nothing different than adding sugar to oyster sauce. The five spice is barely carried out. Quite a disappointment here. The fried chicken was good (when fresh). What really lacked here was taste. There is a variety of food to choose from. They had a pretty decent sushi bar and grill. (My "steak" were all charred and can't be eaten. The meat were all tough after the grill. I only came here because my date like this place for the price and choices...I believe the highlights are the view/ decorations, the price (but not the quality of food), and service.

21.description: One of the better ayce buffets in the area. Went to satisfy my sushi fix and for 8 bucks will be back.

16.description: decent food, clean place. the selection of dessert was a joke!!!!.if it wasn't for the soft serve ice cream , i would have snapped. ( almond cookies, apple danish and a hard ass brownie. .i wanted to stick my finger in a electric outlet.

17.description: This may have been the last time I go. The quality of the food has gone down. Rice, chicken, crab rangoon had no flavor. The temperature of the food in the egg roll section was not hot.  This place is just going down. Sad the the owners invested so much money for hoodlums to graffiti and steal soap dispensers. I may go one more time, but will stick to regular Chinese restuarants.

10.description: You can't really ask for to much at a place like this. I've been twice for the lunch buffet and you're paying $9 for all you can eat and they have a hibachi grill and crab legs at dinner time I believe. The food could definately be little hotter though.The only things I dislike about this place is that the mens bathroom has more graffiti than New York City and I saw a waterbug on my way out the bathroom. Once again its definately decent for what you're paying

5.description: Decent buffet for the price. Their selections seem to be more diverse, but not that big of a selection though.Most of the items were okay, but some of the meat were tough. Wish there was a little more veggie option. Sushi was okay, but minimal. Most of them were veggie only and seemed to be sitting out there for quite some time. The never replaced the unagi roll....argghh!Will maybe go back to try it on a weekend.

11.description: This place is decent. Good chow mein, The sushi is great, the stir fry is very flavorful, and clean stir fry grills. I went to hibachi buffet on cicero and their grills is covered in tar! This place is worth grubbing out.  Also, the food you get in breakfast time (11am to 3pm) is the exact same food you get for dinner (3pm to 10pm). The men's bathroom is wrecked and tagged every nook and cranny you can see. Great buffet for the price. Don't go late at night during the week because they are not rolling out fresh food!

22.description: In the beginning the place was awesome, clean and very economical. I have to say a year into the place and I am no longer impressed. It seems that the establishment lets the Bay Bay kids under 5 serve themselves, and I find that not too good for sanitary reasons. Especially when kids touch food and put it back barehanded. I use to like the way this place has room to breathe, but now, its got that "crowded and cheap" feel. Although okay for me, I don't go out of my way to go here, although I pass it almost every day. I'd rather go further for a buffet. But its just OK.

0.description: The only thing that keeps me coming back to this buffet is the person who actually cooks your stir fry right in front of you it's delicious and you get choose what ever you want it in for instance : shrimp, jalapeños, carrots, beans sprouts...etc. Sushi is good. The desert however is so limited and when I say limited I'm talking about sugar coated peanuts, and dollar store confetti sprinkled brownies lol sounds harsh but hey, deserts the best part, there they lack tremendously. Salad bar is pretty big, they alway have fresh  Cucumbers, watermelon, pineapple, romain, etc.

20.description: I had a lunch buffet last week. I like this place when they gave coupons to local residents those days. And I think they have a better quality of food, attitude and service at that time.In terms of food, it is very average. Now, lots of buffets have sushi, so that is not a plus. very small shrimp and only one kind. the quality of food is mediocre. Some are spicy, so I can not tell they are fresh. I would not call it all style, it is americanized chinese food and sushi buffet.They still have a fairly big customers for lunch due to their less than 10 bucks menu after tax.

19.description: I had a lunch buffet last week. I like this place when they gave coupons to local residents those days. And I think they have a better quality of food, attitude and service at that time.In terms of food, it is very average. Now, lots of buffets have sushi, so that is not a plus. very small shrimp and only one kind. the quality of food is mediocre. Some are spicy, so I can not tell they are fresh. I would not call it all style, it is americanized chinese food and sushi buffet.They still have a fairly big customers for lunch due to their less than 10 bucks menu after tax.

2.description: I have to say that this was not our first choice of buffet to go too but our regular buffet was closed and we were all hungry and ready to get our grub on but at an inexpensive price.We didn't make the lunch buffet which is 7.99 but we made it for the dinner buffet which is 11.19 starting at 3pm.I hate to say immediately I wished this wasn't our second choice but I was with friends and family to celebrate a birthday and at the end of the day that is what was most important but I can't tell you how I wished we had got there earlier to save some money on this mediocre food.Now, I know some say what do you expect when you aren't paying that much for the food; Well I will tell you this, I may not be expecting lobster and filet mignons but I sure do expect the food to be flavorful, eatable, replenished when the food trays are emptied and most importantly digestible.I will give you a quick scenario and I don't blame the restaurant for this but I am saying we should have to pay the price for other customers acting like they are the only ones in the restaurant.  They had some Pepper Shrimp with the heads on but they tasted so good(I can give them an A plus on this selection) Anyway, people were taking mounds of it, matter a fact one table had three people come up and just about empty the pan.  We(the other customers) stood around like a pack of hungry animals waiting for them to bring more for almost 15 minutes and they still didn't add more shrimp to the pan.  I went to sit down because the food I did have on my plate was getting cold.  My girl's mom went back up and just as the vultures were about to attack the pan again she got me some and that was the only way I was able to taste them.The grill was just disgusting the beef was a greyish type of brown, the chicken was slimy and old looking and I couldn't believe they had it siting out or that people were getting it as a part of their stir-fry...Yeah, I skipped that experience.  I am a sushi eater and it is one of my favorite foods. I'm trying not to sound like a big baby but yuck yuck pooie and yes I did say that without hesitation.  It was just not fresh and it didn't really look appetizing but I thought I would give it a try.  Now, don't get me wrong they had a few items that were tasty and flavorful but they had so many other ones that weren't that it overshadowed the so few dishes that were worth putting on your plate.The bathrooms weren't that clean and if I didn't have to go I wouldn't have went and I will leave it at that.I have to say the staff except for a couple were very friendly and nice but it wouldn't make me want to come back but I do thank them for being observant and helpful.They don't have a wide selection of desserts which was disappointing for our birthday boy.They did have a soft serve ice cream which did taste good but you can't really mess up ice cream, can you?I have to say at the end of the day we had fun not because the food was exceptional, or the place was uber clean(cuz it wasn't) but because the 7 of us enjoyed each others company and laughed so hard together that the food and this place played in the background of our family time.  All in All I can't say I won't be back because you just never know but if I had a list of buffets because my favorite buffet is closed this one won't be my second choice.

18.description: I'm writing this review after just walking inside my home after spending approximately 15 minutes at this place. What led me to this place was a coupon I printed off the Valpak.com site to get a $5.99 lunch buffet. When I went to the counter and asked the clerk if they are still accepting this coupon, she told me yes, but I had to pay $7.99 for the regular buffet to get the $5.99 buffet. As soon as she explained this to me, I looked down and on the counter, I saw a sheet explaining buffet pricing. From Monday-Friday, during lunch, get a buffet to go for just $2.99 a pound, and dinner buffet Monday-Saturday for only $3.99 a pound! I've never heard of anything like this before!So I decided to get the lunch buffet to go, going around the aisles of the eatery in search of delicious things to fill my to-go container, and delicious things I would find. Stuffed mushrooms, baked flounder, BBQ pork skewers, authentic crabmeat pieces, sushi-cream cheese and California rolls and raw fish sushi-slab of raw fish over solid rice ball, cheese pizza, brownies, cupcakes, macaroni and cheese, slices of oranges, cantaloupes, melons, and a host of other delicious goodies and munchies! Total cost for the things I listed (I got every single one that I mentioned except for orange and melon slices and the raw fish sushi) was only $6.31! Yes, that's right, $6.31! Damn good deal! Oh my gosh, I have got to come back to this place, probably within the next 2.5 weeks or so, but with my severe time restrictions, there's no guarantee that I will. Nevertheless, it is worth the money. Very inexpensive, and the customer service is great! NOTICE: If you want to pay using either debit or credit, what I used today, you have to purchase a minimum of $5 in food.Something else that makes me give this place five stars is that, in between the register and the dining area, there's a mini pond, filled with beautiful orange fish, live of course. I saw a bunch of small ones, but I also saw like, about three big ones. What a beautiful sight that was.

13.description: This was absolutely horrible.  The food is cold and old and small selection; it was clearly sitting out all day.   Even if the food was fresh, most things use butter for the main flavoring.  It is clear that there is not anyone caring about food quality.  The sushi looked brown, mac and cheese was watery, noodles cold, nothing was properly labeled, so you had to guess what you were eating and they did not even take the time to properly clean strawberries.  I am not being picky, but even if you can't cook, not taking the stem out of the strawberries is just lazy and showing a lack of respect of your patrons.  You should at least get what you pay for, here you don't even get that.  For twenty dollars we could have gotten a couple sandwiches someplace and been much more satisfied with money to spare.  I hope others learn from our mistake.

4.description: Could of been better, only stopped in here cause me and a friend of mine where literally starving!! Food selection was pretty big but I feel like the dessert could've been bigger and better. 11.95 a person which is not bad at all.

24.description: Been here a few times, it's got a decent selection of food.  Just another run of the mill Chinese buffet places.  Nice decor when you walk in with a pond and walk over bridge, clean, plenty of room, and a decently stocked buffet.

6.description: Two words. Donkey balls. This place is horrid. We read a bunch of 3 star reviews and didn't necessarily have high hopes, but the food here is beyond gross. The staff is super rude too, my husband said the waitress swore at him under her breath because we didn't tip. We would have gladly tipped had the food been halfway decent. Edible, even.  Also the ticket they give you to "reserve" your table, such as what you get at any buffet restaurant was not so keenly worded toward good customer service but all but cussed the customer out. They threaten fines and additional charges for wasting food and eating additional desserts. Kinda funny, but kind of not funny too. All in all a weird and rather unpleasant experience. Best thing we ate was the ice cream at the end.

15.description: FRAUDULENT!!!  I went to lunch with a 30% off coupon.  They gave me less than 25% off of their listed $7.99 lunch price.  When I questioned them, they basically told me if I didn't want to pay what they wanted to charge me, I could leave.  Why would you go to a place where they try to rip you off like that and then give you attitude when you call them on it?

7.description: I've been here 3 times for a quick lunch, and will go again.  It's rare to find 4 types of fish that aren't fried at a place like this, so I really appreciated that.  They are: baked salmon, baked flounder, pollock (imitation crabmeat), and the several raw varieties at the sushi bar.Okay so that's not only 4 types then...get over it...how about 4 different areas that have un-fried fish?                                Did that satisfy your OCD???

8.description: In the beginning the place was awesome, clean and very economical. I have to say a year into the place and I am no longer impressed. It seems that the establishment lets the Bay Bay kids under 5 serve themselves, and I find that not too good for sanitary reasons. Especially when kids touch food and put it back barehanded. I use to like the way this place has room to breathe, but now, its got that "crowded and cheap" feel. Although okay for me, I don't go out of my way to go here, although I pass it almost every day. I'd rather go further for a buffet. But its just OK.

3.description: I dined here yesterday. The location is great. Parking is convenient and ample, so no worries with that.  Nice selections at the buffets.  They even have a Hibachi grill.  I got my food items for the Hibachi grill, but had to find a worker to get the grillmaster!  No one was working there or even peeped out to see if customers were waiting!   I have had better stir fry.  They do not have Sriracha sauce on the tables, you will not get a lot of heat if that is what you like.  The cushions on the booth seats are the worst that I have ever seen!  Don't these people have any pride in appearance???  All of the booth seats were in deplorable condition!  The best thing is that the beverage kiosk is self-serve.

14.description: Sunday, July 3 - A friend of mine and I, decided to go here at the last minute around 5:30pm, he was from New York just wanted to go to a buffet restaurant.  I pulled this one up on Yelp.  Have to say, it actually pretty good.  There isn't really any bad things to say.  Their staff sure do love to clean, every where I looked someone had a rag and cleaning the tables and chairs.Food was good, they had sushi there also for $10.95 per adult.  Not to bad at all.

1.description: Love it! :) the rice here is so good, and beans too! Love the horchata! Amazing! Love this place

9.description: This place is our go to Mexican spot at work. The tacos and burritos are pretty good. Have had the pork and steak and they're always fresh and tasty. The enchiladas verdes are also very good, the meat is flavorful and not dry. And the green salsa is tasty with the perfect kick, not too hot. Another thing that may not be a big deal to most, but is to me is their rice and beans are always fresh. Never dried out or crusty. Any Mexican food enthusiast knows what I'm talking about, yuck! Their service is courteous and efficient and the prices are very reasonable, you can have a solid meal for under 10 bucks. If you want good, fast, and affordable Mexican fare that's better than average. La Cebollita on 47th definitely fits the bill.

12.description: Love this place. Always a good meal. Easy to drive right by it but if you're looking for a good Mexican meal, I'd stop.

21.description: I can completely agree with Brian, I have also eaten here dozens of times and have had very few negative experiences.  On the weekends the Carnitas are whole pig, which is to say if you get there early you can pick the best parts, I enjoy the shoulder, ribs and some loin.  The Carnitas are a bargain and an easy picnic choice. Another thing that sets them apart from the norm are the Tamales, red, green and sweet, always fresh and plentifull on the weekends, they tend to run out on the weekdays, very rich and tender, and super cheap.  Brian said the restaurant had a comfort food quality to it and I will agree 100%, a wonderful lady usually seen on the weekends prepping or working the counter is the owners sister, she has developed the signature recipes and is one of the friendliest hosts in Chicago, the only problem is she isn't there enough. On several occasions she has brought me free samples of Chicken Croquettas, (a fried fritter like concoction) Empanadas, (the best I have ever had), and her version of Ensalata de  Nopales, (cactus salad) this is another of the weekend specials. This version of the salad features Extra virgin olive oil , aged cheese, and a lot of love.  Other highlites include tacos pastor and the steak milanesa.   Service can be a bit stoic and impersonal, but has never prevented me from enjoying the food.  Why only 4 stars?  Because of the high quality of some of the dishes, some less popular dishes tend to suffer, Burritos are average, enchiladas lack the balance of my favorites, and if you are craving a Tamale on a weekday, you should go elsewhere. Also I have noticed, even though I am a regular of 3 years, as a gringo I will have to request hot sauce for the table, the Hispanic population gets it automatically, doesn't anger me, I actually find it humorous.  As far as the drinks go, BYOB, the Horchata is very well balanced and the Agua Frescas (fruity drinks) are consistently good.  So come in on a Saturday for lunch, order a Carnitas plate, a Tamal, and enter the wonderful world of pig, FYI when you order the Carnitas they may ask if you want Pig only?  This means meat only, if you want the full experience say "con chicharon"  with skin baby, crispy and fatty a perfect complement to the tender slow cooked pork. Get a side of Avocado, they will give a whole Avocado for .75, and you will have a fantastic meal for less than a Wicker Park Martini.  Also good for catering.

16.description: This place is the best!!!! best quality & servicebeen coming here for like 6 years they have never failed me once!!!please show patronage to keep them open!

17.description: Here's the deal.MUY RICO!!! The burritos come with everything on them- including avocado. So tasty. Chicken was excellent. Best part besides the huge burritos, they deliver and in record time too. They were here with the food within 15 minutes of my call.Fantastic! I think I am going to be a regular.

10.description: My coworkers and I volunteered at the food depository so we stopped by here for lunch. We had a part of four and were able to find a table even though the restaurant was pretty busy. Chips and salsa were given to us as soon as we sat down and the salsa was tasty. We each ordered burritos and horchata as well as guacamole for the table to share. I had the al pastor burrito and it was great. I finished the entire burrito and enjoyed the seasoning on the meat. However, the guacamole was kind of average. I was hoping for a little more flavor. We asked for a little extra lime to add to our guac, and they were very kind and brought us a whole plate of sliced limes. Service was great and quick. Food was tasty. I probably wouldn't come out of the way for it, but if you're in the neighborhood it's affordable and yummy. They also have a parking lot.

5.description: I get my usual tamales here, salsa verde pollo!!! (: yummy! I have also tried their bistec and it is soooo good like on a scale of 1-10 it's a 10 ! Okay now I love Mexican rice I kid you not every place I've gone to so far their rice is bland or just plain out WHATEVER but this rice is so utterly delicious. Whatever they do I hope they never change I love this place.

11.description: First time here. Had tamales filled with queso and rajas.  Those were very good.  Horchata was ok.  The plate I ordered however was another storyOrdered the tampiquena.  The enchilada that came with it was tiny and shriveled.  It was a mini tortilla with minimal cheese.  The worst part of the plate was the meat.  The steak was super fatty, like it had not been prepped or cleaned of all the fat and you had to chew it 100 times before you could get it to a consistency to swallow it.  I ate half of it and have up.  Crappy quality meat. Lastly, I would have ignored this considering there are other food items that may make up for the crappy tampiquena... But the service by the waitress/cashier/order taker was slow, rushed, and poor.  Not her fault, I know, but the business owner needs to reconsider a few things to gain regulars at this location.

3.description: Awesome place for some real authentic Mexican food. Highly recommend! Good parking area, clean place takes cards and has tasty chips and salsa. I would say if you are looking for a place to grab some food in the airport area and are looking for cheap but awesome place. Go for it.

0.description: Amazing little joint you will miss if you blink,  but worth looking for if you like truly authentic Mexican-   no Uncle Julios here-  just Tios Reales!  Easy parking to east of restaurant in private lot.  Very friendly staff. Do not go to Midway without stopping here.Everything is delicious but the soup entree- Carne en su Jugo- is maybe the best Mexican meal I have eaten in Chicago.  I will dream of it.  Laden with meat, some beans and just the right spices- absolutely delicious.  Camarones del Diablo also delicious entre.  Tacos, tostadas- everything made fresh and delicious. Namesake ceboliitas are a must.Please do not pass this place up.

20.description: Here's the deal.MUY RICO!!! The burritos come with everything on them- including avocado. So tasty. Chicken was excellent. Best part besides the huge burritos, they deliver and in record time too. They were here with the food within 15 minutes of my call.Fantastic! I think I am going to be a regular.

19.description: This place is the spot for authentic Mexican cuisine.   Tacos are unrivaled and the Burritos will make you wet your pants.   You feel like you're in Tijuana when you enter this small restaurant.   Quietly nestled on 47th a few blocks west of Pulaski, LaCebolita hits all the right buttons.  Staff is nice and friendly and the food is quite fresh and good.  Verdict:  4 stars.

2.description: Good asada and chorizo tacos. Had to try the Cebollitas and they did not disappoint. Nicely seasoned best Cebollitas.

18.description: Best Tamales ever! Placing an order today for Holiday. Mexican Breakfast choices are all delicious.  Staff is very friendly.

13.description: A go to restaurant. Affordable, excellent menu, polite staff, cooler drinks and spacious seating area. First time I ate there the salsa blew my mind, subsequent trips have not been so impressive. Yet, with four stars they're still hanging in there!

4.description: I used to work across the street and always went there for lunch. I believe the steak tacos are the best I ever had! Never got a piece of chewy fat in my steak taco either .The waitresses always speak to me in Spanish but I'm white lol. Great little place with quality food.

6.description: Damn, now I need to find more reasons to head out to Midway Airport where this place is located.  As I expected, it's located in a fairly non-descript commercial area of Cicero and easy to pass up if you're not looking for it.Interior has brown porcelain tile floor with 5 booths, three tables and some stools along the "bar." Table clothes are in either torquois or orange. Bar/kitchen/cashier looks like a little hut and has a fridge for drinks along the far wall.  Pretty no frills, but it was clean.Sat down and was served a basket of excellent chips and awesome salsa. I've always been a fan of a little heat along with the salsa being thick. This is the first place where I found what I believe is the perfect salsa - awesome balance of tomatoes, peppers, onions and cilantro.Then came my burrito - chicken and added guacamole - and it was served cut in half.  Nice serving size where it wasn't a football and well layered with slightly smokey and marinated chicken, chihuahua cheese, lettuce and the guacamole. It was awesome. First time I didn't miss a Chipotle burrito.Highly recommend if you're in the area.

15.description: La Cebollita is the perfect "hole in the wall" mexican restaurant.  The food is so delicious.  I have never had a better tasting gordita than the ones from La Cebollita.  In fact, I'd recommend anything from their menu.  My co-workers and I order delivery from here almost weekly.  The service is always quick and friendly.They have a small lot for parking, or you could park on a neighborhood street since there isn't permit parking there.

7.description: The pozole is outstanding!  Guacamole is pretty good too.  Next time I'd like to try their tamales.

8.description: The steak tacos were good but the chips were horrible... The salsa tried  saving the chips but couldn't. Maybe earlier during the day they're better. The prices for tacos were kinda pricey too.

14.description: My husband and I decided to give this place a try on a Sunday afternoon and have been going back for their tacos de pastor and carnitas. The pastor tacos are served with small pieces of pineapple. I find that this gives it a distinct flavor and is very similar to what you will find in Mexico. Not alot of places serve them like this. The carnitas are fresh and are only served on the weekends. When you arrive they greet you with chips and three different kinds of salsas. All are very good so I find myself adding all three to different sections of my tacos. The sopes de asada and tacos de chicharron are good as well. We tend to order the same things over and over. I had ordered their pozole once and I was highly disappointed with it. The meat was shredded and the broth was very thick. This taqueria is pretty small but we always seem to find a seat. They have alot of pick-up orders from what I have noticed. The waitresses are very attentive and they make you feel right at home.

1.description: Everything is cooked to order and made with pride. The banana shake is my favorite drink. The chilaquiles are my favorite dish.

0.description: My family has going here for years. This is one of my favorite Mexican restaurants. They don't try to be fancy, it is just good honest Mexican food as it should be. Also these prices are ridiculously low for the quality of the food. Also these prices are ridiculously low for the quality of the food.

1.description: How sad is when you go at this Dollar Tree and see E's with no common sense and cero/poor CUSTOMER SERVICE... Attitude in LIFE IS PRICELESS... Cashier Virginia needs to change job position, maybe on the back that no one sees Her... Extremely Poor Management.

2.description: Dvd's for a Dollar

0.description: I am a dollar tree fanatic because everything is definitely a dollar.  It like those other stores who claim a dollar and then something is $2. This location just expanded and has a bigger variety which is always good. Also they do have groceries so go for it. Although potted meat should be illegal at dollar stores.  Party needs? Get it here. Need garden supplies? Ummmm come in! Need women's sanitary napkins? Oh boy, you really need a new job!I like the fact that I can buy items and recreate them for a fraction of cost, and as a crafter, this place takes me there. I can glue a glass plate and saucer and it becomes a bird feeder once I add a few other things. Cards are usually 2 for $1 so that again, with the quality they have, is really a good deal. Now they are stocking up with better quality food items (is that even possible)? Steak (frozen) for $1? Wow, that's something you never see. But of course, they call it better quality and I call it business. Check em' out and decide, and remember they are now taking coupons!

3.description: I call this particular target "Tar-ghetto"PROSStarbucksFree WifiCONSunorganizedDirtyCan never find what I'm looking forNo AlcoholPacked

1.description: I purchased a $50 gift certificate and a card. When leaving the store I realize I didn't have the gift card in my bag. I went back in the store and let them know what happened. Jose was the manager that I spoke to and he had me waiting for a couple of minute. He then explained that there was nothing that could be done. Brittany and lil were also helping. I was starting to get frustrated because I just left the store when it happened. Lil then said she would see what they can do. After 10 more minutes waiting they finally gave me a new card. They cancelled the card and activated a new one. Lil and Brittany were super helpful and made my visit to target a pleasant one.

2.description: I really don't like this Target because I can never really seem to find the stuff that I'm looking for as well as it just seems that customers just go around grabbing stuff and putting it in places where it doesn't belong and makes the store really trashy.

9.description: This is my backup Target when the one closest to me does not have the items I am searching for.. same friendly folks.. same everything you would expect from a Target. SCORE!!

10.description: GREAT !  service...... ESPECIALLY my interaction with Jorge he was VERY helpful.

4.description: I've never had any issues with customer service at this Target. I come here atleast twice a week and I always find what I'm looking for. The store is well organized and has a Pizza Hut and Starbucks inside.

6.description: I was on my way to visit a friend and I stopped by this Target store to pick up a card, a pack of gum, and to use the restroom....the store was busy. I walked into the restroom and it had just been cleaned so that was a plus. I then went to the card section...took a few moments to select my card and headed toward checkout. As I was standing in line I got my pack of gum, I was in line for about 1 minute before I heard the front end supervisor call for "back up cashiers". I was in and out of the store in less then 10 minutes. It is what I would expect from a Target Store.

11.description: This review is for the pharmacy....I love Target stores in general. They all are pretty much the same in the city of Chicago. No real 'super' targets. When I visited the pharmacy at this Target the pharmacist, David Hill, was unbelievably nice. He explained every form that needed to be filled out, when my 'script would be ready, and answered my questions thoroughly. He even gave me a business card in case I had any additional questions. Just a really great experience with this pharmacy and even though Target probably doesn't care that I get my $4 prescription there I will continue to go to their pharmacy because I trust and like the pharmacist.

5.description: They don't sell alcohol! Every single Target that I've been to sells alcohol, but why not this store? I needed to pick up a bottle of something for a party I was going to on the southside. I saw Target and decided to get something from here. I looked and looked and saw nothing. I asked an employee if they sold alcohol and was was like no! Uhh ok thanks for the attitude lady. I guess not all Target stores are created equal.

7.description: Worst check out experience of my life. Delia was my cashier and she was rude, harsh, and mean. I had coupons and Delia told me "People have committed coupon fraud, so I now have to treat EVERYONE like they are going to commit coupon fraud". I had to pull all 20 of my items OUT OF THE BAGS so she could match up the coupon with the products. THAT HAS NEVER happened to me before, and I shop at Target 1-2 times a week with coupons.That was the first and last time I will ever shop at that Target thanks to the worst check out experience via Delia, who told me "I have been here for 7 years, so I know more than you do". She ACTUALLY said that to me.

8.description: Ok, I'm back to being a fan! It is Target, can't stay mad!

0.description: While me and my sister were in there about last week, a worker who i believe may have been a manager. Her name was Jaclyn and she helped me and my sister carry the bags to put them in our cart. we have a lot of pain issues and she had no problem helping us and was super kind to us. Cant not explain how great it was to see a great person like that.

3.description: Great food and service, best langostinos and mussels in Chicago! Shrimp and cheese stuffed chicken is one of my kids favorites!

1.description: This place is my second favorite seafood restruant. Their mussel appitezer is very good. I usually order the pineapple or the 7 seafood soup. The place could be bigger and staff are ok.

2.description: Great tasting food places are reasonable the service is good and it's BYOB!!! I highly recommend the cceviche! Also make sure you try the mejillones and a michelada . You can also catch some good live music in there , they are there usually Friday and Saturday nights !

9.description: DO NOT come here! I loved this place but the last couple of times I've been here I have been disappointed and today I was just plain mad with the terrible service I received. I had to wait about 30 minutes to be seated, only to get the smallest table in the entire restaurant and mind you it was four of us dining in. We were super hungry so we just let it slide, we again had to wait for our order to be taken which was again another 20 minutes or so, and this was after we waved the waitress over a couple of times. She finally took our orders and in all seriousness it took about 40 minutes for just our appetizers to come out, I don't know if it's because they are understaffed or they are just unorganized. We weren't the only table that was impatiently waiting for their food to come out. When it finally did my order was wrong, I was very upset! I will NEVER be coming back to this place!

10.description: Very disappointed!!! Food was not all that great, waitresses are not attentive and very unorganized. Our check and food took too long to get to us even though it was not really busy, never coming here again!!

4.description: The only thing missing is a bad ass salsa but who cares! Everything else here is delicious! They do it better than any other mariscos place around so be prepared to be delighted with the food. My favorite is langostinos but the stuffed pineapple was soo good! Oh and their ceviche is very fresh and yumm!!!! Its byob so drink it up and enjoy some good ol Mexican seafood.

6.description: The place has a huge menu of cocktails!  They are a BYOB establishment.  The are usually quick to serve & the staff is consistently nice.  The only reason I didn't give it full stars is that most times, because it gets ridiculously full most evenings, it is way too loud to enjoy & as a result, you wait even longer for assistance & food delivery.  Other than that, the food is great

11.description: Simply the best Mexican seafood place. The prices are cheap and the food is excellent.

5.description: Probably my favorite mariscos place. The Langostinos are super flavorful along with the camarones a la diabla and the shrimp cocktail. Overall they have Great food, good service. I definitely recommend this! It is BYOB also!!

7.description: BEST LANGOSTINOS IN CHICAGO!! Take my word for it I set out a mission to try langostinos from all Mexican seafood restaurants and this one is by far the best! Food is great, and its BYOB :)

8.description: So obsessed with this place its almost concerning.  Such good food, spacious, and a live cute little one man band on the Friday we came.  Love the stuffed pineapple and a la diabla.  Pretty much anything on the menu you'll be happy with.  Nice staff as well as fitting prices for large portions!  Always wishing I had more left overs for dayssssss!

0.description: Everybody is entitled to their own opinion but I LOOOVVVVEEEEE this place!!! My husband and I love to try different restaurants all the time but we just can't cheat on El Cangrejo with another seafood restaurant. We have always received the best service ever and the food is just too good. I love the Botana Cangrejo. I can never let that appetizer pass us up. My husband loves the Chapuzon or the Filete Relleno. Really anything you try is very tasty and extremely fresh. Even the shrimp in the shrimp cocktails are extremely good and not gummy at all.Try it out. Take your wine or beers and have a blast.

1.description: Love the fact that they have a pretty good car wash. They are always open (well not the car wash) but the store is. It is a small place but big enough to have a variety of items to fit your needs. Need a condom, hello! Need tire fix a flat, they got you. But they also have food items and small toiletries to get you through the day. The car wash is pretty much from a few dollars to under $10 to get the undercarriage cleaned. Just make sure to save your receipt if you decide not to wash this time around.

0.description: Always great service.  Friendly employees.

3.description: Watch out when they charge your credit card. It is always more than the total they tell you. They want you to pay card processing fees for them, so they add it on the top of the price. When i asked why, she told me the bank charges me that : ))) Food was so so at best, so i will not be going there again.Btw, the charge was only 55 cents more than the amount on the receipt but that will not stop me to contact City of Chicago Consumer Services.Be careful!

1.description: Food is supbar, they take forever to put your order together and forget about it if there is more than two people in line. The old lady has an attitude when you bring your oder back because they got it wrong. Will never be back!

2.description: The lady made the wrong order after i called it in because of what she thought she heard. Then threw my breakfast sandwich together real fast! Disgusting! My eggs are dirty looking and nasty!! Just all around bad service and food!!!

5.description: The food is edible.It is pretty gross though. I was willing to eat it when it was cheaper.

6.description: This place used to be my favorite hot dog joint growing up.  I fell in love with Big Baby's and Italian beef here.. I have eaten here sporadically over the past few years, and things haven't been as good as they used to be. The original owners were very nice, ran a tight ship and served great fast food. Today, the hot dog was ok, and the fries were blah.. They changed their fries at somepoint, and they seem to have a coating or batter, reminds me of the BK fries from a few years ago.  Fries are not supposed to be limpy.. This place doesn't seem so great anymore.. Just your average hotdog joint nowadays.

7.description: had a steak and egg sandwich... the price is right but too much pepper and salt... lady was a bit harsh when speaking to customers and needs a bit more customer service experience...

0.description: Pretty good Chicago dog and Italian beef. I would have given them 4 but the beef is a bit salty for my taste. The Chicago dog didn't have the neon green relish. Still a good dog. I just come to expect the odd color.

4.description: The place to go for great Hot Dog stand food. Have been coming here for years, and when it's lunch Time in Chicago, there is no better place to go.  Everything made to order, and made perfectly.

3.description: Came in for a quick lunch and to order some basic wings and soda. I told the gal I was on a lunch break and didn't have much time. She not only did not offer my soda while I waited,  but didn't include a fork (I ordered the boneless wings), and didn't give and ranch dressing.  I had to ask for a fork, and dressing.  Which, when  I asked for some, I was told was another .55 cents. I paid for my meal already by debit card and had no cash.  So I just gave up the idea of having ranch. I wasnt going to buy .55 on my card. She seemed to not care.Service here sucks.

1.description: I don't normally do reviews but I felt like I had to. I had placed an online order like I usually do. All the other times were a success but today. Said it will be delivered in 45 minutes. It's been an hour and 10 minutes so I called to check on it. He said the delivery driver had called and knocked on my door. That no one had answered and when she called, someone picked up and said that they didn't place the order. Funny because I'm sitting in my living room, volumes low and holding my cell phone. Said that she had called the guy at the store while standing in front of my house. All of my blinds are open because I'm also waiting for the UPS truck for a package. She either called the wrong number and went to the wrong house or she's just flat out lying. But why lie?

0.description: Does arrive quickly and the pizza is decent. The breadsticks however are a joke. Not worth the price really and food always arrives lukewarm.

2.description: What a joke. I ordered the new hot dog pretzel crust with pepperoni and spinach so they are just going to give me a old pizza that was sitting there and throw the spinach on. Wtf. I was cooked spinach. Looked like it sat for awhile.

5.description: Pizza is great the delivery is not so good I ordered online two pizzas it told me my order would be at my house in 45min. IT TOOK 1hr and 40min for my pizzas to arrive before that I had called to see what had happened and what I got was they got backed up on orders! How is this my problem!? Just horrible next time I will just pick up!

6.description: For pasta they are nit bad, pizza is okay and ordering online is perfect for someone who is on the go.

7.description: So we all know about pizza huts pizza. it's pretty good so what we are rating on this review is the service. Which was bad. Our server really didn't want to be working as she even mentioned that us. She never checked on us after we got our food and we pretty much were dying of thirst. The food was good and the breadsticks are the best!! I will be back for the breadsticks but the service I can do without. Maybe I'll just stick to the pizza huts inside the target stores.. they are self serve!Enjoy!

8.description: Worst delivery experience ever! Got my pizza and didnt even get my pizza sliced up what kind of bull is this! I have ordered before from here and they have effed up by charging me for extra sodas that i didnt even order the messed up thing was that i used my credit card soo im just going to order from somwhere else

9.description: This place is TERRIBLE! they have TERRIBLE service! i went here because i wanted 50 cent wings, and i had to wait 45 MINUTES FOR THEM! originally i was told 15. but i guess they had more important things to do. 4 families went in and each ordered a lot more than me and my girlfriend did. and they STILL got their food faster then we did. i warn you. tell everyone you know NOT to go here.

10.description: Pizza is good if you are looking for something, cheesy, and greasy. I would not get the wings they taste like fast food chicken nuggets covered in barbecue sauce.

4.description: I love Pizza Hut, they are always quick, my food is always hot and delicious. The wings are amazing! Price is decent.

58.description: We used Pastel! for a recent anniversary celebration at a non-profit organization.  We wanted a custom cake that would serve between 40 and 50 people.  Maria, the owner, was the person who helped us.All I can say is WOW!  The cake we chose was superb with great flavor and moistness.  The design was executed based on our emailing a jpeg over to them.  The actual execution of the design was very good.  When served, we received numerous compliments and inquiries on where we purchased the cake.Additionally, the customer service was outstanding.  Maria was great -- informative, patient, and professional.  The cake was ready as promised and at the right temperature.  They even helped me out to the car.Pastel!'s prices are lower than most Chicago bakeries and represent great value.  We had more than enough cake for the price.  This is an undiscovered gem in Chicagoland that needs everyone's patronage.  I, for sure, would go back to them again for any celebration treats.  You won't be disappointed.

56.description: Deserves all it's acclaim and more. Everything I've had here or bought has been good.....coffee, coconut pineapple cake, vanilla cheesecake, tarts, flan, and Mexican wedding cookies.If you're in the area try it and if you're in the area and even had sweets... Buy some. You'll be the hero of your friends or co workers.

29.description: Looks can be deceiving. I purchased a vanilla with chocolate mousse and vanilla with caramel cupcake. Both cupcakes were hard and brittle. The so-called chocolate mouse tasted more like Crisco not sweet or chocolatey. The caramel/vanilla icing on the tasted like butter again not sweet at all. I suggest some quality control be exercised. Truly not impressed! I'm quite puzzled as to how they've received such raving reviews.

42.description: Good Cakes !The only problem is there service is way to slow and the girl at the counter wasn't friendly .

23.description: Love love love love love Pastel! This is the place to go if you live on the Southside and if you don't you won't regret making the trip. I actually like their cakes better than Webers. My favorite is the pineapple coconut followed by the mandarin. The cake bread is moist and the flavor is very refreshing. I have gotten custom cakes made for my son's birthday parties and they did an amazing job with the designs. My guests have enjoyed them and have gone back to get more. You can walk in there and get yourself a slice of cake or many and have your very own cake sampling party at home :)

47.description: A + for their cookies by the pound.  They were like short-bread cookies and they were wonderful.  We also tried some cheesecake, which was not near as good as the cookies.  I could come back and try some more from here!

8.description: Had some of their pineapple and coconut cake and all I can say Is OH MY GOD THIS SH$& IS GOOD!!!!! And I am not a big fan of coconut. Not to sweet and so fluffy! The pineapple inside was fresh and beautifully decorated. Will be back for sure.

31.description: My wedding cake was made by this place 3 years ago. We loved it. Going back to get a slice for our anniversary :)

34.description: Patel! is without a doubt a nice surprise to the area for sweet treats. I myself love the cake they offer.  The pineapple is to die for, but you are not going to get your typical southside bakery sweet treat.  There cakes is nowhere near as sweet as most bakeries in the area. I myself love the cake, but thats me!My Mother and I went to try some cake for my upcoming bridal shower.  We decided against it becaues it just isnt as sweet and I dont think my friends and family will enjoy.  Its a different type of cake.  Not bad. Like I said, I love it!

16.description: Love this family owned operation!!!! Actually...hmm..yes I do believe this is my favorite bakery in Chicago. I almost don't want to post a review for fear that too many people would crowd this hot spot but I like the staff so much I might as well spread the word. Like I said this is a family owned operation so majority of the people I saw entering the shop were friends and  relatives of the workers. The set up is calm (there's a couch and only a couple of tables as well as a bar along the window for individual seaters) They also offer free unlimited wifi.  There is one hour of free parking available but if you sit near the window you can watch your car...I've actually never seen a meter maid. I don't know why this place isn't more popular when nearly every single piece of cake I've tried has been moist, fresh, unique and delicious. I'm not embarrassed to admit that after my first visit I returned and brought my friends for 3 consecutive days in a row. So yes so far I've gone to this location 4 times in 1 week and have sampled every cookie on display (only in the counter- there are larger ones in the cabinet I haven't hit yet) and most of the cakes. Here is my descriptive verdict.Cakes:Best seller: Coconut Pineapple cake. I thought this cake was delicious and the fruits complimented each other wonderfully. If you only plan on coming once...try this cake cause I think it was thee best I've tasted so far and I highly doubt you will be disappointed.Strawberry Cream with Strawberries: Is a close second. One of the friends I took preferred this cake over the coconut so if you are not much of a coconut/pineapple fan then def. order the strawberry. Raspberry Chocolate: Was pretty rich but still moist and decadent. If you have a strong sweet tooth I recommend this treat.Oreo Cookies n Cream: Was probably my least favorite. Only because it tasted pretty typical. Nothing too unique about this order yet still tasty.Caramel cream and Pecan: I loved the Pecan pieces! Overall a satisfactory slice of sugar. =)I have yet to try the orange or the cheesecake. Perhaps on my next visit...now onto the cookies!Cookies:Best Seller: Pecan Bars...and for good reason. Everyone I've allowed to taste these treats agrees that these are the best they have. Perfect coffee cookies.Mexican wedding cake: Also delicious and my second favorite. Crumbly, moist, yummy.Orange cookies: A very nice hint of orange. Do recommend. Macaroons: Wonderfully bite sized. They have a crispy and fairly hard exterior but the inside is so moist and delicious. Definitely one of my favorites here. Chocolate Chip/Pecan cookies: I thought these were pretty good but a little harder to chew than I prefer. My friends noted that this was not their favorite but I liked them just fine.Lemon Balls: Pretty good but I would pass.Mocha cookies: I'm not a huge fan of  coffee flavored goodies but my friend is and she very much enjoyed. Pastitas (Shortbread cookie with raspberry or apricot center): They were okay but I wouldn't reorder. Cinnamon sugar cookies: Pretty good but again not my favorite. The prices here are very reasonable as well. A little over $2 for a slice of cake (Yelp offers a buy one get one free!...hence my indulgence) and the cookies are 0.35 cents each- or about $4 for 1/2lb...cheap! Their coffees are about $2 as well so for as little as $6 I can walk away with a very content palette. Without a doubt, a 5 star 4 visit experience =)

13.description: I just picked up my daughters birthday cake today and we had a nice party for her. OMG the pineapple coconut cake is heavenly. I will be using them all the time! My 30th birthday party 2 years ago was from them and everyone at the party loved it so much!

11.description: I came to Pastel for a last minute birthday cake. They had a good selection of cakes available on the spot and fast and friendly service. I ended up taking home the Strawberries and Cream cake.Yes, the cakes are beautifully decorated and YES, the bread itself is very moist and very deliscious! HOWEVER, I was extremely disappointed with two things: the strawberries and cream. The filling  had a ridiculous amount of whipped cream and very,VERY few strawberries. I'm not joking when I tell you that one slice of cake had more whipped cream than bread itself and only about one tiny slice of strawberry (if you got lucky). I came in here to buy a cake, not a whipped cream filled pie! I had to throw in my own strawberries to accompany all that whipped cream and prevent more than half my "cake" from going to waste. The Strawberries and Cream cake is pretty to look at and great if you can eat a whole can of whipped cream in one sitting. Hope the rest of their cakes are not like this one!

39.description: We were on the hunt for a slice of cake in honor of a loved one, and found Pastel! I think it's too classy and cute for this neighborhood, they should move here to where a community is on the rise, BERWYN! Great cake slices and friendly staff. Yes, the Caramel Pecan Tart is yum.

37.description: AWESOME :) I love this place by far the best cake I have ever tasted they made a beautiful cake for  my sons 2nd birthday and omg it was fantabulous :) My family loved it I hate sweet cakes therefore I can say that this cake was deliciously balanced I asked for almost no sugar and thats exactly what I got I LOVE THEM :) I can't wait to pick up my brothers graduation cake tomorrow just becuase I know its going to be delicious :) OH and the prices are SPECTACULAR reasonable and well earned :)

0.description: I recently had my engagement party and bought my cake from here. I loved that not only was the cake beautifully decorated but  they did not overcharge and were willing to work with me on my budget. Everyone at the party took pictures of my cake and asked where I bought it. I love this bakery and they truly make the tastiest cakes ever. These cakes not only look professional every time I buy from them, but always leave everyone wanting more.

38.description: We've ordered from this place for every single one of our events over the last 4 years.  We've been getting cakes from them before they had a store and the owner was baking them out of her house.  We've got 3 kids so we're talking about bdays, baptisms, and a communion.  We're honestly doing about 5 cakes/cupcakes a year from this place.  The cakes don't get any better.  Our favorite is the cajeta cake.  Their cakes taste phenomenal and their designs are great.  I'm only giving them 3 stars because lately they've been messing up our orders.  Listen, when you're paying +$200 for a cake you shouldn't have any screw ups in the design...especially now that they've got this process where they draw the picture and list all the details on the receipt and make you sign it.  The day of the party is stressful enough the last thing you need is a freaking screw up with your cake order.  Our last two events have seen us get the wrong amount of cupcakes and missing designs on our cake.  How would you like that....to be short a few cupcakes at a kids party or to have the cross on your kid's communion cake missing when it is drawn right there on the freaking receipt?  Then, on top of that, you've got to wait to get it fixed...as if the day wasn't stressful enough.  I can't bash this place completely because, like I said, their cakes are phenomenal, but lately it seems as if the staff isn't paying enough attention to detail.  One more strike and they're out.  Hopefully they'll straighten themselves out because I sure do love that cajeta cake.

51.description: I really like this place! I first frequented Pastel! a little over 2 years ago, after eating at Birrieria Zaragoza (seems to be the trend here). they have a nice selection & the space is adorable. very contemporary & modern, design wise. there is almost always street parking (meter free, yay!) & are open daily. I have had their cake slices, cookies, tarts & cupcakes. loved the cookie selection (sold by the lb or 35 cents each), the cajeta tart is amazing & their cake slices are very good. sadly, I wasn't a fan of their cupcakes (the frosting was kinda heavy & bland) but that won't stop me from frequenting the bakery. they also make pretty amazing cakes for special occasions; check out their pics they have posted. my friend has had Pastel! make cakes for her family for a few occasions this past year & has raved about them.if you are in the area, please check them out! conveniently located on South Pulaski Rd; about 1 minute south of the Pulaski I55 exit.

27.description: Pastel's PROVED once again it is the BEST bakery in Chicago!!! It was my son's 6th Birthday & Pastel's created another 3-dimensional masterpiece! They created a Southpaw (White Sox's mascot) cake w/the White Sox colors! It was beautiful & delicious!

32.description: Funny, I read all these great reviews and wonder if I was in an alternate universe version of Pastel! I will never go here again. I had a groupon and ordered a birthday cake.  I ordered it decorated for my daughter the birthday girl. They sounded less than thrilled over the phone. I should have known... When I picked it up... a. it wasn't ready or they couldn't find it. I waited for over 15 min while they "looked for it"b. it wasn't decorated when they finally had itc. they were unbelievably rude! d. she snottily told me that they "do not decorate groupon cakes", I told them that if this had been mentioned on the phone I would have paid extra. She just stared at me. I asked if she could just write Happy Birthday on it.. she refused! This was a bday cake for a kid.. This was late as I was picking up cake for the party (and I'd already waited since they didn't have the cake).The cake I brought back was not so great (red velvet), kinda dry. I wondered if they "found" a day old cake for me. Ultimately, their attitude said it all. I will NEVER go to this place again. There are better bakeries nearby that value their customers and treat them with decency AND sell beautifully decorated, delicious cakes.

54.description: WHOA! Finally decided to stop by once I saw that they had fresh fruit and yogurt in cups! All it took was facebook and I said I would be there after work. So I ordered a banana and apple parfait and a berries parfait. Not bad, since I am writing this a few days after the fact, and I have already stopped by another time after. I do have ONE thing that I was bothered by. Well, the first time I went I was told the cupcakes would be $1.25 but of course I was able to get a taste of one, which was okay (although not the caliber of the Cupcakes for Courage or the Flirty Cupcakes I am accustomed to), but why should they be, the others are over $3.25 and $3.75 respectively, but still $1.25 a cupcake here is really not bad.  Now the next day I returned and bought two more parfaits and a few other things such as lemon meringue tart and the other a fruit tart that I used my YELP check-in to get for FREE! Also ordered 4 cupcakes but this time I was told that the cupcakes are $1.50. Now correct me if I am wrong, wasn't I just told the day before they were $1.25? THIS IS THE ONLY THING THAT I WAS PERTURBED BY, but I could still live with the $1.50 per cupcake, as I really was impressed with the place and want to YELP them out to get  more exposure. I like the fact that they do offer free WI FI and a comfortable "lounge" area with really nice furniture and art. I was pleasantly surprised that the place really makes you feel at home. The fact that you can just come and order a coffee and dessert is awesome, and West Lawn needed this. Now the clincher is I was just informed that they have been around since 2008, but hello I am just finally coming in? Damian, shame on you. Check them out and don't forget to use your YELP check in since they do freebies and you all know that as ELITE YELPer's, free is always good. Hmmmm, do I detect a YELP hang out here soon. Stay Tuned.

48.description: You have to try their pumpkin cheesecake which is in season now for  the Fall.  I ordered one for my son's birthday and it was almost completely gone by the time he got a slice.  I'm ordering another for Thanksgiving dinner since the lady told me that they will carry this cake all winter.  Pastel has excellent coffee and all sorts of delicious pastries.  The last one I tried was the Caramel chocolate tart.  OMG!  The caramel inside of the tart (which is really Mexican cajeta) started oozing out after the first bite.  It is a very sweet pastry so you may need a tall  cold glass of milk to follow it up with.  They have a small family style eating area with two couches.  My BF and I decided to sit on the stools by the window and read the paper.  Great, friendly service and good cakes for those special occasions.

44.description: My best friend and her husband ordered their wedding cake from here and it was amazing. We scheduled a tasting and it was so difficult to decide on the cake they were all so amazingly delicious. The cake was ready on time and it looked perfect. A picture of it is now on display in the front window (blue cake w/ silver ribbon)It's also a little cafe I've had their veggie panini very good as well. And their cookies are addictive. I definitely recommend this place to anyone looking for a cafe, place for lunch, or specialty cakes.

24.description: The inside isn't particularly well decorated, but the sweets and sandwiches are great and definitely less expensive than other cafes. ($1.85 for a cupcake, $3.75 for a turkey sandwhich). The employees are friendly too - they even gave me a free bottle of water when I asked for a cup of tap water.

7.description: They have delicious cakes but I was a bit disappointed because they did my gender party cake wrong. My first child & I went all out at my gender party & the cake was obviously the focus point. It was supposed to be pink or blue inside to determine what gender baby I was having & it had none!! Mind you I didn't know what I was having so it was pretty important to me.

49.description: I have been going to Pastel since it first opened, and the quality of their pastries is just the same, or better (by better I mean their coffee!!, it's a must-try item).  They are very costumer oriented, the women at the counter are both helpful and friendly...Now, their pastries are simply amazing. I am particularly a fan of their pumpkin cheese cake, lemon tart, carrot cake, red velvet annnnd their donuts!! One bite of them and they have the ability to take you back, they taste just like the donuts I had in Mexico as a child :) I enjoy seeing new items added or seasonal items in their menu, it is both refreshing and exciting.  They are now selling cake pops for Halloween, I had never seen anything like it so I was a bit hesitant to try them at first, but that cake pop is delicious!! (chocolate brownie inside, then covered with chocolate)I am hoping they add another group-on offer soon, I bought the one they had about a month back; I think it was 18 cupcakes for $16.  I took these cupcakes to a party and everyone...I really mean everyone, who tried them raved about them.Great job Pastel!! keep up the fantastic work.sincerely,a presently, and extremely satisfied costumer.

40.description: I just went in yesterday and bought about 6 cupcakes and all of them were very hard and dry. I think this place is very nice addition to the neighborhood but the quality of the cupcakes needs to improve greatly.  If they are better known for their cakes, just stick to cakes.

53.description: Wow!! is this place good. So I was at a niece's party and they served the most delicious cake. It was a 2 tier cake, rich chocolate on top and vanilla and fruit at the bottom, so I asked and was surprised that it was from this place. Not because I didn't think that they would be good, but because my family  lives in Portage, IN. So it is a bit of a drive. So I decided to check this place out and just wow. I was there with a friend on Saturday and we ordered coffee, a few cookies, 2 cupcakes and 2 pieces of cake. Everything was really good but what stood out was the strawberry cake, it was so good. Perfectly balanced and with a strong fresh strawberry flavor. The drink selection could be a little bigger. Delicious cakes and cookies. make sure to try the strawberry cake

30.description: The cakes are to die for. Friendly service. Excellent. Street parking makes it hard to get to location on busy Pulaski rd. why didn't I give it a five star? Well it's a bit pricey products are different but with our economical budgets lol.

46.description: Pretty much every member of my family (South Side) buys their cakes from Pastel.The reason being.............. They SNAP!I've been a loyal Pastel customer for about 4 years now and don't see that changing any time soon.Their cakes are moist and the fillings are delicious. They have many options to choose from and its conveniently a few blocks away from my house.Just a great establishment with friendly and helpful staff.

1.description: Despite this bakery being way out of way for us coming from the North Side we make the trek because honestly their cakes and gelatinas are top notch. I have ordered cakes from here on at least 4 occasions and each time I am asked where did I buy the delicious cake. You will get good quality here and they are always willing to accommodate you. The cakes have just the right amount of sweetness and fluffiness to them. Yes..they are a bit on the pricey side but I am willing to dish out a bit more money if I know I will get a cake with quality ingredients and not something that is mostly layered with frosting..or whip cream....Like I said quality aside...this would probably be considered more of a "boutique bakery" hence the higher prices.
