Besides the prices..another clue that you are not just in a "regular"  bakery is when they sell the tres leches slices in cups rather than square containers (BOMBON bakery comes to mind). I do not know if there is a special reasoning why this is but that is my observation of the more "upscale-y" bakeries. "Supposedly" as I was told by one of the owners at the Cakes and more bakery is so that the milk doesn't drip out from the cake...which I can see the logic behind that..there is always excess milk coming out from the slices placed in the box containers...because I was craving a slice or should I say a cup of cake....I proceeded to shell out the $4 something that they charge for a teeny amount of cake in a cup. While it was phenomenal..to my dismay I noticed it had a lot of whip cream on top that it took almost half of the cup....that is when I got mad....first they really are overcharging for their teeny portions but second they cheat the customer because they put a lot of whip cream on them.....soooo...while their cakes are out of this world....so are their prices....

55.description: I don't like sweets BUT my wife and son seem to like it as well as the rest of her family. I ordered a cake from Pastel for a 25th wedding anniversary ONLY PROBLEM is cake said ANIVERSARY. Lol

9.description: This has got to be the only place where you can pick up a cake without ordering it and have it taste like it was made in Heaven.

26.description: Very cute little pastry shop.Have been here for almost 2 hours now just hanging out, working from my laptop and munching on cookies and cake :DLove love the chocolate chip cookie and pecan bar!This is definitely a family run family spot- all the customers that came in while my roommate and I were hanging out here were parents and kids.The only thing that was missing was music, and when we mentioned that to the cashier she turned on a little ambiance music for us hahaIf you open up the sweets cabinet to the right of the counter be prepared to get slapped in the face with wonderful aromas of fresh baked pastries!P.S. make sure to check-in on yelp to get buy one get one cake slices!

25.description: Love this family owned operation!!!! Actually...hmm..yes I do believe this is my favorite bakery in Chicago. I almost don't want to post a review for fear that too many people would crowd this hot spot but I like the staff so much I might as well spread the word. Like I said this is a family owned operation so majority of the people I saw entering the shop were friends and  relatives of the workers. The set up is calm (there's a couch and only a couple of tables as well as a bar along the window for individual seaters) They also offer free unlimited wifi.  There is one hour of free parking available but if you sit near the window you can watch your car...I've actually never seen a meter maid. I don't know why this place isn't more popular when nearly every single piece of cake I've tried has been moist, fresh, unique and delicious. I'm not embarrassed to admit that after my first visit I returned and brought my friends for 3 consecutive days in a row. So yes so far I've gone to this location 4 times in 1 week and have sampled every cookie on display (only in the counter- there are larger ones in the cabinet I haven't hit yet) and most of the cakes. Here is my descriptive verdict.Cakes:Best seller: Coconut Pineapple cake. I thought this cake was delicious and the fruits complimented each other wonderfully. If you only plan on coming once...try this cake cause I think it was thee best I've tasted so far and I highly doubt you will be disappointed.Strawberry Cream with Strawberries: Is a close second. One of the friends I took preferred this cake over the coconut so if you are not much of a coconut/pineapple fan then def. order the strawberry. Raspberry Chocolate: Was pretty rich but still moist and decadent. If you have a strong sweet tooth I recommend this treat.Oreo Cookies n Cream: Was probably my least favorite. Only because it tasted pretty typical. Nothing too unique about this order yet still tasty.Caramel cream and Pecan: I loved the Pecan pieces! Overall a satisfactory slice of sugar. =)I have yet to try the orange or the cheesecake. Perhaps on my next visit...now onto the cookies!Cookies:Best Seller: Pecan Bars...and for good reason. Everyone I've allowed to taste these treats agrees that these are the best they have. Perfect coffee cookies.Mexican wedding cake: Also delicious and my second favorite. Crumbly, moist, yummy.Orange cookies: A very nice hint of orange. Do recommend. Macaroons: Wonderfully bite sized. They have a crispy and fairly hard exterior but the inside is so moist and delicious. Definitely one of my favorites here. Chocolate Chip/Pecan cookies: I thought these were pretty good but a little harder to chew than I prefer. My friends noted that this was not their favorite but I liked them just fine.Lemon Balls: Pretty good but I would pass.Mocha cookies: I'm not a huge fan of  coffee flavored goodies but my friend is and she very much enjoyed. Pastitas (Shortbread cookie with raspberry or apricot center): They were okay but I wouldn't reorder. Cinnamon sugar cookies: Pretty good but again not my favorite. The prices here are very reasonable as well. A little over $2 for a slice of cake (Yelp offers a buy one get one free!...hence my indulgence) and the cookies are 0.35 cents each- or about $4 for 1/2lb...cheap! Their coffees are about $2 as well so for as little as $6 I can walk away with a very content palette. Without a doubt, a 5 star 4 visit experience =)

12.description: Finally! A nice spot to have a latte and pastries. It's nicely decorated and the menu somewhat limited, but considering the demographics, don't expect this place to have lots of traffic throughout the day or weekends...but it's a start in the right direction.I purchased a hot chocolate and a latte for the wifey, which were very good.  My only concern is the freshness of there pastries. The red velvet cupcake I bought was hard and tasteless and was charged full price!! It must have been a few days old...they should warn customers of this and provide discounts for aged goods.Will give them another try soon.

59.description: Awesome Cake! I decided to try this place after hearing some of my friends saying it has great cakes. Bought one for my daughter's bday and it was one of the best cakes I ever ate! I had ordered the vanilla cake with strawberry filling. The cake was moist and the filling of strawberries and cream was smooth and fresh! Got compliments on the cake. We decided to order for my other daughter's bday! Same awesome quality! This is the place I now order cakes from now on!

21.description: I order a cake for my birthday on the 12/31/13 and it was half chocolate with caramel pecan and the other half was pineapple coconut. I LOVED it.... My favorite was the pineapple coconut it was moist and not to sweet.. The Price I payed for it was $112.00 and it was for about 20 people but I had more the 25 people at my house for a party and two cakes and no one wanted the other cake.. I had enough for everybody plus leftovers, I will definitely recommend you get or at least try there cakes.

17.description: A fantastic place with even more amazing cakes and desserts. I definitely recommend their Red Velvet cake/cupcake. It is, to this date, my TOP PICK. The service is fantastic, the prices are appropriate and the venue is so cute!

10.description: This is a nice place located near the airport. They had great customer service. There was a photo book in the front so you can view their many designed cakes. I got the cookies and cream and the coconut pineapple. The cake had a whipped icing and you could taste that it wasn't fresh. It tasted like it had been sitting in the freezer. I must say the cake slices are good portions and the designs are elegant. Taste is where they lost the stars.... Whipped icing can't be frozen. :-(

5.description: Reading my future in the frosting? I'm thinking I may have to find a way to embrace the "boo box" experience. Five star all around until the box. (Pic) Presentation should be carried through. No frosting upon the top just as you don't want cheese slathered all over the top of a pizza box. It seems pretty straightforward to me. It kills me to do four because this shop is otherwise perfect.The cakes are all that!!!  They ARE just like flavored air. Incredibly light and fresh and moist. There's also giant cookies and sime other goodies. The service is heavenly sweet without even expecting a tip. (She was shocked, actually). (And that shocked me back ;) The place is simple. A table, couches, and a short counter at a window where the view of the street is blocked off from inside. The coffee is steaming hot but was weak. I'd do an espresso next time. I happened to ask a couple people for directions and I got to work on my Spanish on the first occasion. The second time, an older gentleman with a weathered face simply shouted "POLISH!" at me. I think I thanked him in Russian!

3.description: Cupcakes were really stale and very dry. Cake slices were ok. I was really disappointed, I will give it another try, maybe I caught them on a bad or slow day. I love that you can eat there and it looks like a cozy place to hang out.

35.description: Cakes from Pastel are AMAZING!!! I decided to go with them because they were very affordable and they had a lot of options for cake flavors. I had a 4 tier cake, 2 red velvet layers, 1 strawberry and cream layer, and one called "cajeta con nuez", which is best described as nutella and nut. Everyone loved our cake! It looked beautiful and was also very moist. Best part, we paid about 1/2 of what other bakeries wanted to charge us for the same cake. I am now planning on using them for other family parties. Other things I have tried are their paninis and their bolio with cream cheese and jalapeno. The panini is the reason they are getting 4 stars, they used pretty gross deli meat. So I cannot reccomend that. There bolio was SOOOOOO good, very flavorful!A++ in my book :)

19.description: I love this place and their cakes. I ordered my wedding cake from here and it came out lovely!  We had half vanilla with strawberries and cream and the other half chocolate with the caramel pecan. The cookies on top, however, we're not made by them. I special ordered them from Sweet Mandy B's. The cake was moist and delicious and came exactly when they said the only reason I gave them 4 stars was that they forgot to bring my wedding cake toppers and they didn't arrive with them until an hour later.

28.description: Went to the bakery 2 times to buy their already made cakes. The last one felt soggy as it had been too long refrigerated. Note to self -next time order the cake ahead of time so that it can be fresh.

45.description: The cakes here are great, but the girls working here are beyond rude! Seriously, the customer service here is HORRIBLE. These girls have the worst attitude! Never again!!!

33.description: I heard the cakes were delicious so I bought one for my friend's birthday. I bought the oreo one? I hadn't pre-ordered the cake but wow. The cake blew my socks off.. It was delicious.Fresh and not too sweet. I will be back.

43.description: I got here on a rainy Chicago afternoon, and the place was completely empty, but still selling there famous cakes and Mexican pastries. I got the yelp deal, which was a free slice of cake, and WOW, its was amazing! It was a Coconut-Pineapple cake, and it was so soft & moist, and the not too sweet, and just divine flavors of Coconut and Pineapple flavors!! (5/5)I also got a slice of Cheesecake, and it was average,a little stale at first, so nothing that special at all. (3/5) But I did also get a Jalapeno-Cheese bread, and it was all golden brown and well baked and soft, very good bread!! (5/5)Overall, this place lacks an ambiance for people to stay and eat their cakes and pastries, but I think its most take out and people come here to order all their birthday and anniversary cakes.  It does have a small lounge in the center, but nothing too special.Very impressed by the cakes here, and even the pastries, so I hope to come back here again to try some more!!!

2.description: I'm a sucker for deals.  It's so easy to justify buying something when it's coming to you at a discounted price.  So when Yelp informed me that Pastel had a BOGO deal on slices of cake, I detoured to the bakery in the blink of an eye.Walking into the empty store, I was confused as to why there wasn't a long line of sweet-tooth deal seekers like me, yet I was delighted knowing there was plenty of cake inside the glass case for me to choose from.  The woman behind the counter kindly explained the flavor of each of the six cakes.  With my BOGO deal, I selected the cookies 'n cream and the caramel-pecan, both of which looked equally tall, rectangular, decorated, and appetizing.  I happily skipped out of the store, eager to taste my purchases.I took three bites of each cake, finishing neither of them, not because they were over-the-top sweet and indulgent, but rather because my taste buds categorized the cake slices as "just okay".  The top and middle layers of frosting were whipped, and while generously spread and contained small surprises in the middle layer (actual caramel on the caramel-pecan, plenty of crumbled chocolate cookies on the cookies 'n cream), I wasn't the biggest fan of the fluffy texture combined with those add-in's.  I wished I was indulging in a smooth, thick buttercream frosting.  The cake itself had the consistency and taste of a standard cake one would purchase at a grocery store's bakery.  Although it's not a knock against Pastel, it didn't elevate my thoughts about the cake either.In short, I learned the hard way that not every 5-star deal guarantees you a 5-star quality.

18.description: I order a cake for my birthday on the 12/31/13 and it was half chocolate with caramel pecan and the other half was pineapple coconut. I LOVED it.... My favorite was the pineapple coconut it was moist and not to sweet.. The Price I payed for it was $112.00 and it was for about 20 people but I had more the 25 people at my house for a party and two cakes and no one wanted the other cake.. I had enough for everybody plus leftovers, I will definitely recommend you get or at least try there cakes.

41.description: I ordered the pineapple coconut cake for a coworker, it's THE BEST EVER! it's like tres leches but with pina colada!! Gorgeous cake too!

52.description: REALLY disappointed! I used a groupon and no where on the groupon did it state that butter cream would be extra $$. When I mentioned that I didn't like whipped cream cake they wouldn't budge and insisted it would cost extra. I've never heard of a bakery not offering both options. I was, however, fine with paying extra for decoration even though that also was not mentioned on the groupon. The cake tasted like the "refrigerator". Out of the 12 people that I had only 2 people told me that they liked the cake, and one of them was 8 years old. The cake was really moist which is a nice change, but I will definitely not return.

50.description: omg where do i begin i never write reviews or even joined anything like this at all i went here to pastel cakes and more and i was very impressed the young lady at the counter was helpful i went there on a recomendation from a friend and I tried the cajeta tart (caramel tart ) wow is all I have to say just one bite and the cajeta oozes out yummmmyyyy lol also had the mexican wedding cookies and the vanilla flan and strawberry cake not all in the same day hahaha I can't believe I just found out about this place they have a selection of paninis as well I must try rhem soon ! And coffees it is an awesome little place hope you make it there

4.description: Delicious and affordable cake; really good customer service...love it.I recommend them 100%

6.description: They did an amazing job! Not only was the cake beautiful in so many ways, it was also delicious. You only usually get one or the other so I was extremely surprised. All of my party guests loved it. They let me choose different flavors in each tier so everyone got what they wanted. The flavors aren't typical either- one of the fillings tasted like a snickers bar. Overall great experience- I'll be back to order again next year!

22.description: Finally! A nice spot to have a latte and pastries. It's nicely decorated and the menu somewhat limited, but considering the demographics, don't expect this place to have lots of traffic throughout the day or weekends...but it's a start in the right direction.I purchased a hot chocolate and a latte for the wifey, which were very good.  My only concern is the freshness of there pastries. The red velvet cupcake I bought was hard and tasteless and was charged full price!! It must have been a few days old...they should warn customers of this and provide discounts for aged goods.Will give them another try soon.

15.description: Happy to have a pastry shop in the South side, super cute, great selection and good service.

57.description: They have a picture on their fb page of my cake (orange one with dots and a lion on top for Matteo's 1st bday)! Too bad I received the cake falling apart and wasn't given any REAL solutions when we called the bakery. The place is great... Until you run into a problem

20.description: I love this place and their cakes. I ordered my wedding cake from here and it came out lovely!  We had half vanilla with strawberries and cream and the other half chocolate with the caramel pecan. The cookies on top, however, we're not made by them. I special ordered them from Sweet Mandy B's. The cake was moist and delicious and came exactly when they said the only reason I gave them 4 stars was that they forgot to bring my wedding cake toppers and they didn't arrive with them until an hour later.

36.description: Some moons back, I got in on the Groupon love action and was prothe option of a nine inch cake or 18 cupcakes. Being ever the Groupon procrastinator, I used it roughly sixty seconds before it expired. My oldest daughter turned five in March, and given her love for bakeries in general, I uncharacteristically decided to chance it and order her birthday cake from Pastel!. She chose a chocolate cake with cookies and cream filling, topped with whipped cream (sounds delish, right?!). Well, let's put it this way. The whole thing was devoured in a single night.Granted, we had a handful or two of people over to celebrate, but everyone who so much as looked at the cake went wild over it. I did not hear a single derogatory remark about the beautiful cake from Pastel!. Aesthetically, it was very elegant but fun (and large--come on, she's only five...the bigger the better!) and the inside was sheer heaven. Melt-in-your mouth chocolate cake (not overly sweet, not at all crumbly), the mousse was as light as air, and the whipped topping was authentic without the slightest hint of artificial, well, anything. Would I go back? Of course. They're not crazy expensive (although you'll pay more than you for a cake made from Jewel, per se), but you get what you pay for. If you pay for a mouthful of deliciousness from Pastel!, let me tell you...you'll find it to be money well spent. :)

14.description: I ordered a custom cake for my son's birthday. The cake was beautifully decorated (it looked better than the picture I provided) but the flavor was absent! The worst tasting cake I've ever had! It had absolutely no flavor and it wasn't cheap! What a disappointment.

58.description: My Kids are a Fan of Red Lobster.. It used to be the 'IN" Place to go back in my Younger Days but I must say... This has to be one of the most Undesirable Locations;.. honestly it's a bit on the ghetto side. The wait is always horribles.. And you always seem to be in the presence of the next Don Juan Reject. I've gone to this location 4 times with 4 different Servers. Each time the server came by only 1 time to see if we had needed anything forgetting that a 20% tip off of a $160 tab could be a nice night for them. I just don't' think that this would ever be one of my favorites to go to. Maybe if it's snowing out. The place looks Super Dead and there are 10 Servers Praying that Anyone would come in so that they can make some money.. Only then would I go here.

56.description: Place was nice. Except it was loud. & food wasn't even stuffing.  & literally only lobster & shrimp. No other variety.  Nasty.

29.description: Typically I don't like seafood, but when I do get a taste for it, it tends to be shrimp. I've been to this location about 3 times and when I do, I always get the same thing: garlic shrimp with mashed potatoes, broccoli and rice pilaf.The first 2 times I came here everything was great, but on the last visit they forgot to put garlic sauce on my shrimp. Service sort of varies because sometimes they're so busy that they're running around like crazy trying to service everyone but I feel the service never lacks either. The waitresses are friendly, but sometimes I have to ask for refills more than I'd like.I will continue to come here as they have a killer deal for $15 that's extremely filling and you get unlimited biscuits which everyone knows about (or should!) you can't beat that.Friendly service but they could be a little more attentive :)

42.description: Awww......I had the lobster pizza.   Pretty bad,  i wouldn't feed the seagulls this.   My son had the shrimp. That's was good.    Is there really a big difference from one chain to the other?    Next time I going to get some crab.  At least the people were nice.

23.description: Long wait, reasonable prices, decent food, alright service.  I'm not a huge red lobster fan, but I'll go when someone else notices.  This isn't the best red lobster, but it isn't the worst either.  Know what to expect when you go and you'll have a great time, for a reasonable price.

47.description: Mel was my server duing the Endless shrimp promotion. She made prompt and we NEVER had to wait for her. GREAT SERVICE!!!

8.description: The Food Took too Long To Come out. The waitress seemed disinterested in making sure we did or didn't need anything else. Entrée was not even hot. Slow service for the amount of staff were in the restaurant. This food was really nasty and the drinks taste like dishwater and soap and the shrimp was dry and burnt.

31.description: I took my niece here because she wanted lobster for her birthday. Before I could sit down, I noticed many crumbs on the seat and wiped them off. The waitress was apparently new with no one to help her and with that being said, she missed many things. She incorrectly put in my husband's order and waited almost 30 minutes for his lobster tail. She forgot the glasses of water we had requested in the beginning of our order as well. She did not check on us until after we were done eating so when the manager came around we talked to her about our experience. She offered dessert for free, but instead asked to get our bill reduced for the lack of service. While it wasn't huge, it did make us content. The food was ok though.

34.description: Decided to come here after shopping since my sister wanted to try the cheddar biscuits. I remember having Red Lobster years ago and not liking it. I was also preparing myself for bad service based on Yelp reviewers.We stood while the host went to check for a table. There were a couple of waiters and waitresses up front chatting. They asked if we been helped and we said yes. We got to the table and our waitress came and asked if we wanted drinks. We took awhile deciding since it was our first time. Crab Corn Chowder - My sister got this and it was good. It's like a meal on it's own.Cheddar Biscuit - My sister said it was okay, but nothing to rave about. Seafood Bake - I got this and thought it was a bit salty. The crab legs were pretty good. The shrimps were cooked nicely. The scallops were the tiny kinds which I wasn't expecting. This came with a side salad and I got the caeser salad and thought it was pretty good. I also got the clam chowder and it was good.My sister got a dish with a lobster tail and 2 kinds of shrimp. I didn't have any. She seemed to like it.I thought the service was very good. Overall, the food was okay, but I'll probably return if someone wanted to go. I think for the price and for seafood, I'll go somewhere else.

16.description: I can say with total confidence that I will not be returning here.   My son wanted to go here for his bday because he'd never been to a Red Lobster - I obliged...but seriously, when he got his plate and the tilapia looked the size of a chicken strip - I mean come on now, way to cut costs...sheesh!  Also, although our waitperson seemed nice, she kept forgetting stuff - I mean over and over again.  Me and the BF ordered burgers, yes, at Red Lobster cause we don't eat seafood.  Honestly, nothing wrong with them - but the fries were lukewarm at best - no bueno.  Best part of the meal was dessert...and when we got the check.The other thing that bothered me was the place itself - it's in need of a major makeover.  I needed to use the restroom, it was a disaster in there...like a bunch of kids went in and had a toilet paper fight.  It was just not a pleasant experience.

13.description: Worst restaurant ever and ever ..salty fooood poor service don't even thinking to try it

11.description: The best red lobster I have ever been to. Food and service were top notch and the portions are bigger in the states than in Canada. I left there the happiest girl in the world.

39.description: This is the Red Lobster that i continuously dine at (for a fix) only because I have to. It is the closest one to me. I have had my great visits and my bad visits. I have had an waitress with an attitude (can't remember her name) but we had her switched. I have had the SLOWEST waitress ever (It is the older Asian lady). I don't know if she works there still but she needs to retire. And I have had the BEST waiter ever. His name was Diego and he was really the only reason I kept coming back there. He is gone now I hear, but it was nice to see a friendly face every time i came in there with my friends and family. He knew us by name and always treated us like VIP. now onto the food.The food is great. I usually stick with the usual crab legs (mix of snow and king). Sometimes depending on the deal, I will eat some steak or shrimp scampi. The only bad time I have had a bad food experience there was when they started "seasoning" the broccoli with crushed red pepper.  I don't know what the chefs are thinking, but that needs to stay on pizza. So just a heads up if you order broccoli, ask for it plain.I haven't been in a couple of months, but once I get the courage to receive service without Diego as my waiter, I'll write again.

37.description: Love this location!!! The food and service is excellent!!!!!!!!!!!!!! Great drinks made your way................[;

0.description: As a Chinese boy, I grew up maybe having Red Lobster once in my life. It wasn't until my friend mentioned "Endless Shrimp" that I dropped my bags, hopped in the car, and got our fatty selves over for the epic seafood meltdown. My overall impressions: basic, but a good shrimpy way!Everything here is very typical of any chain. You've got standard service and bland service, but you just need to come here for the good stuff: endless shrimp!THE GOOD-* Drinks were very reasonable ($7 or so) and can be quite stiff.* Bread was amazing. No doubt. Greasy as hell, but good* Endless shrimp ($17.99) gets you hella shrimp and you can even box the leftovers to go. We definitely took advantageTHE MEH* Side dishes left much to be desired* Service was mediocre at best* Calamari was AWFUL. I regret getting this so much that I ordered more shrimp to make up for it. If you didn't get the message already: it's all about the endless shrimp. If you don't like shrimp, best take your money elsewhere. Otherwise, enjoy and eat tons!Parking is available in a private lot.

38.description: So the food at this place is the same at every other Red Lobster. I don't think that I have to rate the food so I will do the other little things that matter to most of us. The wait is LONG! Be ready to really wait 45 mins - 1 hour. We had to wait that long on a Saturday night at around 930pm when the place closes at 11pm. Yes, people still come until the time the place is closing. The service by our server was great and we loved it. Food comes out in just the same time as all other locations I'm guessing. The cleanliness is pretty much the same...it's clean.

51.description: Didn't expect much. Didn't get much. Damn i'm tired of just being in the neighborhood n needing something to eat. I gotta step my game up. Food wasn't bad, wasn't great either.

27.description: I can say with total confidence that I will not be returning here.   My son wanted to go here for his bday because he'd never been to a Red Lobster - I obliged...but seriously, when he got his plate and the tilapia looked the size of a chicken strip - I mean come on now, way to cut costs...sheesh!  Also, although our waitperson seemed nice, she kept forgetting stuff - I mean over and over again.  Me and the BF ordered burgers, yes, at Red Lobster cause we don't eat seafood.  Honestly, nothing wrong with them - but the fries were lukewarm at best - no bueno.  Best part of the meal was dessert...and when we got the check.The other thing that bothered me was the place itself - it's in need of a major makeover.  I needed to use the restroom, it was a disaster in there...like a bunch of kids went in and had a toilet paper fight.  It was just not a pleasant experience.

32.description: Not much of a seafood lover but the customer service and the cheddar biscuits were awesome. The seafood was...eh...my opinion on it shouldn't deter anyone from going because I am not much of a Bubba Shrimp kinda guy but it's "A-OK" with me.

54.description: considering the last time i was here i had to wait for like an hour to be seated i decided it was best to arrive earlier in the day. i arrived at around 6pm on friday. i was quite happy that we were seated as soon as we walked in. i knew what i wanted, endless shrimp but dude wanted to look over the menu. it took forever for the waitress to come, it took forever for her to bring our drinks and we had to ask her for biscuts. the food was good but the service was horrible

48.description: No water. Had to request cheddar biscuits after 15 minutes. No dip for my coconut shrimp. But, the steak was delicious and my lobster tail was off the chain. The waitress who initially was slacking, gets a thumbs up for not charging me for my second beer.

44.description: Never in my life had I ever received such bad service as what I received last night from a waitress named Natalie. I loved their food but the service was crap. She never brought over silverware and after asking her for refills she nodded and left. My cousin had to go to the bar to get refills for her children.  I seriously never met someone who needed to go to school to be a waitress. How ignorant and stupid could you be. I rather drive out of my way to get better service than to ever come to this particular Red Lobster Again.

24.description: The best red lobster I have ever been to. Food and service were top notch and the portions are bigger in the states than in Canada. I left there the happiest girl in the world.

7.description: We saw their ad on TV, having crab fest on the month of August, so we went there right away.We ordered crab and seafood, everything was good, the best was the lobster, shrimps, crab, were standard. Well, just like all the rest of chain stores, nothing more nothing less.

49.description: This Red Lobster is one of the worst I have been to. Besides the wonderful cheddar biscuits (of which I am a huge fan) the food was horrible. Everything was too creamy, from the potato soup to the Cesar salad. Not only was the food sub-par, but the service deplorable. The server was attentive at first, but failed to clear our table, didn't refill drinks, and had to be flagged down to get our check. This location is severely understaffed and I will not be returning ... ever.

40.description: They lost me at the Cesar salad. The teriyaki shrimp is nothin but sautéed shrimp with teriyaki sauce drizzled on top. the cocktail I orderd was delicious, flavorful and made just right. The crab and shrimp stuffed mushrooms are delicious and the biscuits are always on point.My sister said she remembered when she was younger my parents would take her here and it would be really fancy with white table clothes and everything, they have fallen way off now, what a shame.

53.description: I am not a Red Lobster regular at all. To be honest, The only time I ever go there is when they have their endless shrimp special. This is pretty much the only time I really get my money's worth here because I am all about a good value. The place was packed as usual even for a weekday night. The hostess and our server were both very friendly and helpful. Our server was a little bit flighty though as she kept on forgetting stuff throughout the night. Our food was very good as always as I had my typical endless shrimp special. I left with a a very full, happy belly!

30.description: I was nervous about going here, partly because I'm not normally a fan of chain restaurants and also because of the location.  But I had a gift card, some time to kill, and was in the mood for seafood.First thing I noticed was that the exterior of the place was quite attractive, well cared-for and landscaped.  When I entered, everything looked clean and inviting. That eased some concerns right there.  My waitress was very helpful, friendly and attentive.  Surprisingly for 12:30 pm on a Sunday, the place was empty (started filling up around 1-1:30).  I ordered the ultimate feast (Cheddar Bay Biscuits, Caesar Salad, Lobster Tail, Crab Legs, Shrimp Scampi, Fried Shrimp, Broccoli).  The food was all cooked perfectly and the ingredients seemed quite fresh.  I wasn't looking for chef creativity at a chain restaurant, but rather technical consistency, and this place delivered. An extremely satisfying meal.  The weakest element, while still good, was the fried shrimp (the breading seemed to distract from, rather than complementing the shrimp). The highlight was the crab legs.Restroom was very clean, and I also observed a kitchen staff member spend an extremely long time thoroughly washing his hands (another nice sign that management appears to care about cleanliness).

46.description: Wow!  Like seriously....wow!  Coming from the northside and having to make that 2 train ride trip down there was something else!  Huge pro: me and my friends food was delicious!!!  Our biscuits (the main reason why we came) were so good....yum!  Now on to business....hostesses and managers very disorganized!  Its a weekend so yall need to be on it!  Plus the clientele were HILIARIOUS to watch and I mean it in a bad way.  Plus they need more servers....their sections were way too big so they cant be as attentive as they should be.  More likely wont be making that trip back but thanks for the biscuits though!

1.description: Too expensive for the quality of food.Never been here until this day.The best thing they have here are the biscuits they serve as soon as you sit down and the colada drink I ordered.Other than that, food tasted too salty, too fatty, and just not that great.Service is kind of slow. Our waitress was very nice but too slow for everything. We left so sick and annoyed. We had to wait too long for the food. So we got full with the crab biscuits.We waited too long for the refills.and we had to wait tremendously too long for our check. We left somewhat annoyed.And on top it, it seemed there where too many people working there but they where really not doing much or able to help us. Most probably won't be coming here again.

55.description: Before i review this restaurant i should let you now it might be a little biased, i took my fiance and mother of my kids here on our first date. I have to say i love the food here its always fresh, and dam them biscuits are fire....I always get the shrimp side trio..... wow its delicious and every time i go back i always have great memories of my first date and the first time i went here. The only reason i don't give it 5 stars is if you go on a holiday(Valentine's day,Mothers Day, etc.) your going to wait two to three hours for a table....CRAZY for some food, but i still love it.

9.description: Lived in the area for a while now and I finally decided to go after plans to outback fell though this was my second choice. After weeks of hospital food this was my first meal. It was delicious! amazing!!! We arrived at noon on a Thursday so no one was really there it wasn't busy, got seated right away the waiters and waitress were very attentive. The biscuits and salads were delicious as always for Redlobster. Best bread shrimp I've ever had! My friends aren't fans of seafood, but this changed their minds. Absolutely everything was perfect,delicious, and tasteful! Will absolutely return hungry for more. (In the afternoon on a weekday I like the quiet atmosphere of the place. )

26.description: My boyfriend and I went to visit his mother and stopped in before we commuted back to the city.  All I can say is wow! Martha at the bar is amazing and the service is as well.  Thank you for having us xo

25.description: I went there today with my parents and my 92 year old grandmother and people who came in after us got served first that's just bad business. It took forever for the food, my drink and a refill on water. I know not if a fancy seafood restaurant but I still want great service and we didn't get that at all. The last thing my grandmother said was she don't want to ever come back there.

12.description: A two hour wait on a Sunday evening? The food is tasty but not worth waiting 2 hours. Staffing issues perhaps?

59.description: Been to several Red Lobsters around Chicago and this has to be one of the worst ones.  Inside is a little dirty and outdated.  Our waiter looked 14 years old.  He gave us plates with crap stuck underneath.  The salad was served in a hot bowl (wtf???).  The food was pretty good, but the decor and service were lacking.

21.description: Me and my family went to red lobster last night and there was no wait time. The service was great. The cheddar bay biscuits are awesome!!

17.description: WHAT A GHETTO DUMPI wouldn't recommend this place to anyone who wants a nice meal.we came to red lobster for a birthday party for a 14 year old and waited an whole hour and a half to be seated. it was not crowded nor busy. we finally got seated then waited a long time for the server to ask about drinks, after 20 minutes she asked what we wanted to drink and told us she would be right back. then she comes back without are drinks and asks if we were ready to order. and as she told us we could order from the lunch menu even though its after 3PM i decided to get something from the lunch menu. an hour went by and we still haven't received any drinks bread nor salads we kept asking the manager what was going on she gives us attitude like she didn't care.  are drinks finally arrive with cold bread. we tell the server the bread was cold and she said there's nothing she can due since they had other customers to assist. then we kept asking for refills and everyone was low on drinks. furthermore when the food came out my uncles fish was overcooked and burned. she replaced it. then when it was time for cake we waited longer for them to bring it out. but what really bothered me was when the bill came and she lied and told me she never gave me the lunch price for what i had ordered and she said her boss told her there was nothing she could do about it. very poor management i would not recommend this location to anyone.

10.description: I would never come back here and this location almost ruined it for ALL red lobsters. The food is not good. I have the crab trio during crab fest and a lobster tail. I didn't even eat the lobster tail after tasting it. The crab wasn't good, I make it better at home. Sucks to be disappointed it was my birthday. My husband order his favorite food tilapia and that was horrible as well. When he complained the waitress gave him a cup of seasoning .... Really ?

5.description: I had the worst customer service experience at this location. After placing my order I waited over a hour to get my food. Not to mention not receiving appetizers for my toddler son, my alcoholic beverage, and even the biscuits.I talked to the manger and he tried to make up for the inconvenience by not charge myself for the sides and drink. The waiter showed no regarded for her actions. Not once did she refill any drinks or replenish the biscuits.But wait! After paying for my subpar meal with my credit card, the cashier stood over my shoulder while I was writing in the tip!!!! Never in my 26 years HAVE I EVER felt that type of disrespect while dinning. The manger was aware of this and of course he did nothing to make up for it.Please don't support these type of places. I will never in my life eat at red lobster or "seafood McDonald's" ever again.

3.description: Terrible service! They made us wait and had other ppl after us come in and got seats for them first. The wait is terrible.. We waited for our drinks for 20mins tsk tsk never again

35.description: This was by far the worst service I've ever had! Was it busy?? Not at all! So why is it that we only seen our server walk past us?? I'm still trying to figure this out. I'll probably come back but if I ever have to sit in Jessica's section I am leaving with the quickness! Everything about her sucks!

19.description: Decided to come here after shopping since my sister wanted to try the cheddar biscuits. I remember having Red Lobster years ago and not liking it. I was also preparing myself for bad service based on Yelp reviewers.We stood while the host went to check for a table. There were a couple of waiters and waitresses up front chatting. They asked if we been helped and we said yes. We got to the table and our waitress came and asked if we wanted drinks. We took awhile deciding since it was our first time. Crab Corn Chowder - My sister got this and it was good. It's like a meal on it's own.Cheddar Biscuit - My sister said it was okay, but nothing to rave about. Seafood Bake - I got this and thought it was a bit salty. The crab legs were pretty good. The shrimps were cooked nicely. The scallops were the tiny kinds which I wasn't expecting. This came with a side salad and I got the caeser salad and thought it was pretty good. I also got the clam chowder and it was good.My sister got a dish with a lobster tail and 2 kinds of shrimp. I didn't have any. She seemed to like it.I thought the service was very good. Overall, the food was okay, but I'll probably return if someone wanted to go. I think for the price and for seafood, I'll go somewhere else.

28.description: just stopped in for my birthday and Jeysin our ssrver was the bomb. kept me and my wife and kids entertained for the whole time.  thanks to mark for putting us in his section.  it will be a happy birthday.

45.description: Jim was our server and his service was outstanding. He brought plenty of cheddar bay biscuits soon as the basket was empty. He remembered that one member of our party wanted lime wedges in her water and brought plenty without asking. We never had to look for him. If you go to this location ask for Jim. 2 thumbs up!!!!

33.description: Service is TOP NOTCH. The servers are friendly, attentive, and timely. I like it.Besides that, I am not really a fan. I like the cheddar biscuits, but the rest of the food is a total meh. I actually think about crap (as in cheap food) going into my body when I eat it. I like the vegetables okay, but not so much the other food.It's also not very clean. There have been crumbs on the seats whenever I've gone. Also, I went into the middle stall in the bathroom and it just so happened that two employees occupied the stalls on either side of me. They were talking about how the bathroom doesn't get cleaned!!! When I left, they picked up paper towels and toilet paper from the floor and then sprayed air freshener. There was no wiping down of anything.All that said, I recognize that tehre are people who love Red Lobster and Olive Garden. It's their go-to place for celebrations and special occassions. I understand because I used to view it as da bomb diggity too! So, if you're one of those people who consider this to be fancy then you should definitely go and I mean no disrespect.

43.description: I've been here 4 times and can't believe how great ( for a chain restaurant) everything from the cheese biscuts, soup, salad and entrees are.  Very fresh, good proportions, served at the correct temprature etc..  I actually reccomend going there!

2.description: Walked in and was greeted by the entire management staff. The accused is for having a bad odor and asked us to step outside location to air out? My party and I went into debate with them for at least ten minutes in front of guest and staff. I am highly upset at the way they treated us and will be taking this matter to higher management.

18.description: Actually, "zero" stars for this dump. Worst service ever!!! Manager blamed the kitchen and said the server wasn't to blame for a wait time over 40 minutes...just for a salad. Look up "poor management" and I'm sure this Red Lobster will be listed. Don't waste your time or money here.

41.description: I agree with everyone complaning on the service. I been there 2xs, the second waitress was waaaay nicer, but my compliant is not about her, but the manager I believe it was.He was going around making small chit chat with literally every table on our surronding area, then the idiot skipt my husband and I.Great just what we need, on top of it taking forever to be seated, (this place does not take reservations AND u cant even call ahead!!) running the risk of having a bitch for a waitress u still have to deal with racism! I mean seriously?! Sorry Red Lobster on Pulaski the only thing u got going 4u at this point is the biscuits and SOMETIMES the food. Cuz ur service sucks!! whoever is doing the hiring should really make sure the staff they hire has customer service skills I mean they are just that bad.I guess they get paid a load of money too (2b waitresses)bcuz they sure as hell dont act like they want or need our tips.

52.description: Pay no attention to the drunk man swearing at a bike with no wheels. I'm sure he's not a permanent fixture out front of this place, but between him and a cast of many others, made this a great night for people watching. We went during the Endless Shrimp special, and even on a Wednesday night, this place was packed. The food was good, and for a change, I got my money's worth. Shrimp scampi, and garlic Parmesan shrimp were all I ordered, and plenty of it. Our waitress was nice, because she told us about shrimp that was available but not on the menu. We took advantage of that with some coconut shrimp! Besides for that bit of advice, our waitress was rather omnipresent the whole time. She was everywhere at one time, except when we actually needed something, like drink refills, and a check. I can't really blame her, since the place was packed. I'll probably be back next time the shrimp deal rolls around. On a personal note, I hate the lobsters in the tank up front. Lobsters are just scary looking.

50.description: horrible service.. me and my friends went there for the endless shrimp deal and after our 2nd order, he was being frustrated for no reason and start having a little attitude.. our biscuits was not hot like it suppose to and our food came out really really slow... will not come back here ever again.

4.description: Call me a lobster fanatic...but i love this place...first time when i was a kid i enjoyed seafood when i was a kid...i always come back... The service could be a little fssterv though

6.description: What happen to this place my Dinner and my Service was not good at all. And I will have to Make some calls. From the time we walked in the door. My water had 4 ice cubes when I place my order for my Drink I had to get my side sip 10 mins later. And it should have been a side shot. Now my food was good. But hear this I told her  that I will let you know when I'm ready for my Dinner to be cooked because I wonted to finish my drink. Next then I know this hard of hearing girl Ryan is bringing me my food with a steam cover. Really lady. She told me well you can eat you food and it won't be cold. Could somebody please tell this lady I told her 2xs. Smh. So 1star if for the hot biscuits. And the other 1 Is for my dinner was good.Red Lobster I was wondering why do you have Security now walking around while people are eating

22.description: What happen to this place my Dinner and my Service was not good at all. And I will have to Make some calls. From the time we walked in the door. My water had 4 ice cubes when I place my order for my Drink I had to get my side sip 10 mins later. And it should have been a side shot. Now my food was good. But hear this I told her  that I will let you know when I'm ready for my Dinner to be cooked because I wonted to finish my drink. Next then I know this hard of hearing girl Ryan is bringing me my food with a steam cover. Really lady. She told me well you can eat you food and it won't be cold. Could somebody please tell this lady I told her 2xs. Smh. So 1star if for the hot biscuits. And the other 1 Is for my dinner was good.Red Lobster I was wondering why do you have Security now walking around while people are eating

15.description: Red lobster is a chain restaurant. I been to this location many years ago. The last time I been there the food is alright since I order the endless shrimp feast since my friend took me out for my birthday. I think this restaurant is overrated and I wouldn't go back to this place. I rather go to a place where they have better pasta with seafood.

57.description: Living in the the sea of food awesomeness we call Chicago, sometimes we need a dose of nostalgia/reality/whatever to remind us where we came from (but in a good way, LOL). Red Lobster fills this void for me. Sure, it's not the nicest RL I've been to (actually, probably the worst I've seen). You can't deny it though -- the food is still really good. Damn good cheddar biscuits. Damn sweet lobster. The service was excellent, too.  On the negative side, the restaurant overall didn't appear very clean. Plus, my fiance mentioned the bathroom smelled like someone laid a huge fudge dragon on the floor. Yuck.I love RL and will most likely return....but probably not to this particular location.

20.description: A nice experience we had here. We came to celebrate a birthday. Reasonable prices for all the dishes. We bought multiple full course entrées, lobster pizzas, etc. There were no complaints. Otherwise, this place was nice for our first time. The food came out pretty slow, and my soup was forgotten. All in all, we had a good time here.

36.description: I have not been at red lobster in like 10 years so I was very excited to go. They try to give you the perception that you are in a fine dining restaurant. When I asked if there were any beer specials I was told "this is not that kind of place." I like going to fine dining and I like that they want to be fine dinning but they can't pull it off. Its just not that kind of place. Biscuits are amazing and I left very very full. Place is priced very reasonable for amount of lobster you get. Lobster was good but not great. I am looking forward to coming g back next year.

14.description: Yikes!!!! Sadly, all the bad reviews are true.  I walked into this location 30 mins after they opened and almost walked out. Definitely not the same establishment I knew as a kid. The hostess upon  arrival =missing in action... The bathroom = destroyed.. Service=super slow ( 30 mins to take my drink order..really??!!!)...the one bright spot = those darn cheddar bay biscuits still amazing.  At an average of $ 25 per entree you have to do better Red Lobster.. I should've listened to yelp!!!

12.description: This place is awesome...this place demonstrates that great big things come in small packages.I have traveled far north and far south looking for excellence....Here it is. I had come in and requested a fresh full set which required the removal of the old set. Now i am not new to how tedious this process is and painful if u dont have a tech soak them off. But i went in fully expecting pain and a slight attitude from the tech since i also needed nail art design and crystal gems applique. Yes i came in with a list of todos. I was greeted so very unexpectedly gracious when i entered the salon with a nice hello and papertowel since i was raining...i appreciated that. I picked my color and was immediately seated and began being serviced by the tech. Now im not sure why people assume people of different cultural backgrounds are always talking about them when they begin a conversation in an unfamiliar language in your presence but even though i knew she WAS struggling trying to remove the old set of nails , she was the most patient tender technician i ever had the pleasure of being serviced by.From the very moment i knew i was in the right place and she deserved a great tip just based on the removal process. She was fast efficient and careful and her skills were evident in each stage of process. I am over and beyond pleased. Beyond satisfaction. She deserved every bit of that $20 tip. QUALITY QUALITY QUALITY....

7.description: Love this place! They always do a great job and check every detail. Other salons I went to didn't care about you skin around your nails and did sloppy job.

20.description: FUNGUS: DON'T GET YOUR NAILS DONE HERE!!! I feel bad writing a negative review about CNN Nails because this was my nail salon for many years. Although is was always busy they always did a god job. Unfortunately I stopped going because I got nail fungus during one of my manicures. It all started with discoloration in my nail and now all my finger is dry, cracked and itchy. The worst part is that half my nail has fallen off (I'm not exaggerating). Thankfully I went to the doctor, who confirmed it was fungus and gave me medication and said that my nail will be growing back. So go at your own risk but please ask them to clean their equipment. If they want to run a business they have to become more hygienic.

19.description: WORST CUSTOMER SERVICE EVER !!!!!! I DO NOT RECOMMEND THIS NAIL SALONDON'T DESERVE NO STAR AT ALL ! I've been coming to this place for over 8 years already and today for the first time this lady from the pedicure area was really rude and mean & the way i wasnt greetting like i usually get I was very upset by the way she was acting all moody and pisst about it for no reason I personally told her I was not going to make her do my pedicure if she didn't wanted to so I stand up from the ped chair put back my shoes on &  told her manager the situation what happened how rude she really was & left the place for good ....seriously don't blame us customers about your problems leave that at home you can't be all mad in a workplace where you dealing with customers if you don't like your job just quit & find something you can enjoy working at because is really disturbing how employees like this recieve you with an attitude not only you put you yourself bad but the place also you had my 5 star now it went to 0 just because of this bad treatment

1.description: I used to love coming here but not anymore.. The owner is very moody and the service is not that good anymore. I really dislike how the owner pressures you into giving a tip!!!!! I always tip and she doesn't have to remind me. There was this one time where I had tip my girl in the back for the service and Lily the owner was like.... Are you not going to tip????

2.description: This is not the fanciest place in the world and it can indeed get busy, but the price is right, they have a ton of no-chip colors, and as others have said, they do such a great job with the nail art, that it's worth waiting for.  My no-chip nails grow out before they chip and I've gotten lots of compliments.  I'm not always in the mood for a pedicure, but if I am, I'll come here.  They do a great job turning my hooves back into human feet.

9.description: I've been coming here for the past year, I've obviously always loved their work but lately their service FUCKIN SUCKS!!!The male who works in front is fuckin rude, he practically forced my friend to leave a tip on her debit card! (What if she had cash?) Not to mention he asked/yelled loud enough for the entire salon to hear. How embarrassing. I'm actually pretty upset with their decline in customer service and I refuse to return. I'm appalled. They're pretty expensive as well, the least they can do is compensate with decent customer service.I've watched them be rude to other people but the last time I was there they refused to do my fill-in (which doesn't even take long) when there was half an hour left for them to be open. They seem pretty money hungry all the time so I'm actually surprised that they declined service to me. At that, they practically FORCE you to buy honey sugar scrub when you're getting a pedicure. ($5) Their upselling is uncomfortable. If you want good service, go to Nail Club. The owner will personally greet you and they're friendly.

6.description: Yes-they are always busy, but my no chip lasts three weeks with no lifting or peeling. The quality of work is worth the wait. It gets pretty packed. Walk ins only! Love their deluxe pedicure.

18.description: I have recently starting going to Cnn nails and I love it. First off, where can you find a deal like a no-chip mani and pedi for only $40!?! The no-chip mani last longer than the recommended 2 weeks and the salon has a large variety of colors to choose from. When I get a pedi, I always ask them to apply a honey-sugar scrub they have and leaves my skin incredibly  soft ( and they only charge me an additional $5). Oh and they are open until 8pm. Most nail salons in the area close at 7pm.

10.description: Always the best results of gel application and designs. Note Thursday thru Sat are pretty hectic busy days so make sure you pick a slow day or arrive early on a busy day. Open Sundays at 11:15 am , best day to go. Staff is nice and friendly. Get different designs every time, the stones lasted 3 weeks as well as the no chip. Satisfied customer

13.description: I came here on a Sunday morning because everything else near me was closed. They are inexpensive so I guess, you get what you pay for. It's not the cleanest, management can be rude to not only their customers but their staff as well. They are pretty persistent with trying to sell u every product on their list and the jobs themselves can either be great or meh, depending who you get. The wait here is pretty ridiculous as well so come early when it won't be busy.

16.description: FUNGUS: DON'T GET YOUR NAILS DONE HERE!!! I feel bad writing a negative review about CNN Nails because this was my nail salon for many years. Although is was always busy they always did a god job. Unfortunately I stopped going because I got nail fungus during one of my manicures. It all started with discoloration in my nail and now all my finger is dry, cracked and itchy. The worst part is that half my nail has fallen off (I'm not exaggerating). Thankfully I went to the doctor, who confirmed it was fungus and gave me medication and said that my nail will be growing back. So go at your own risk but please ask them to clean their equipment. If they want to run a business they have to become more hygienic.

17.description: Simply satisfied with their art for nails. This is the the spot to go to on the south side.

15.description: I dislike the fact that the man in charge of the salon asks "did you give a tip?" That is extremely rude and it is the customer's choice whether or not to give one. They do a fast and good job on nails.

0.description: I personally love this place. I have tried many locations and I always come back to CNN. They could be pushy on some of there products but they are a business so I don't let it bother me. The price is right and the women that take care of me always do a great job. I cant complain! my only recommendation would be that they expand their space, its always pretty busy.

5.description: 1st time customer, loved their work but not the prices or the wait, I suppose they're packed because they do an awesome job with nail designs. I will try them out again and will update review. But if you have time, give them a try just be prepared to wait. Who knows the wait just might be worth it, mine was.

11.description: Love this place yes it gets packed but keep in mind for the great value and good job  they do that is why they get lots of people would recommend to everyone LILY is the best she is always on point with my no chip nail designs I am in heaven when it comes to her work never had disappointed me

8.description: This place is "meh." Not the most sanitary and DEFINITELY not the best customer service. If you can go somewhere else, I suggest you do so because this place isn't really worth the visit, especially with their ridiculously long waits. I  got an acrylic full set and they layered it on WAY too thick. I also got a pedicure which was okay--I liked the hot towels, though. What I really disliked though was how the owner pressured me into giving a tip! I was going to give one, there's no need to remind your customers. They also lost my OPI nail polish thinking it was theirs. So overall, 3 stars, just 'cause my nails look cute.

3.description: I had my nails done here for my wedding. My matron of honor told me to come here because this is her usual location. I had no idea what to have done for the big day because my dress had a lot of color to it that I wanted my nails to compliment instead of being just white. I showed her a picture of the dress & told her to do whatever she felt would compliment it nicely. I received compliments on my nails all night long!!! I seriously couldn't be happier with the job she did!!!

14.description: I've been a loyal customer for a year and a half already, this is my favorite nail salon to go to! Ive tried a couple other nail salons, and so far this is the best one. I feel comfortable going here. They open at 10am on Saturdays, I needed a no chip manicure for an event today (Saturday) so I got to the nail salon around 9:50 & there were 4 other ladies waiting by the door! Keep in mind that the weather was about 25 degrees! That just shows how much quality their work has. My no chip manicure lasts about 2-3 weeks. I totally love this nail salon! Other nail salons their no chip manicure lasts for about a week and they start chipping. Also I never feel that the nail technician is rushing on my nails even though there's a huge waiting line.

4.description: I have been here a few times and the first two where kinda of rude but lately they have been so nice, don't know if it's because they have seen me more but every time I come I try to see the same woman she is so nice and likes to take her time with you. She will always ask if you are ok or need something Yes she try's to sell me up on things but that is part of there job.. I will keep coming here as long as she is here can't remember her name.

3.description: Ordered flowers for Valentines day for my girlfriend.  The flowers never arrived and I never received a call or an email to update me that there was any issue.  I called to voice my concerns and cancel my order and the man who answered the phone was short with me and offered only excuses.  He gave an apology, and when I asked how he planned to make restitution for their error and flagrant disregard to customer service, he simply apologized again and hung up.

1.description: Highly recommended. I live in Las Vegas....This florist values his business very much. Has always followed thru... Almost always even have surpassed my expectations! Always willing to accommodate everybody's budget and likes. Every time I need something for a birthday, wedding, anniversary, mother's day, even cemetery arrangements he follows through very nicely.  This is the only flower shop that I will order from in chicago.

2.description: DO NOT ORDER FROM THIS FLORIST!! They forgot about my friend's wedding this past Saturday!!!! They refuse to answer the phone and have not even had the decency to call and apologize! This is disgusting customer service and the least they should do is is call to apologize and refund the deposit. How does a florist just happen to forget a wedding after they called to confirm????!!!!

5.description: Unbelievable, I ordered two arrangements for my brother who passed away unexpectedly leaving behind two little girls 12 & 14yrs. The girls wanted a balloon that read "We will miss you" instead they sent...."JUST BECAUSE". When I called to complain the owner actually argued with me(for 15min.) because I ordered the flowers through 1800-pro-flowers and that was the only balloon had. "HE" thought that was the next best thing since last time a similar "not having the balloon in stock" happened he didn't get payed when he didn't send one. Not once did he ever offer to reimburse me for the girls arrangement. He did tell me to take it up with pro-flowers though? I asked why he didn't just grab a sympathy card from his shelf and hand it to the driver to give to the funeral home stating..."My condolences, we didn't have an appropriate balloon, my apologies,. You will not be charged  for the balloon,. Please call me at your convenience with any questions" All in all, I guess I should have been happy that it didn't read "Happy Birthday". If anyone who reads this cares to comment please do as I'm curious what your reaction is. In the meantime, I have two little girls I have to console.....I guess it really is all about the money and who's going to eat the cost. An Indian call center who said "Just because" was good enough or the guy who actually sent it. Total cost  $195. The girls arrangement- $50........all for fifty-bucks. I'll end my review  it as I started it "UNBELIEVABLE"

6.description: I had ordered bouquets and centerpieces from here for my wedding, requesting specific colors and even included a picture of what they should look like. Not only did Al give me the wrong color flowers, he was rude and unprofessional when my bridesmaids called about it. Please save yourselves the trouble and find another florist who understands what you want.

7.description: Every bride wants all the details of her wedding to be absolutely perfect. That being said, those that work in an industry that caters to weddings ought to be very specific clarifying large wedding orders. My friend was recently married and specifically requested "orange" roses for the boutonnieres and bridesmaids' bouquets. I'm not a florist, and neither is she, so when the florist asks "do you want a marlese rose?" after asking "orange" that the damn rose is as orange as the Bears' alternate jerseys? Apparently no. When we called the florist the morning of the wedding, not only was he a high class jerk, but maintained that the salmon colored roses were, in fact orange. Sir, by no stretch of the imagination is sushi grade salmon the same as "orange". To solidify my opinion of this douchiness, he labeled a rose "pink" and one "marlease" and left them on the GIFTS TABLE NEXT TO THE FLOWERS FOR MARY AT CHURCH. I'm sorry, sir, grow a pair, and don't make a passive aggressive statement IN A HOLY SETTING. He has undoubtedly lost the business of not only singles of the bride, but ALL FIVE BRIDESMAIDS. Nice work.

0.description: I order flowers for a charity event.  Al was extremely helpful in keeping with my theme.  The floral arrangements were absolutely magnificent.  Since then I have placed numerous orders and have been pleased with the level of service and professionalism from the staff.  5 stars!Vivian Valtas Schmidt

4.description: More like 'Mostly Crap'.  This outfit has got to be one of the worst businesses I've dealt with.  Unprofessional, argumentative, unapologetic when they screw things up (and they will), and no compensation for their errors.  Have a funeral?  Look elsewhere.  Have a wedding?  Next.  Have a birthday, keep going.  That is unless you want a funeral wreath that reads "Surprise!"  Places like this make me wish Yelp had negative ratings because they don't even deserve one star.  Do NOT order from this place.  Who sends a balloon that says 'Just Because" to a funeral?  Why not send one that reads "Sh*t Happens"?

58.description: This place is crazy GOOD!!!I can't even tell you which plate was the best. They all were tasty.This place is a must when you are in the area.

56.description: I'm Mexican and love Brirria, I have had authentic birria for a long time and I  tell you that Birria Zarrgoza was ok, not as great as the ratings made it sound... There are far better places for birria that are more reasonably priced! Places I like better and are more inexpensive are Birria Ocotlan and La Quebrada both of these locations also offer hand made tortillas, I took off the three points because I think they're overpriced,  horrible Decor, creepy ambiance and service was not very good. I had to ask for napkins twice and they couldn't keep tortillas on the table! I think They are over their heads because of reviews and publicity. Maybe they should put some of their profits into making the place more comfortable, up grading their chairs and reducing their cost! It's a little whole in the wall and they have the nerve to charge for the salsa de molcajete. I was not impressed all!

29.description: I love the goat.  I have been converted.  Small shop, but food and prices are great.  Didn't have a hint of gamey flavor.

42.description: The most amazing tacos I have ever had, not exaggerating. Nothing compares. It puts all other chicago-land tacos to shame.  If you have never had goat tacos before, TRY IT... and try it at Zaragoza's!! It's life changing. :D Make sure you try their Horchata and their Cinnamon Coffee too!! Yum. And the staff is just amazing. They are so sweet and accommodating, they make you feel like family!

23.description: Came here to pick up food they so generously donated to the Green City Market Big Table Dinner and John (the owner?) gave my colleague and I a sampling while we waited. Amazing tortillas home made right in front of you and extremely tender and delicious goat with a plum tomato consummate. It's a small place but very cosy and when the ownership is so friendly, it definitely makes you want to come back! Oh and don't forget to try the hibiscus tea!

47.description: Best Birria in the Midwest by far. The chef has the original recipe from the heart land of Birria, La Barca. Jal. And mastered it. Sweet!

8.description: I was not very impressed with the food.  Truthfully it tasted like pinesol, and you had to go through the kitchen to get to your table.. I'm sorry but that's against restaurant code..it seemed dirty. Noo thank you! !!

31.description: Went to Birrieria Zaragoza with my sister, never heard of this place before but she wanted to go. Got there the staff was very nice took the time to go over the menu (Small) with us. The place is small with about six tables & four counter stools Perry Clean.  We choose 2 Large Plates of Birria (goat) without bone. Add $ 1 extra for bone-out  you will still need to watch out for the little bones ( I had three in just the first corn wrap), we also ordered the  Salsa de Molcajete (Fire Roasted) it was ok for me my sis. liked it. The Birria Tacos  and Birria Quesadilla we did not have but you can see were this is going ONLY GOAT. I have had goat before and liked it, can't say this was bad but watered down would best describe it for me. Not much of a taste. Would I me? go back nope. Maybe I went on an off day, my sister fills the same.

34.description: Went here with 2 friends and it was phenomenal. The preparation of the goat takes them 24 hours and it is a true farm-to-table experience they come locally from out in Woodstock organic farm raised and of the highest quality.. The long preparation time makes it melt in your mouth tender and eliminates any of the gameyness goat sometimes has. Their home-made fire roasted Salsa de Molcajete (we ordered the spicy once) was great. I had the platter which comes with tortillas, onions, cilantro to make tacos or eat by itself. There is a reason this place has been rated before as the #1 Taco in Chicago - you can easily pay more money to eat, but it is difficult to find anything more delicious. My friend ordered the Large goat platter as a soup with broth, kind of came out looking like a pozole or menudo, I will definitely try it that way next time, I tried it and it was phenomenal. The owner John came over and chatted for a bit, very nice guy and very passionate about good food. Service was great and it's BYOB - I just don't see how you can go wrong with that. Certainly deserving of 5 stars..

16.description: Super good goat meat place on the south side. Very tender and flavorful meat that's served with traditional Mexican sides (onion and cilantro) with an optional roasted hot sauce. They will also serve any part of the goat that you'd like, including "inners". Plus, fresh corn tortillas made in house. Prices are a little higher than your typical Mexican joint worth it. My only issue with the amount of fat and gristle they serve with the meat. Otherwise great.

13.description: They specialize in two things: Goat meat and friendliness. Fresh handmade tortillas and various innards on Thursday evening add to this restaurant's irresistible siren's call.

11.description: I have been here before and loved the food. What made me very upset this time is that they lied to me. I knew it was a holiday and therefore the hours would be different or even closed. Anyway, I called in advance to make sure so I wouldn't waste my time going there. They said over the phone they would be closing at a certain time. We got there 30min before that time. We where planing on ordering to go so the time wasn't bad, I thought. When we got there the doors where closed. Some people where coming out and we thought maybe it was a mistake. One lady came and told us they had to close early because they where too busy and had too many orders to make. They should have been honest and said that over the phone when we called wich was about 10min before we got there. The place is too small for the demand.They don't have a good system to keep their customers happy. Unfortunately I will probably not come here again.

39.description: Maria v has the worst attitude , we where the only table , and she was very busy talking Shit about the costumers, my god, any time we ask her for some thing she will make faces, you dont like your job??? Dont fucking do it.

37.description: This place totally rocks. If you like birria (braised goat) you'll love this place. If you don't love it, you will here! Tortillas also rock since they are homemade! All they have is birria, salsa de molcajete and quesadillas but it's worth it. Try this place!

0.description: the BEST. Holy crap. Who know goat was that good???Only flaw: It closes too early. I wish I could eat here at 4 in the morning... or at least at 9 pm.

38.description: If I could I wouldn't even give it 1 star! My favorite waitress was fired and aside from that the owner keeps their tips! It's bs and illegal I'm definitely gonna report this to the bbb!

51.description: This is one of the better birria's I've had, and I've had some good ones. It would rank fourth or fifth for me. The large plate comes with enough meat for a few large tacos. The handmade tortillas are really good and the sauce provided at the table goes very well with the dish. I tried the salsa molcajete, which is an additional price, but didn't think it was really worth paying extra for.The employees were really nice and accommodating and the food came to the table pretty fast after we ordered it. It is somewhat pricier than most birrierias I have been to. This is one of the better restaurants in the neighborhood, since there aren't too many good places in the immediate area. Overall a pretty good place.

27.description: I have been here before and loved the food. What made me very upset this time is that they lied to me. I knew it was a holiday and therefore the hours would be different or even closed. Anyway, I called in advance to make sure so I wouldn't waste my time going there. They said over the phone they would be closing at a certain time. We got there 30min before that time. We where planing on ordering to go so the time wasn't bad, I thought. When we got there the doors where closed. Some people where coming out and we thought maybe it was a mistake. One lady came and told us they had to close early because they where too busy and had too many orders to make. They should have been honest and said that over the phone when we called wich was about 10min before we got there. The place is too small for the demand.They don't have a good system to keep their customers happy. Unfortunately I will probably not come here again.

32.description: From the greeting until they unlocked the door to let us out ( we stayed 30 minutes after closing and they never rushed us) we felt the hospitality and the warm of good food done right. Places that specialize in one thing and do it right are rare gems, and John (Juan) has made something that sparkles! From the handmade warm tortillas that we never had to ask for brought to our table by the very friendly staff to the vibrant salsa molcajete and rich goat in consume- everything was wonderful! A meal so good the a few bites into it we were planning on how much we were taking home ( they sell it by half and whole pounds) and how to hide it from the roommate. We were treated like old friends and found the whole experience outstanding. Go here and enjoy his old family recipe of birria

54.description: I was a regular here going so far as to introduce a half dozen of my friends to this place but I've had it. The service is always lacking but I put up with it. The final straw is the hidden "bone out" charge. Did you know they charge an extra dollar to make up a boneless dish? How could you not know? Maybe because it's not posted anywhere and the waitress never tells you! Thanks for thieving my money from me my last 10 visits Zaragosa! Also beware when your encouraged to "just try" something. They make it sound like the 1st time is free then charge you for it. Go to Zaragosa for a good robbing and some fresh tortillas.

48.description: Just. Plane. Awesome. Tell them it's your first time and they will set you up with delicious goat(don't be scared!) hand made tortillas and a bunch of fixin's. Small space so seating is limited, definitely worth the wait. Staff is really friendly too! Also... Don't believe the rumor that they slaughter goats in house. Not true! Don't pass this gem up!

44.description: Not fancy in the least but so good! The goat is succulent, the tortillas homemade. Great chunky warm salsa, cheesy quesadillas with or without meat.
