Horchata is homemade and yummy and the Jamaica Agua Fresca is fresh, tart and never overly sweet. Service was quick, and helpful, friendly.

24.description: Food was tremendously good. There is practically 1 thing on the menu but man do they do it well. I had the large birria plate (no bone) which is about 3 cups of birria. They served onions, cilantro, limes, and chiles on the side which all were fresh except for the limes which were dry but luckily for me I don't not put lime in my birria. Service was great, it was my first time there and instead of saying they'll give me more time with the menu she explained to me everything on the menu and how it was served, I actually never looked at the menu again as there was no need for it. Will I be back again? I think the question is, why haven't I been back already? Two thumbs up!!!

7.description: I've been checking out places in the city that yelpers have "raved" tremendously.  Hubby and I were passing through the Archer Heights neighborhood on S. Pulaski, attempting to head back north during pre-rush hours.  I knew that this place wouldn't have anything vegetarian for hubby since their dishes focus on "goat" as the primary source of meat.  Yet he was curious and wondering whether or not goat would cause any discomfort on his stomach.  After all, he became a "part-time" vegetarian because he experienced ongoing stomach problems and illnesses due to the consumptions of meat and poultry.  Well, obviously his stomach could deal with goat just fine.  The owner, who shares 95% similarity with the famous George Clooney, warmly greeted us and invited us to sit down anywhere we liked.  The entire dining room was fairly small, and the wall decors had nothing fancy or special.  The young lady server quickly approached to our table with an i-pad in her hands (small businesses' favorite piece of technology).  We wanted horchata (of course) while we were perusing through the menu.  The menu is relatively simple.  In summary, there are three (3) types of entrees to choose from: tacos, quesadilla, and small/large plates.  All entrees feature goat as the sole protagonist.  We went with two (2) orders of Plate Chico (small size) and added the warm salsa served in a molcajete.  That salsa was spicy, but that spiciness was so smooth that I kept on eating it with my spoon, one scoop after another.  Their goat was tender, juicy, and flavorful.  I know it wasn't easy to cook goat meat without sacrificing one (1) criterion for another.  Nevertheless, Birrieria Zaragoza did it!  We asked for extra tortilla because that salsa was just that awesome!  By the way, the horchata was also delicious.  I liked how they used the crushed ice instead of the full-sized ice cubes.  The full-sized ice cubes tend to dilute the horchata mix.  Yes, there's always science behind food-making.  The owner (Mr. Clooney...was that you?) and all workers at the restaurant were very welcoming and beyond friendly.  I can't wait to come back!

49.description: We just ate there and yes! This place is as good as the reviews say. What a delicious, wonderful meal. So many things go right at once here, starting with the fact that their food is truly amazing, they are fast, very friendly and make you feel at home. They follow a golden rule to success "focus", and they do, they focus on what they do right and stuck to it and do it amazing. They have just a handful of menu items (goat, a sauce and a couple of quesadillas) and they execute them impeccably. Their goat is cooked in a flavorful spicy house sauce and slowly cooked for hours and presented promptly on a handsome square white plate on some delicious broth. They bring you incredible home-made tortillas and off you go making tacos of that deliciousness! No wonder this place was named best taco in Chicago and #10 in the whole country!The lady (is she the owner) is so friendly and she offers you not only samples but a wealth of knowledge about goat meat. Apparently there's a Harvard study that found that goat meat is the healthiest there is in every regard (almost 4 grams of fat less than chicken!), I found a study, I don't know if it's the Harvard one but it blows you away (i'm attaching a key chart of that study, look at it and marvel!)Stephanie Izard is killing it preparing goat in the West Loop at her Girl and the Goat powerhouse. Birrieria Zaragoza is right up there with (if not better than) Girl and the Goat in flavor (except the amazing big birria plate at Zaragoza costs you only $10)Congrats Zaragoza! You have an awesome future for so many reasons! I'll make the 45 min drive from my place to eat there as often as I can!

40.description: Wow! What a find! This place is absolutely fantastic! The waitstaff is friendly and explains things well both in English and Spanish. We met the owner and she explained to us the health benefits of goat. Now the food, just fantastic. It is authentic Mexican here. The spices, the hand-made tortillas, the slow-cooked goat. Absolutely stellar. It is tiny and expect it to be a no-nonsense atmosphere.

53.description: Super authentic spot that is worth stopping by for the goat and the ambiance.  The place is really small, but because they were packed we got to eat in their office, which was located after walking through the kitchen. It made me feel like like I was really in Mexico. There is no choice, besides large or small, bone in or bone out. Its nice to just eat and not think. The hot salsa was amazing. The tomatoes and smoke were a perfect combination. The goat feel off the bone, great seasoning.  The tortillas were yummy but I wish they were a bit thinner as I got full right away.  Don't come expecting tacos or you'll be disappointed(top tacos in America list have his categorized wrongly, don't think Big Star or similar). Come for an experience for nostalgia and goat.

30.description: Unbelievable.  Best tacos in existence.  I suppose not technically a taco.  They serve one thing. Birria. Home made tortillas and amazing warm salsa.  My favorite Mexican in the city

46.description: I've been checking out places in the city that yelpers have "raved" tremendously.  Hubby and I were passing through the Archer Heights neighborhood on S. Pulaski, attempting to head back north during pre-rush hours.  I knew that this place wouldn't have anything vegetarian for hubby since their dishes focus on "goat" as the primary source of meat.  Yet he was curious and wondering whether or not goat would cause any discomfort on his stomach.  After all, he became a "part-time" vegetarian because he experienced ongoing stomach problems and illnesses due to the consumptions of meat and poultry.  Well, obviously his stomach could deal with goat just fine.  The owner, who shares 95% similarity with the famous George Clooney, warmly greeted us and invited us to sit down anywhere we liked.  The entire dining room was fairly small, and the wall decors had nothing fancy or special.  The young lady server quickly approached to our table with an i-pad in her hands (small businesses' favorite piece of technology).  We wanted horchata (of course) while we were perusing through the menu.  The menu is relatively simple.  In summary, there are three (3) types of entrees to choose from: tacos, quesadilla, and small/large plates.  All entrees feature goat as the sole protagonist.  We went with two (2) orders of Plate Chico (small size) and added the warm salsa served in a molcajete.  That salsa was spicy, but that spiciness was so smooth that I kept on eating it with my spoon, one scoop after another.  Their goat was tender, juicy, and flavorful.  I know it wasn't easy to cook goat meat without sacrificing one (1) criterion for another.  Nevertheless, Birrieria Zaragoza did it!  We asked for extra tortilla because that salsa was just that awesome!  By the way, the horchata was also delicious.  I liked how they used the crushed ice instead of the full-sized ice cubes.  The full-sized ice cubes tend to dilute the horchata mix.  Yes, there's always science behind food-making.  The owner (Mr. Clooney...was that you?) and all workers at the restaurant were very welcoming and beyond friendly.  I can't wait to come back!

1.description: The three star ranking is not because the birria is not delish but because of the way the owners overprice everything to the point of nickle and diming you..my husband is from Jalisco...(the primary state birria originated from and whenever we go...we always have to get us some birria) so I would classify myself as a birria specialist..and insomuch as in Jalisco as many of the other Birrerias in the city..i can tell you that the broth (consome) IS part of the birria..and here they charge you addtl if you want it with the broth...I can totally understand charging extra if we want EXTRA consome but charging it from the get-go is just crazyI will explain via analogy...It's like making chicken noodle soup and charging you extra for the broth....that is just NOT nice and a way to overcharge an already overpriced dish..(perhaps because of the label "organic goats" that gets tossed around and easily manipulated...but hey it's their business and they can charge  whatever they want and its up to the consumer to decide.The homemade tortillas are very good...However, their homemade molcajete salsa was NOT hot nor did it really have any outstanding flavor to it.(and again..they charge extra for that)..the salsa they do have gratuitous tasted like something store bought...They will also charge more for taking the bones out...( i hope im proving my point by this time)Which I did ask to b taken out and I still had lots of tiny fragments of bone....so it wasnt even worth paying extra for that since they didnt do a very good job...All in all..the birria is pretty good in comparison to other places we have tried but out of principle..we certainly will not be returning.One of the other reviewers..Cristaldo said it best..."Too many hidden fees..Trying to act like they're a fancy restaurant. "

55.description: If you can get here, you need to come here. The food was the best meal in a 2 week trip I just back from around Chicago and Boulder. I never knew goat could taste so good. We got on the bone and the al fresca sides were great to go with it. Get a fun drink there as well, something you're not going to get anywhere else. Chicago is known for the pizza and hot dogs, but it should be known for the goat served here. So much better, healthier, and outright awesome.

9.description: The goat is good, served with  plenty of juice to soak up with the home made tortillas.   I had the small plate and hibiscus tea so I can't speak of the salsa, which should probably be offered as part of the meal when factoring in the prices. $14 for 3 tacos and a tea should include a decent salsa. I still recommend it, parking is hard and it it a bit pricey but worth the trip if you have never been there. It may open your mind to try to make goat at home, I think if you give it love, and effort you can make it better give it a try,

26.description: Fantastic food and experience!  The horchada and the handmade tortillas are amazing!  I can't recommend this place highly enough.

25.description: Delicious goat tacos!  Friendly and fast service with a smile.  We really enjoyed the fresh corn tortillas.  Will go back again for sure!

12.description: Just tried this place for the first time and all I can say is amazing. The young gentleman with the beard and beautiful eyes that just came from Mt. Everest or looked like he did was so very nice. This was my first time here and he was gracious enough to let me try one. I give this place five stars for food and service

59.description: Our family had a fantastic meal here today! The tortillas were home made delicious and the cabrito was tender and perfect! Can't wait to go back!

21.description: What a cute, yummy little spot to have lunch.  This place will make you want to bleat for joy. The owner was very warm and welcoming. He personally walked us through the menu, described the food preparation, and gave us his recommendation. Food was delicious, the quiet setting was nice, and I loved the people, extremely sweet.  A great first impression.  Mary should have had a little goat instead of lamb. Just my opinion. Baaa-a-a-a-a.

17.description: First time in Chicago! After 10 years haven't eat birria, this remember my casa in Mexico! So good!

10.description: Best goat and homemade tortillas!  Must try the roasted tomato salsa. Went with a friend of mine from Jalisco,  Mexico  where there specialty is Goat.  I love this place and he wanted to eat food from his home state.  He said it was great!  He also said "I have eaten this many times and if I said it's great you know it tastes like home!" Plus goat is all they serve so of course it is their specialty.   I was there last week and Sunday. Sunday was a line for a seat. There were also two guitarist who played and sang beautifully.

5.description: Before coming to this place I thought no one made birria as good as my mom, but this place knows how to do it right! It was mine and my husbands first time trying this place and we were blown away, not only by the amazing food but by the awesome customer service, we will absolutely, positively be coming back, luckily we only live 5 minutes away!!!

3.description: Just like another reviewer said, the Two star rating is not for their birria which is good but for their hidden charges. We were seated in a little hidden room right behind their kitchen where we didn't have access to their posted menu. When we asked for one, the waitress said they didn't have any. She then proceeded to take our order and asked how we wanted our goat meet in our stew. We were charged 2.50 extra per person just for serving us our Birria on a different plate (cazuela de barro) and were also charged extra for how we wanted our meat. At no point did this waitress mention how much extra we would be charged. Needless to say, we wont be coming back to a place that charges as if they were a steakhouse.

35.description: Amazing Birria! The meat is sooo soft, melt in your mouth tender, very juicy! The tortillas are thick and soft, the condiments just make it all come together nicely. The negative...Waaay overpriced! Expect to pay around $30-$40 for two people if you order the large plates (large plates but not large portions). If you feel full after eating here will most likely be from the tortillas not the birria. The dining space is the size of the average house dining room (not very big) and it's difficult to find seating. So simply put, If I'm going to spend $40 on lunch with a friend, the place should at least have room for you to seat and eat your expensive food, or have decent sized portions, unfortunately this place is lacking both. May go back if they move to a bigger location.

19.description: I'm an Arizona native where authentic Mexican food is hardly in short supply and I say they could open a location in Phoenix/Scottsdale and still stand out for their absolutely delicious recipes. They slow steam their goat for about 5 hours then marinate it for another couple days, then slow braise it in the oven. This kind of care shows through in the texture and complex flavored of the meat. I think I'll fly in to Midway more often just to come here.

28.description: Great food. They do one thing and they do it well. The goat was delicious. The molcajete was phenomenal and the tortillas were on point. Everyone should go.

45.description: The best part of the dinner was the homemade tortillas. The goat is good but I have had better in Chicago. The broth was very plain. This place is expensive and you don't get your money's worth at all. Fancy plating with little meat. **too many hidden fees that they don't tell you about. And they ask you for so many options for some goat when it's a small menu and everywhere single thing is extra!!!It's a dirty hole in the wall place Trying to act like they're a fancy restaurant. They need to update their tables and chairs. They have their nerve to sell you a small salsa for $3.50First and last time going there.Birria Ocotlan is way better and inexpensive.

33.description: Wow! Their birria is just the best around and is almost if not the same as the birria from La Barca, Jalisco. Homemade tortillas and perfect goat meat! Delicious! The restaurant is family friendly and family operated.

43.description: Amazing tacos. The meat is top notch and they make their own tortillas. They also have an amazing staff that is super friendly. We felt like we were eating at someone's home. We just finished a taco crawl and Birrieria Zaragoza was our favorite spot.

2.description: Homemade tortillas! Seeing those warm and fluffy tortillas pressed by hand made them taste that much better. The birria tasted delicious, but I thought it was a little dry. However, as I have never had goat before, I am unsure if that's how the meat usually tastes or if it was just a tad overcooked. For my first visit, I only ordered the tacos de birria; for my next visit, I will definitely order large plate of birria instead, as other yelpers have stated the meat from their large plates were tender and juicy. Nonetheless, the combination of their homemade tortillas, the flavorful meat, freshly cut onions and cilantro, and a little dash of lime is a must-try! The only down was the overpriced salsa; how can salsa not be complimentary?

18.description: My wife and I always drove past the restaurant and never stopped in until this past weekend. The food and service was fantastic! We were very please with our experience. Really loved the handmade tortillas. The fire roasted salsa was amazing and the tacos were out of this world good! We are so happy we finally stopped there and will def be back for more! The people that work there were also very friendly and welcoming! Can't say enough good things about this place except we will be back again! (and that's the best compliment, isn't it?)

41.description: If you like goat, you'll love this place.If you've never had goat, I cannot recommend this restaurant strongly enough.  Their food is outstanding and such friendly folks!  I love going there.Its a hole in the wall restaurant.  A truly great find for me.

52.description: Amazing food!! I was upset at how small it was when i walked in...but they have great service...and had a seat ready in minutes...fresh TORTILLAS can't beat that...

50.description: Never had ate at a place like this.  The woman behind the counter was incredibly helpful and made the visit easy.  No need for the quesadilla (even though it was good), and just come with an open mind and the staff will help you with the rest.

4.description: Wow!  Holy goat the food is great! They hand make their own tortillas which are the best I've ever had! And the meat is so tender it falls off the bone!  I highly recommend trying this place out!   Also the hochatta drink is Amazing!  A must try!

6.description: What a cute, yummy little spot to have lunch.  This place will make you want to bleat for joy. The owner was very warm and welcoming. He personally walked us through the menu, described the food preparation, and gave us his recommendation. Food was delicious, the quiet setting was nice, and I loved the people, extremely sweet.  A great first impression.  Mary should have had a little goat instead of lamb. Just my opinion. Baaa-a-a-a-a.

22.description: The goat is good, served with  plenty of juice to soak up with the home made tortillas.   I had the small plate and hibiscus tea so I can't speak of the salsa, which should probably be offered as part of the meal when factoring in the prices. $14 for 3 tacos and a tea should include a decent salsa. I still recommend it, parking is hard and it it a bit pricey but worth the trip if you have never been there. It may open your mind to try to make goat at home, I think if you give it love, and effort you can make it better give it a try,

15.description: Like many review here I am in love with this restaurant. Tough to get in on the weekends it's small and lots of people. First come first serve but totally worth the wait. Staff is very friendly. All they do is Birria (goat) but they do it right. So juicy and tender. Tortillas hand made and delicious salsa. One of the best spots in Chicago for Birria by far.

57.description: Super good goat meat place on the south side. Very tender and flavorful meat that's served with traditional Mexican sides (onion and cilantro) with an optional roasted hot sauce. They will also serve any part of the goat that you'd like, including "inners". Plus, fresh corn tortillas made in house. Prices are a little higher than your typical Mexican joint worth it. My only issue with the amount of fat and gristle they serve with the meat. Otherwise great.

20.description: I'm an Arizona native where authentic Mexican food is hardly in short supply and I say they could open a location in Phoenix/Scottsdale and still stand out for their absolutely delicious recipes. They slow steam their goat for about 5 hours then marinate it for another couple days, then slow braise it in the oven. This kind of care shows through in the texture and complex flavored of the meat. I think I'll fly in to Midway more often just to come here.

36.description: Its overpriced. 2 adults 2 tolddlers we spent around 70 dollars. I've honesty would much rather drive down to south chicago border line to indiana to birreria octolan they serve bigger and more flavorful portions.

14.description: Ummmm. Wow. Blown away. The Birria was sublime. Tender beyond description in a really tasty yet subtle salsa. The tortillas were freshly made, pillowy and warm. The condiments while sparse were perfectly matched. Maybe the best taco ever? The chase for that prize continues!

12.description: I always order form here when don't feel like cooking and still good flavor and fresh, every time I have to wait because I order form inside the store but this time I decided to do it online and way ahead of time so I don't have to wait!! By the time I get to the store they didn't got my order from online even if I have a confirmation order and everything so once AGAIN I have to wait.. Of order online call to make sure otherwise you will have to wait.

7.description: Wings are great but my online or phone in orders are always 20-30 late. Even with the estimated finish time the online ordering or the people give you.

3.description: The only good thing here is the barbecue. .. tried the hot and mild wings noooo flavor what so ever and fried to a crisp ....

1.description: It was okay. The teriyaki was pretty good. The potato salad was decent.  Waited a while for them though.  Ordered the 8 piece combo with veggie sticks.

2.description: Finally, tried this place out, but it was a let down. The wings were small and I was not a fan of the flavors. I did like the fries though.My guy and I both thought everything was a tad salty too.I'll stick with Hooters.

9.description: Hot wings have finally landed near Midway and this one is perfect. I am so happy that someone decided to be smart and open this place. I go to Wing Stops all over Chicago, but now there is one near me and I will be a regular.Many different flavors of wings and the beer works too! Have a Jamaican Red Stripe and some wings and you will be satisfied for sure. Order ahead for games and they will oblige.

10.description: Poor service, they have great wings here but each and every time I stop by to pick my wings up, no one seems to know what they are doing. Mind you they are very ghetto, maybe it's the neighborhood. Fries are very disappointing as well.

13.description: Use to come here on a fairly regular basis, mainly cus family members of mine liked the food. But it seemed like a regular practice of this place is to forget stuff like dipping sauces. But recently I had a really bad experience where THEY messed up my order BIG TIME and then as I try to argue they try to make it seem like I placed the order wrong. So not only did THEY mess up the order but then THEY try to make ME look stupid? Oh yeah, excellent customer service. And the parking situation here sucks. There are only 3 spots cus everything else is either for the Cricket store or the random computer place to the south of it. You are better off going to the one on archer near Austin.

16.description: First time at Wing Stop. I liked it a lot. More than Buffalo wild wings. The customer service was great and the bread, "Oh boy", the flavor I cannot explain. I definitely will be going back.

17.description: Day 1: Got a 6 pc bone-in, mild to sample... They were cooked perfect. Made us decide to give this place a shot.Day 2: All 3 flavors of wings were way over cooked, the flavor of lemon pepper: too much salt, garlic parm- tasty, Hawaiian-tasty as well. The fries are too salty and have a honey tasting seasoning that was unexpected. They forgot some dipping sauce and didnt give the cups for the sodas~ Potato salad has way too much mustard otherwise, not too bad. The beans are just okay, something is missing from them.... The celery and carrots were fresh and crisp, the ranch dressing is .... yep, you guesed it too salty. The rolls: just slightly dry, taste pretty good.

15.description: As a wing lover this place is pretty awesome. The wings are freshly made, but contrary to what they claim about the wings being ready to go... I had to wait 14 minutes for the food. I was told about the wait time after I paid.

0.description: I honestly think their wings are alright in flavor, I've tried mild and the orignial hot. The only thing is they can tend to be a little too salty. The times I've been here the service was on point though

5.description: Tried giving this Wingstop another try and they failed again.Food was cold, fries were cold. Wings were disappointing, hardly any chicken on the traditional wings. Sticking to BWW

11.description: Love their wings! My favorite are the Cajun for the spicy but not overwhelming and the garlic Parmesan ones are not spicy but they are so crispy and delicious. The best part of it all are the fries! They have a sweet yet greasy taste to them which go soo good with the ranch dipping sauce. Their wings are waaaaaaaaaay better than Buffalo Wild Wings for sure! I ordered ahead and the guy who took my order got it right and my food was ready when I got there! You guys are getting better!!!

8.description: My sister brought some last night and I love them. They taste great and I'm going to try the other flavors soon

4.description: Ordered online and still had to wait about 20 minutes after the pickup time. The wings and fries were pretty good though, not the best but decent.

14.description: The employees where nice but I personally didn't like the food at all!I really wanted to try Wing Stop but this killed my dream :(  I'll honestly never go back again, the wings were blah!  Not even the sauce was good.  The potato salad had hard potatoes!  The fries were good!  I'm honestly not a picky eater but the food wasn't good at all!  The employees and manager were very nice.

6.description: I heard this place had good chicken!! Omg so , not true!! Nasty!! the taste was not a pleasant  one.   Ill never go there again.

0.description: Is not hard to find good tacos around this areas... I had them earlier today and lets say I am still feeling them. I would skip this place and go to a busier taco place down the street.

This supply has everything you need. From nail essentials to eye brow needs. Being a make up artist, having a place that has tools is essential. I like the fact that it is near my home and I know things are easily accessible. Most of the times, when you want good quality items you have to either go to Sephora or MAC but this is the easiest and less economical way of getting items. Its located inside a plaza so there is various spots to check out besides this place. BUT, the parking lot seems to be full all of the time. I pass here every day and notice that parking (although plentiful) is scarce. So get ready for a parking disaster.

1.description: Let me start off with the quality of these clothes is excellent for the price. Even disregarding the price, it's still excellent. I have a pair of jeggings and a sweater I bought 3+ years ago and it's as good as the day I bought it. It may vary from each article of clothing, but you can really get some good quality clothes here. They HAVE brand name things, for example I saw a Kenneth Cole Reaction purse for under $20, purses similar to Target's brand for under 20 as well when Target is selling them for $30. I ended up coming into this Discovery on a whim after 3 years or so from my last visit. They make every customer aware of the return policy when you check out, and I can imagine why. I work retail as well and the people around here will try to return anything. I found so many things I wanted to buy. If you haven't visited in a while, stop by! And if you've never come in, well come in there's so much to shop from.

2.description: Club Clothing! Where I got my J. LO accessories. You can't beat $2.49 each for hoop earrings, a bling ring, and bangles. $9.99 for a blinged out gold purse. It was very chaotic and difficult to maneuver in this store. You had to step over clothes and kids. Yes, kids! People let their children run around like it's Gymboree. The clothes are low quality, almost disposable, but definitely sexy looking. If you need cheap accessories like purses, belts, jewelery this is where to go. The clothes... not my style. But if you're between 16-25 yrs old and got to Excalibur, Buzz, Enclave, Reunion, etc... get your hot and sexy club clothing here! Guys will buy you drinks all night.

0.description: So I went in with a friend, this place has certainly changed since 2011 review. It's super well organized, the staff is very friendly and the stick seems to of been upscaled a bit. Meaning they have less gaudy but really nice looking pieces.I can't help but think what happened sinceMy last review but I can say I am pleasantly Pleased at the progress. Even their displays are very nice and chic.You can't best prices here and compared I Mall prices, what can I say? Nicely done but hold onto your receipt for exchanges and please don't wear the clothes if you're going to return. That's just tacky and for the price of clothes here you can afford to buy more. Check them out and definitely remember that there are no dressing rooms here ladies.

3.description: The Starbucks workers at this location is in need of customer service skills talking about the two african-American girls everyone else is great and very welcoming

1.description: Gross!  There must have been 30 flies surrounding the work area and the one barista seemed to be ok with it. Like she has been dealing with flies all her life. She was horrible too!  I'm never going in there again. I'd rather get Dunkin Donuts!  Yuck!

2.description: 25 minutes it took me to order a venti hot chocolate!!! Seriously?? That's just insane. The line was not even long about 2 people in front of me! Seriously? The worse costumer service ever. Never did I wait in line so much for a hot chocolate at any Starbucks I mean seriously this is not downtown were u usually have a line of about 10 people!! That's not normal..

5.description: Hit or miss here unless you get "Jose".  The other members of the crew come and go so the drinks are inconsistent.

0.description: They are slow here now. Sometimes they only have 1 worker and it takes forever to even get to order. Also, they are not the friendliest.

4.description: Asked for a Venti iced coffee with sugar free vanilla and heavy whipping cream and the employee, a young Hispanic lady, who took my order was confused with what heavy whipping cream was and asked if I wanted whip cream on top, I told her once again I wanted heavy cream at which point she turn and asked her co-worker what that was. Her co-worker asked if I wanted half-and-half. At this point I was frustrated and again asked her for heavy cream. The co-worker a young African-American was clearly frustrated as well and said her shift was over and she had no time to deal with this. I told the employee taking my order that half-and-half was fine. She was nice enough to have someone check in the back to see if there was heavy cream which there was. She showed me a carton which read "heavy whipping cream." Unfortunately the coffee was horrible and I was displeased with how rude the young African-American lady was. Don't waste your money here, drive to 47th & Cicero...

1.description: Best choco covered almonds while getting the best deal, outlet store!!! Great value, one lb $4 special!

2.description: Had issues with stale chocolates and weights being less than stated.  Filled out comments on their website requesting feedback.  Waited 3 weeks, no response from company, will not purchase from again.

0.description: I love, love, love World's Finest Chocolates!!   I used to love that time of the year as a kid, when we would do fundraising and sell their chocolate bars.  My waistline and teeth took a big hit because i would buy so many bars at once.  Alas,  I dont have to chase down the kids selling chocolate bars for their fundraising any longer. WFC opened a storefront a few years back and relocated across the road to their new location on South Pulaski Rd., which serves my occasional craving for their carmel and almond chocolate bars that I loved growing up.Cheap prices on regular and thrift candy bars, bulk and boxed candy. TIP:  Great place to shop for Valentines Day, Easter, Halloween, etc..  they usually have some gift sets all ready to go for each special occasion.

Must admit, I never knew that this store sold men's shoes also. So here I am at the new location and decided to browse. Came out with a few pair of shoes (buy one get one half off) and you all know I can't pass up a bargain ever! The choices are really nice from conservative to adidas gym shoes for men , women and kids. I think I have a new place to shop at and considering its inside the new Pulaski shopping center this makes me smile. The workers of course are new and quite happy so let's hope this momentum keeps going. I let the manager know I was adding them to YELP (and he should be happy) but no, he's like "oh I can't authorize that you have to contact corporate. Umm no i don't. He's very fortunate I am just reviewing the store or that comment would of upset me but I digress like a Chubb of being shown the dark side of a chocolate shop and an all you can eat free candy display. Lucky indeed.The bargains here seem very competitive and I am really impressed with the flow of the store, let's just keep it going and clean so that man others will be able to enjoy this new section of stores in our far hamlet. Come by and see for yourself how the shoes are rather nice and affordable. Let the games begin as the store grows in reviews and just in popularity so that they can be successful. Happy YELPing, and remember if the shoe fits, slip it on and wear it!

3.description: I have been getting my eyebrows done at this nail shop on ashland but they really messed my eyebrows up. (One eyebrow was way shorter than the other) so after growing them out for a while I stopped by Nail Academy yesturday because I've been looking for another place to get my eyebrows done and decided to stop in here because my mother gets her brows done here and they're always perfect. They fixed my brows up and listened to my requests. The lady waxed them quick and clean, and wiped them before and after with an oil of some sort to prevent bumps. Nail Academy is now my permanent brow place, I love it!

1.description: City inspectors or health inspectors get in there "NOW" no sanitation at all .,, they jump from chair to chair fungus being transmitted . Don't go !!!! I just came out of there disgusted with service and how they don't even care ., they wear same plastic gloves as they think they are being clean and what they are doing is just as bad as not wearing them passing around fungus ., using same nail filler and not only that but person next to me was bleeding from her cuticle and the nail tech seem to careless and just jumps to the following chair rushing to get people out .., mind you pedicures ., no words .., see for your self .,,  Best part they force a tip .., unbelievable smh

2.description: Shitty customer service. Was waiting for a no chip with one specific employee, for over 20 minutes, when someone walked in and wanted fake nails. The lady tells me I'd have to get them done by someone else. Apparently only ONE person is able to do fake nails?? HOW. Ridiculous.

9.description: Went back the next day with a girlfriend for a pre-wedding mani/pedi.  My friend got there at 10 am (it's a very small little plaza, sharing a small "parking lot" off Pulaski - don't sneeze or you'll miss it) and waited outside their doors in the calm, sweltering Chicago summer humidity, for twenty minutes until they decided to open their doors.  Very professional, right off the bat.  We got our pedis, headed over to the mani station, and I then casually confirmed the price I was quoted over the phone.  They tried to charge me $20 more than what I what quoted.  I ended up just stopping them before I got the no-chip mani, paid for my pedi, and got the h*ll out of there, but not before they snickered in their language and laughed, "you thought how much??? no! no!"  The pedi was decent, to be fair, but it wasn't worth the price, the humiliation, or the hassle/wait/unprofessionalism.

10.description: Came to get a pedi and a gel set for prom last minute. It was a Thursday night, and I expected no wait, but when I arrived they were busy. It was about a 20 minute wait, but I didnt mind. Paid 43 all together and theres honestly no beating that. Considering places by my house will charge that for the gel set by itself. I have gotten compliments from friends and strangers, who think that they are my real nails. Little do they know theyre fake, and for $18 you can't go wrong. The salon itself is small and could be better kept, but the services they provide at the cost they do is unbeatable. I just wish they had a bigger selection of essie polishes!

4.description: Worst place ever!! Never again. First time the place was busy so it was understandable the lack of courtesy no not really!!! But ok, second time same thing! Bad customer service, no communication and the place is very filthy. If the employees don't like or enjoy their work then quit it!!

6.description: At first, I loved this place. No chip for $25? But then after a few manicures, they started to go the cheap route to do things. Filing off the no chip instead of soaking it off properly. My nails are so damaged and so thin, it's painful. I guess you get what you pay for.

12.description: I've been going to this place for years, not often, but whenever I do need a pedicure or manicure, this is the place for me. Tops things I like about this place:- Tile floors...I've been to my share of nail joints with carpeting that look very dirty and unsanitary.- Convenient parking ... lot in front, I can always find parking- Massaging chairs :D- $25 mani/pedi special Sunday through Thursday...best deal I've come accross.I've never had an unpleasant experience here. Will definatly keep this as my #1 spot for mani/pedis. P.S. Also offer waxing

5.description: Really unhappy with my pedicure. I paid $25 to get the top of my toe sanded off because the lady wasn't paying attention and I was only in the chair for 10 minutes (my friends were in the chair for 30-45 minutes and got a leg/foot massage). She then proceeded to draw a design on my toe, which she implied would be for free because she cut me and I was bleeding profusely and then charged me for it. When I went to get my money back because I was still bleeding 30 minutes later, they would not give me my money back. As if this weren't scary enough, someone was in the chair/tub that I had just bled all over and I know it wasn't cleaned properly. I don't know if they used the same tools that they did on me, but if they did, they weren't clean. They are lucky I don't have a blood born pathogen because they could get a lot of people sick!! Don't ever go here, it's not worth the sanitary risk!

13.description: I love this nail shop.. My nails stay on  for so long, I get gel nails and they are very cheap. The woman who does my nails always takes her time with them, she never rushes. I literally don't go anywhere else to get my nails done ever since I stepped foot in this place. Also, when your nails are at the drying station another woman always gives me a back massage, it always nice :D

11.description: Love this place! Just recently started going here. I am a fan of the no chip manicure , only $25 when typically they are $35 any where else. Everyone is really friendly, great quality polishes , and not a long wait when I go. My no chip lasted it's promising 2-3 weeks. The girls there take their time and do an excellent job. My new favorite place. It's nothing fancy, but it will do :)

8.description: Came here for a regular French mani/pedi. I wasn't in my usual area and really didn't know where to go but yelp has done me a solid once again. Walked-in and was greeted and immediately was soaking my dogs in a bath of water. Water could have been hotter but that's something I won't complain about. My foot ran into a table and part of my big toe nail was gone and the lady did the best she could and an impressive job frenching that bad boy up. The only thing I didn't like about the pedi was either I had some horrible feet underneath or she just did a quick job but there was still a bit of dead skin down there which was one of the primary reasons I went in there. The mani was fantastic! She shaped it better than anyone else I have ever gone too. Even after the paint chipped and I took it off and the nail grew out, they were in such an amazing shape! One of these best manis I have had. Its unfortunate that the paint starting chipping off in 2 days. Next time I think ill try the no-chip.

0.description: Ladies are so nice minus the fact they request a tip when you pay which I find rude if asking for additional money-- it's courtesy to leave tip but don't ask and be put on the spot. They added "spa" options for $38 which includes green tea mask for your legs, mint & sugar scrubs + a longer message for on your feet and legs. Worth the cost but a little pricey compared to spa treatments I've had before.

7.description: This is a great nail salon. Everyone is very friendly. It's especially good if you're in a hurry. They are quick, but still take their time to do a good job. Even as a walk-in, I've never waited more than 5 minutes to be taken. The prices are also VERY reasonable... they're some of the lowest I've ever seen. They have a great ongoing special: $25 mani/pedi (Sunday-Thursday only). The place is very clean and sanitary, which makes a huge difference for me. Extra perk: the ladies all give you a little shoulder rub while you wait for your nails to dry under the lamps! I always leave feeling so relaxed. While they do accept Credit, it seems like they prefer cash. When I reached for my credit card, the girl asked me if I had cash. Not really a big deal, but I try to bring cash because it's such a great value for the quality.

1.description: Weather you're looking for a quick haircut or long term barber these guys will take of you. Good environment, atmosphere.

0.description: Straight up hair cut! No frills or manicures here. Just great cuts. Three or four barbers clipping away.

3.description: This place is more like a flea market. It reminded me of Swap-o-Rama except you don't pay admission. They have a little bit of everything: jewelry, clothing for the family, shoes, a barbershop, pet store, hell I think I saw a tattoo shop, although I didn't go investigate to be sure. I don't know how I feel about the pets for sale. Listen, it's important to note this is not the place for quality merchandise. I knew what to expect so, I really don't have a problem with it. I'd like to think that this type of place benefits people who need a cheap place to rent  for business which I think is important.. *Shrugs* I will say that I used the ladies restroom and it was to my great surprise, very clean and fresh smelling. Sooo, I have experienced better but in many ways, it's no worse than some of the malls I've been to.

1.description: Not sure if this should turn into a segment. I have so many horror stories about this place that it would take me years until I point out every flaw this place has. I've gotten my ear pierced here once and boy was it something I regretted for months. I got the worst infection I could possibly get. Now some of the stuff I've bought  here does not last at all. The only stand I trust is the one that's a stand away from the entrance. It's in the middle hallway. It sells shoes. I can get converse here at a great price and if you bargain with them they will lower the price. The animals they sell here are in poor health and I wonder if there is a way to call some animal cruelty number to get them taken away. They have a macaw that's in the poorest condition it could be in. I have so much more to say but I do not have the strength to type anymore. I'll give an update if I ever feel motivated enough. Do not waste time in here unless you're used to places like these.

2.description: Super Mall doesn't exactly resemble a typical "mall" like the Water Tower Place, Westfield Old Orchard, or Woodfield.  Each store inside is an individual kiosk.  In other words, there's no local, regional, or national stores you are familiar with.  Each kiosk is rented, merchandized in whatever fashion they want, and can potentially cause someone to feel claustrophobic since a kiosk is rather tiny and cramped.  Hubby has never seen a "mall" like this, yet this type of place is everywhere in Taiwan, the country I spent the first fifteen (15) years of my life at.  The types of kiosks at the Super Mall are consisted of fine and fashion jewelry, electronics, western apparel, footwear, and accessories, junior clothing, vitamins, and other miscellaneous things I failed to notice while hubby and I were browsing through.  There is also a Mexican eatery and a snack shop immediately to the left upon entering.  Many stores appeared to be selling similar merchandize.  I didn't pay a close attention to the prices on similar items at different kiosks, but I believe the owners and clerks would probably be willing to accept your bargaining or bartering if you offer them a deal or some sort.  Since most kiosks cater to the local Hispanic community, it wouldn't hurt to be somewhat proficient in Spanish.  Knowing Spanish or even speaking some is beneficial in the city of Chicago anyways. They do have restrooms, but utilize them at your own risk.

9.description: I like this place, I never had a problem with any gangbangers or anything and I tend to just come here and hang outAll the food there is actually really good, I come here all the timeObviously if you go in looking like you own the place and dress all threatening then yeah you might get into some problems lol

10.description: This place is in an extremely sketchy area and i will most likely never be back. How are you able to look through a bunch of junk for something you might want to buy when you have to watch over your sholder the whole time making sure your wallet is not going to get snatched. I got a couple cool things from here but because of the area and the patrons here i will most likely not be back. And unless your in a gang i suggest that you not go there as well.

4.description: Who invited these gringos to the Supermall? I really don't care for the negative reviews from people that are mad that Latinos aren't catering to their weak ass language skills. I don't care that this is "America". I don't care that you guys have tried to impose your language and culture on every non-white person. You know what neighborhood you're in. You should know the community. If you don't, get out. [End Rant] Regarding this establishment, it's pretty ok. It's a nice place to spend your Saturday if you're in Mexican style mercados. Yeah, they're going to try to reel you in. I imagine they're trying to, you know, make money. The food is decent. I've only ever bought one thing from here, and that was a stationary set for $10. Like I said, it's a nice place wander around.

6.description: Totally a waste of time. I was embarrassed to even go in. It is certainly not the best place to shop. Stores are crowded together, it wasn't at all taken care of and their "food court", good gosh should I draw up an investigation here or what?I remember back in the day when the Supermalls were just a concept and when they came on, I was excited. But I guess back than, stores would take pride in their merchandise vs now. Everything seems so crammed together and so not worth me getting a headache every step I take and have someone basically beg me to buy something from their kiosk. No, I don't want baby shoes, does it look like I have bay bay kids all snot nosed hanging onto my shirt?Basically I will try to be kind and say, so not worth it. Sorry Mall rats, this is not a mall.

11.description: Its OK i guess. its good if you need a emergency hat for a fit, or you want to get your ears pierced on the cheap. There's alot of gangbangers so be careful if your wearing a hat, i actually got checked once when i was younger, i don't have a problem now that I'm older. I just put it like this, its one of those places where you get in and get out, not your window shopping place.

5.description: i have been to great supermalls in Florida but this one is ghetto, street, sketchy etc. the parking lot is dirty the sounds/rims on the cars that come here are more expensive than the actual cars (grow up people that is so "80"). The stores r not to bad but over priced Macys is cheaper. The people that come are sketchy wanna B's. I dont mind the Paisas and cowboys what I do mind  is the wanna B's-thugs-Losers that give a bad name to our Mexican people.

7.description: Every shop is basically the same. It doesn't look any different from when I was a kid in the 90s. Lots of low quality clothes and most of the vendor stands look the same. The food is more expensive than a stand-alone restaurant. The candy shop is very overpriced. The pet shop, like someone else said, is disgusting. Once my dad was foolish enough to buy fish from there and without my consent or knowledge decided to put them in my fishtank where all but one of them died (they where infected with ick) . I had expensive, show-quality guppies in there. There is really no reason to come here.

8.description: The only good thing I can say about the Supermall is that the patrons there are willing to negotiate prices on some of their items so you dont have to pay full price for the things you want. On the negative side, most of the people that work there don't speak English or have a horrible accent which makes it difficult for me and other non-hispanics to be able to communicate. In additon, the hallways are a little narrow and sometimes the sellers try to talk you in to buying their merchandise, even if your not interested in what their selling!  Which annoys the crap out of me! However if your looking to get a good deal on something, this is the place to go.

0.description: It is all about knowing yourself, the vendors and the place you are getting into.Do not come into this place expecting a regular mall with high end stores and overpriced stuff. This is more like an indoor tianguis or fleamarket, small stalls crammed together with a wide array of merchandise.Know yourself, you need to know what you want/need and take a stroll around and compare prices haggle a little and go for it. Or just look around.Know the vendors, they are there for the business so do not feel uncomfortable if they try to get and keep your attention so you buy something. Act like a local, if they do not have what you want just say no thanks and keep walking, or a simple just looking will do.Know the place, as said before, this is not macies or the mag mile, nothing wrong with the people there, they have security not only for inside but also for the parking lot. I make it here every once in a while and occasionally find something cool.

12.description: Tacos are about a dollar more that other Taquerias in the area but well worth it. They taste crazy fresh and the meat is amazing. Stay away from anything else on the menu. Just get Tacos. I always love the Tacos and am totally disappointed by the other food which I think they serve less... and therefore is less fresh.

7.description: i LOVE THIS PLACE!  Been in Pilsen 11 years - and this is one of the better "joints". BYOB and outdoor seating in the back.  My choice: LENGUA or esp the CHILE RELLENO TACO OR BURRITO if you want a true gut buster!They put everything on -- rice beans etc -prepare to be stuffed!The food is still good and reasonable....esp the chile rellenos!!

3.description: I was around the area with my friend as we were getting our cash washed nearby. We walked to the first place we could find and the reviews were pretty good, so we figured why not give it a try? I ordered 3 steak tacos with rice, beans, onions and cilantro. Yes, I know that is a hell lot to fit in a taco, but I like variety. They give you a nice cut of steak, but it is too chewy for me. It is good, but I do not prefer huge chunks of steak in a taco.

1.description: This is an attentive family operation that serves up some better than average Mexican fare. It's just like mom serving you excellent Tacos for Breakfast without asking you to do the dishes!You kind of want to fill your pockets with fresh made guacamole as well for the ride home...

2.description: Had a great lunch here.  Food was as authentic as you can find anywhere in Chicago.  Guacamole was a freebie and was fresh and home made.  Loved it.

9.description: 2012 Summer Taco TourExploring Pilsen's taco gold all summer. | First stop -- a few blocks from home.// The ExperienceStopped in on a Monday evening after work. Friendly woman at counter took ourorder and brought us chips as soon as we sat down.Festive decor, Caso Cerrado entertaining us (Telemundo's version of  Judge Judy)// The Food, The TacosCheap tacos. Big portions. Filling, but not quite satisfying.* Al pastor -- I enjoy well seasoned pork tacos. These were greasy and lacked flavor.* Chile Relleno Taco -- Roasted + bread poblano pepper served in a taco with beans. Again, greasy and not much flavor. Spoonfuls of the spicy salsa helped bring this flabby taco to life.* Eggs & Cactus -- what you would think, like a cactus omelet in a taco.* Chorizo -- the star of the dinner. Well spiced and, surprisingly, not a greasy mess like other place.Summary: It is what it is. Cheap decor, cheap tacos, cheap flavor. Not surprised, not disappointed, but also not in love.

10.description: I like this place. It's nothing fancy as far as decor, but the staff is really friendly and the atmosphere is pretty laid back. They had three types of salsa on the table, along with a bowl of jalapeños, hot carrots and onions. Plus, when you dine in, they give you free guacamo and fresh homemade chips! Very tasty! Their rice drink is delicous! We'll definately be coming back...

13.description: No bueno.  I've been here once, and though this food is very cheap, it skimps on flavor.  I got a chorizo and vegetarian tostada.  They were ok but didn't taste very "fresh."  The meat was more greasy than anything.  I will say this, the portions are very large.  And for what it is, it's a much better buy than fast food (probably for less money too).  Just with all the Mexican options around (especially in this area) I don't think I would choose Taco Bueno again.

16.description: Local taco joint close to home so it's perfect for picking up something quick. Go for the Arrachera (skirt steak) tacos not the Asada.  You'll taste the difference. If you like lengua(tongue) they have it in a red guisado sauce  that's real good also.

17.description: I love tongue tacos and this place has quality and quantity. I get the tongue tacos with the beans and rice. The reason they did not get five stars is because they use to give you more food, until the bad economy hit. I use to get extra tortillas and have six decent sized tacos instead of three huge tacos. I wash it down with a big orchatta and I'm a happy camper. The waitress very friendly and helpful. I come here for just the food. I was full and the bill came out around $10.00 for 3 big tacos, and a large rice water drink They have complementry tortilla chips with guacamole,sauce, green or red sauce.

15.description: This place is so cheap, so good, and you get giant portions.  I have been several times and everything I've tried has been delicious!

0.description: This man started from a little taco stand outside on cermak I remember my mom would take me to sneak a taco or 2 from the rest of the family And ever since I never stopped eating them I absolutely love them And higly recomend it

5.description: This place hits the spot!  I went here after hanging out in a frigid sports bar across the street.  I was cold and hungry, and this restaurant really helped me out.  The tortas are a good size, good quality meat, and the price is great.  They are open late, but are cash only (at least after 9pm), so stop by if you're in the neighborhood.

11.description: Living in Little Village/Pilsen for over 35 years and been in may Mexican restaurants, we were looking for a quick bite and we saw Taqueria Taco Bueno (had a different name on sing outside, I think it said Tacos Victor or something like that) and decided to come in. When we came in I had doubts about the place, but the menu was impressive large and they have hand made quesadillas and decent prices. The place is like a very local common restaurant, nothing even close to be fancy but it was decent. They have salsas on the tables and pickle jalapeños with carrots. I ordered a huitlacoche quesadilla and my wife 2 tacos one of chicharon and the other al pastor, good size tacos and they add rice and beans in it, the quesadilla came with a small portion of salad and a very delicious rice (like home made). For drinks we had agua de jamaica (not to sweet) and hand made chocolate actually using the hand molinillo. We were surprised when the waitress brought the guacamole and tostadas as appetizer, not the best but decent one; usually you pay extra for it at other restaurants. We loved the food and decent prices (cash only), tacos $2.50, quesadillas $4.50 including the huitlacoche and shrimp that usually are more expensive. The table setup was a little strange, they have a large table in the middle like for 20 people and tables of 4 on the side, I do not think that they can handle large groups without a previous notice. We only comment on the food we had, but definitely coming back to try other dishes.

8.description: I'll make this quick. The good-Relatively cheap. Huge portions! Chiles rellenos de picadillo (ground beef) - hard to find outside of Mexican homes.  Other dishes that are not that common at Mexican joints catering to GRINGOS. Such as tacos de chicharrones (pork rinds).  Pozole and menudo on weekends. And no I'm not referring to the latino boys band. Freshly squeezed OJ. The bad-Food is good but won't blow you away.  Go here for good but not awesome cheap eats and hard to find stuff (see above).The ugly-The restaurant. Yuck. Misspelled marker menu (eg. azada instead of asada)I'll be back again!

4.description: Dang so good! Bomb.com salsas, free guacamole, and the best chilaquiles this side of the mason dixon line.

14.description: Oh man, its good, goat meat taco's for gringos like me to enjoy, while my friends moms wonder why the hell I am eating peasant food they fled mexico to get away from. Portions are huge also, I love that they have tacos for $1.90 .Whenever some ass suggests Taco bell, i say TACO BUENO! SABROSO!

6.description: This is a great mom-and-pop Mexican food spot. The owner is there frequently and oversees the cooking... the attention to detail can be noticed in the high quality of their food. I've been coming here for years and never had a bad meal. My favorite is the chicken enchilada dinner. They will include a small piece of skirt steak (carne) with it - a tasty little surprise. The guacamole is great too. Heads up: cash only.

1.description: I was once a fan but alas, different owners and different service. They takeForever to serve you and heaven forbid you would like water. Shhh I will no longer return! I think fast food fish sandwich may be better!

0.description: I went today and they redid there whole menu and added new items, the food was good and they serve a lot. I will be going back
To my surprise everything tasted fresh the location looks very clean..loved the beans that came with the order!

3.description: This is the first time ever reviewing anything. Got to the drive though at 9pm and I was first in line to order. Waited for 10 minutes for someone to help me. No one did.  As I drove off a girl was standing right next to the window laughing and smiling. AVOID AT ALL COST! Save your self the stress.

1.description: Super fast but the one downside is that although they do haver a drive thru (and most in the area don't), it is a tricky turn if you have a bigger vehicle so be careful after you order. I saw an SUV already have problems turning. Although they just opened about a week ago, this place has been ready by the crowds. Right off of the I55 going south, once you get to the bottom of the bridge you will see it.  Service is alriight, than again they are all new. I am really glad we finally get a drive thru since this would be something of a convenience. Now they do have an area for outside also, BUT, I noticed one of the benches right on the edge of the curb, the same curb that the cars have to drive thru in order to order. Give them a chance and do the surveys on your receipts, you can always exchange them for coffee, donors or whatever you have as an inventive.

2.description: Great fast service. The workers are very friendly . I go here almost  every morning.  Its very close to the expressway. One thing that bothered me was that the cashier spoke to me in Spanish.  She should have spoken to me in English first. Thats just me. My opinion. I could  have spoken to her in Arabic  to  see how she felt. I do speak Spanish . I am Mexican. Many sadly do not speak the spanish language. I would just rather have heard  English  first.

5.description: OMG! I come to this dunkin cuz it's the closest to my job. The service it's good when the lady's are there. But the guys super slow! I was waiting for 10 min on the drive thru, and I still had to wait for them to bring my sandwich.  That's F**** UP.

6.description: Service sucks and the coffee is not good. Coffee has no coffee taste maybe its too much water and not enough coffee. They need to train all their workers on service and  food preperation, not to mention attitude and customer care. What a shame!

7.description: Awful service. The location is conviente before expressway. Service is terrible!!! The cashiers care more about the time clock on the board than the customer. I had a VERY BAD incedent with a visit. It's a complete NO NO!!! to ignore and rush a customer because your clock board is beeping !!!

8.description: Bad reception and awful service. The only thing they have going for them is that its right before you get on the expressway.

9.description: Rude customer service!!!! Ordered an ice coffee; when it was handed to me the lid popped off and coffee was all over me and the car. I told the girl that worked there to hand me some napkins and shes like what happened with a damn smirk on her face. When I told her what had happened, she didnt even apologize...never going back

0.description: Man, are they slow. One lady working the cash register, but she kept walking off after each order and coming back to take the next. They do seem to have a few people working the drive thru, but that seemed slow too.I think it took me about 20 minutes just to get a coffee and bagel sandwich.Parking is small and doesn't help when cars from the drive thru starts to get long.

4.description: 1. EXTREMELY slow service2. Small drive thru lane3. Disorganized staff. Made the mistake of coming here 3 times.  Each time the service was slow, had to repeat what we ordered multiple times and the straws and napkins bins were empty Do yourself a favor and visit a different location.

0.description: I recently came across Hemp Helps online clothing store & their mission of planting trees with a portion of the proceeds from every sale. In fact they plant 11 trees for every shirt sold and 3 trees for every bracelet sold to help fight against deforestation. Hemp Helps is a great company that has teamed up with another gem 'Trees for the future' who have planted over 100 million trees throughout Asia, Latin America & Africa=) I am a BIG supporter of Hemp related clothing for several reasons. To me Hemp clothing provides all the warmth, softness and durability that are seldom found in other materials. Hemp is extremely versatile and can be used for countless other products product's not to mention it is earth-friendly. I began scrolling through Hemp Helps website and found a couple of shirts I really dug. Anyone who knows me knows I am a t-shirt & jeans type of guy when away from work. So when I spotted a couple of amazing finds on Hemp Helps website I knew I had to purchase them. When it came time to check-out and pay for my items I was stoked to see that shipping within the confines of the United States is free=) After placing my order I received a confirmation email that my package was being shipped and it arrived quite quickly. When my package arrived I was pleasantly surprised to find my shirt wrapped in recyclable brown paper. Inside of the hand wrapped package my t-shirt was wrapped in a hemp bag that can be used for trips to the beach. As I explored the bag  future I found a bracelet which I gave to a friend under one condition if anyone asked where she got it she would not only tell them it is made from hemp but direct them to the Hemp Helps website. I felt like a kid walking down the stairs on Christmas morning. I found stickers in my hemp bag along with several inspirational quotes. I believe everything happens for a reason and I was meant to stumble upon this website and I am so glad that I did. I washed my hemp t-shirt as instructed and let it hang dry and it fits perfectly. I actually tried it on before I washed it and found it to be just as comfortable and it fit perfectly after it was washed. If you are looking to support a great cause and look stylish at the same time look no further than Hemp Helps. It is nice to see that local business folks Andy & Bart the co-founders of Hemp Helps are out there and being the good. They have earned a lifelong customer because of their core values, beliefs, where their money ends up and the quality of product they are producing while being eco-friendly!!!Since 1937, about half the World's forests have been cut down to make paper. If hemp had not been outlawed, most would still be standing today oxygenating the planet. I will sign this review off with a random fact. The USS Constitution 'Old Ironsides' had 60 tons of hemp. Hemp was used in the lines, rigging & sails. I say good enough for them, good enough for you and me=)                                           HEMP CAN SAVE THE WORLD                                          The Emperor Wears No Clothes

3.description: This place was horrible the customer service was beyond awful. The wait for my exam was too long and my questions toward my  insurance were not answer correctly.The general manager was really rude and wasn't able to help with my situation regarding my glasses not to mention the bad attitude of their retail supervisor!

1.description: Because they have Sunday appointments this is truly a plus. I have a super busy schedule and having a Sunday to be able to go into an appointment is actually a good idea, as most do not do this. I was happy none the less and I am really glad that the girls in this office are that amazing also. I mean, they were attentive and very knowledgeable also on certain insurances as well as the pricing of frames. Although this day was for my elderly mom, I was very happy that it was courteous and that they understood my moms needs. In the end its all about courteous service and how you are treated and I for one have to say that they were extremely professional there. The fact that they are located inside a mini outside mall helps also due to having plenty of parking and enough space for a ton of customers. Lately I noticed that many other optical spots are not equipped to handle many customers and that the Sunday is not a factor, but when you work full time and go to school full time, a Sunday opening is exactly what is needed. Many may not realize it, but time is limited these days so being able to go and not have an appointment is awesome, although appointments will always lead to faster service. As we had one also. They also call your insurance right there to make sure they are able to provide excellent service quickly. This again is something that other optical shops cannot do, or for that matter are equipped to do. Give them a chance and also, check the YELP ad as they do have coupons here and there. USE THEM!

2.description: Worst place ever to buy glasses. Super expensive!! Never again. Try Costco, compare prices and quality and you'll see the HUGE difference. They even charge for HD GLASS and ANTI GLARE! Really?

5.description: Customer service is dreadful, CSR's does not seem to know anything about HD Insurance, personal insurance, seems they are familiar only with group insurance but no with HD or Part C insurance, walk in's get seen before people with  appointment, also, seems the CSR does not have the liberty to take decisions by themselves, every single thing has to be asked before. No communication between Dr and Front of the house.

6.description: So this was the closest place my insurance took.. I stopped in on a Tuesday afternoon.. not expecting too much and I was attended right away by the doctor and his assistants.  They have an opening special right now, but their regular prices seem pretty fair to me... I am not a regular eyeglass wearer.  Would def go back again and recommend =)

0.description: This place is 'ok'. I purchased glasses and contacts. There seems to be miscommunication between the staff there. I was told i'd get trials and when they called me to pick up my contacts the girl seemed mad and gave me attitude because i asked for the trials. Hey I'm a paying customer, i have to try them out to make sure they're right for my eyes because if i open the boxes of contacts i purchased and they're not right then too bad i opened them, i cant return them. They should really work on their customer service! When i got my glasses i did not receive any spray or cloth to clean them. When i got my contacts i asked, 'so what kind of solution should i use?' Thats when they gave me some solution and a case for them. If i wouldn't have asked i wouldn't have got anything.

4.description: "Customer service is dreadful," says another yelper.  I highly agree!

1.description: Im very glad I have this store just around the corner!!! They have a little of everything!!

0.description: This is a very strange place. It is your basic neighborhood take on a 7-11. The emphasis is more on the liquor store end of it. It is kinda dingy and not very well lit. Doesn't sound overly exciting does it? BUT .... they have one BIG claim to fame. For the past 55+ years they have made and sold fresh Polish sausage. A few months ago I drove past this place while going to lunch. They had a big sign in the window proclaiming their long heritage of selling fresh Polish sausage. Well could I resist? Heck no!!!! So I bought some frozen links to take home. Yum!!!! So today we were back in the area and I got some more. Dagnabbit, if I find myself here again in the future, I will stop and get even more. Yay! I'm a fan.

28.description: I have to drop the star due to the new menu, prices are up and anti pasto salad is no longer on the menu- neither is the family platter which consisted of fried mushrooms, zucchini, cheese sticks and such. I was highly disappointed that the new look of the menu has omitted so many of my favorites. The selection of beer for pitcher has also changed and the prices (although understandable) have gone up, the pitchers seem a tad smaller. Ummm, I am no beer expert, but I do know my pitchers. And these have gone down slightly. I wasn't impressed as I usually am and our waitress also stated that many patrons have complained about the menu "enhancements" or lack there of. This to me smells like a fish! I still think that speediness of thepizza from ordering to your table is pretty good and you can watch them make your pie through their looking glass window. Although you'll have to Stan in front of the cashier, still your kids might enjoy this. It's still hand tossed in the air and that always makes for a great experience.Parking lot lines also seemed to of narrowed, and I drive a small car so I can tell. You be the judge and as far as I'm concerned, they still serve the best deep dish this side of the Dixie line!

1.description: Why I am I giving them 4 stars, let mr be gain,  I placed an order for a heart shape pizza, but what I got was a med  stuffed pizza, so I called back, and told them they  messed up. So I spoke with  the manager. And now  I have to wait  now, for there mistake, I should get something  for this , so now I  can't keep that pizza, I think I should,  well it is not the manager fault this happens he was cool, I love this pizza, and it was a surprise for my husband when he got home from work 4 v day, and know I hope it won't be ruined .

9.description: The cannolis here suck. No flavor at all.  The calamari sucked. The stuffed pizza is good but the thin crust was not. Second and last time here, hopefully.  My grandpa had his birthday here and he hated it. He was on to something. RIP grandpa

29.description: I have nothing bad to say about their pizza. I LOVE me some Giordanos. The problem that I had was with a waitress. A cousin of mine and her finace came to visit from Michigan state. They wanted to eat pizza. What better pizza right? We were a group of 6, plus my cousin's newborn baby. First of all, the waitress that we got couldn't speak english. Most of us speak spanish, but that's not the point. The fact that we were specifically paired up with this lady annoyed me right of the bat. Why? there was a group of 5 (african americans) that got there after we did, but were seated before. Their waiter spoke english! I guess they figured they would sit the latinos and give them the waitress that can't speak english. She stood at the end of the table handing us our drinks. She gave my cousin a drink, she gave it to me, I gave it to my hubby :/ She brought the appetizers out and kept handing them to my cousins, instead of just placing them on the table. When the pizza came out, same thing. WE had to move the empty plates out of the way and make room for the pizza because she decided to put it right in front of the baby's seat. She was no where to be found for refills. When we finally got her, we had to make sure to order anything else that we wanted. I forgot to mention, she also stood by my cousin (the new mom) and was asking her personal questions. Like, is she breastfeeding. When my cousin answered yes, she then told her that she was going to give her some "tips." O_o  She told her not to go out with her shoulders exposed (she was wearing a strapless shirt), because that would cause her milk "to evaporate." I was annoyed and asked her if she could just please go get us our drinks (we didn't have our drinks yet, but she was giving ADVISE). I don't know. I was just annoyed at the whole situation. My cousin's and hubby were too. I was going to ask for the manager, but my husband didn't want  me too. I think I should have. She was sooo unprofessional, that it was just annoying. By the way, I did ask her at one point if she was new. She said she wasn't. I would have understood if she was. I'm not saying that I won't be back. I will just keep an eye out for this particular waitress.

23.description: My family and I were delayed by those cancellations of the flights. We came here to  enjoy some peace and we got it! The food is amazing as well as the service!!! The manager Oscar was awesome! He made us feel welcomed! Tell us some funny stories. Our waitress Letticia was excellent! Refills when we needed it without asking for one. She was amazing! Pizza was amazing!

5.description: What I like about Giordano's is that they are very consistent with all their different locations. I've been to 3 different locations and they've all tasted great and had excellent employees.

31.description: OH MY PIZZA PIE!!! Huge restaurant chain in Chicago, you seem to see one everywhere, mainly in the south area.Maybe to the locals in Chicago they wouldn't be able to give this place a 5 and maybe just a 4. For being from LA this place is a 5, pizza was soo good. Stuffed with mozzarella cheese, salami and mushrooms, topped with olives! The sauce that it's on top of the pizza pie is sooo good, not salty and has a good tomato flavor. I really expected this pizza to be greasy BUT I was wrong, flaky buttery crusted, not greasy at all but not something I would eat every week. Maybe once a year! haha...It was just all kinds of awesome, when going out to Chicago you must try their stuffed pizza pies!! You can build your own or order what they offer on the menu. Please allow 30 minutes to cook these bad boys, it's worth the wait, get a salad while you wait. =)

25.description: Mmmmm... we loved the pizza. I'm an East Coaster and so NY style is my love, but we enjoyed this very much!

12.description: I've come to this location multiple times in the past, but I was always with a larger group and ordered a pizza. This is the first time I actually ordered something else from the menu. I must say I was impressed. My mom and I ordered the Chicken Parm, which says it feeds about 2 people. I uploaded a picture of it, and it could easily feed four people. We also tried a soup, I don't recall what it was, but it was very similar to Chicken Noodle with ravioli. I enjoyed this venture away from the simple pizza orders. However, I won't make a habit out of it! The pizza is still their strong suit, but the pasta was a good contender.

37.description: i dont remember when this wasnt a chain, but i do remember  when there was a location on 63rd by california(its not the midway one, that barely opened).  im really not sure if that was the original, but i do remember ordering from that one when i was a kid. since that location closed this is the one we usually order our STUFFED pizza from. the stuffed sausage is very good, also the spinach. i never had  Giordano's pizza from all the other locations that seem to be popping up everywhere, but it does suck when a place like this, and uno's get bought out and they make them everywhere!!! oh well the pizza is still good, stay away from the thin crust, i really dont care to much for it!!!
