21.description: I love Giordanos pizza in general. Yesterday I got a lunch special which was $10. Anyway I got the baby sausage deep dish with a side of Parmesan garlic fries and a lemonade. The deep dish was amazing as usual. The fries by themselves were just ok, but with the ranch sauce provided were amazing! The servings were more than enough. I ate all the fries and only 1/4 of the pizza and took the rest home.

16.description: The pizza is always great, I just refuse to eat in the facility. I went for my birthday with my family, we were a table of like 13 people, in the middle of the day, no other customers were there. And we were abandoned for an hour without any service. I was very disappointed, we spoke to a manager and it seemed like he didn't even care, the whole experience just sucked.

17.description: I ordered food to go by phone at 8:43 they said it would be done in 35 minutes. I am not complaining about the time. My complaints are about the two kids working the counter, a young man and young woman. There were two other people before me still waiting for their food and the young woman had the nerve to confront the guests by saying, from over the counter, "is there something funny?" Really? Then I overheard her say, "I don't care about them" to her coworkers, again, REALLY? My name is Antero Suarez and I am an Executive Chef. If I heard one of my employees even say that to a customer, she world be fired immediately. That was the most disappointing thing I would expected from a Giordanos employee. This happened at the Pulaski store. I would expect better manners from your employees. Moreover, your manager blew off the previous customer in front of the employees. Why would a manager promote that kind of disrespect to the clientele? Obviously, she is behind the culture of this restaurant. This happened around 9:35 pm on a Friday night.

10.description: Given that it's Valentine's Day, this place is packed (as expected), still, everything went smooth. Great pizza, kids loved it, very reasonable timing. Came in around 5pm, it's now 6:45; we were seated in 20 minutes, had drinks and appetizers ten minutes just after being seated and are just wrapping things up. Kudos to the manager on duty, Oscar and staff for running such a smooth shift (at least from my experience tonight)!! Our server, Denise was also very pleasant and great with the kids.

11.description: My first stuffed pizza.  Yum!!  I may move to Chicago just for this!

26.description: I'm at client near this restaurant and I must service is fast waiter was really nice, Alfonso. Food was great as well and you can't really beat the lunch special... Choice of pizza, pasta, or sandwiches with one side and a drink under 10 bucks including tax!

27.description: I love the lunch menu here.very affordable

35.description: Been here once because I didn't feel like dealing with parking downtown.If you don't know what giordano's pizza is like, then you simply must try it.  If you do know, then also know that this location is doing it right. The service was also very friendly.  Maybe even more friendly than the ones downtown. One of the other reviewers submitted a rather racist review, complaining about all of the "illegals".  Well, what he means is that he thinks all Mexican people are here illegally.  Besides being a racist, he is also ignorant. But I repeat myself. Sure, most of the staff was Mexican.  So what?  What, do think they would put salsa on the pizza and have a mariachi band playing the background?  Don't be ridiculous.  The pizza was good, and this a good location.  The neighborhood isn't high dollar north side, but it's fine.  If you're from out of town like me and are looking for a convenient location not too far off I-55 but don't feel like dealing with downtown, then go here.

8.description: I have to drop the star due to the new menu, prices are up and anti pasto salad is no longer on the menu- neither is the family platter which consisted of fried mushrooms, zucchini, cheese sticks and such. I was highly disappointed that the new look of the menu has omitted so many of my favorites. The selection of beer for pitcher has also changed and the prices (although understandable) have gone up, the pitchers seem a tad smaller. Ummm, I am no beer expert, but I do know my pitchers. And these have gone down slightly. I wasn't impressed as I usually am and our waitress also stated that many patrons have complained about the menu "enhancements" or lack there of. This to me smells like a fish! I still think that speediness of thepizza from ordering to your table is pretty good and you can watch them make your pie through their looking glass window. Although you'll have to Stan in front of the cashier, still your kids might enjoy this. It's still hand tossed in the air and that always makes for a great experience.Parking lot lines also seemed to of narrowed, and I drive a small car so I can tell. You be the judge and as far as I'm concerned, they still serve the best deep dish this side of the Dixie line!

0.description: Amazing service and amazing food! We came here on a recommendation from our hotel and I'm glad we listened!

20.description: I've come to this location multiple times in the past, but I was always with a larger group and ordered a pizza. This is the first time I actually ordered something else from the menu. I must say I was impressed. My mom and I ordered the Chicken Parm, which says it feeds about 2 people. I uploaded a picture of it, and it could easily feed four people. We also tried a soup, I don't recall what it was, but it was very similar to Chicken Noodle with ravioli. I enjoyed this venture away from the simple pizza orders. However, I won't make a habit out of it! The pizza is still their strong suit, but the pasta was a good contender.

19.description: I love the lunch menu here.very affordable

33.description: Restaurant was clean.  I highly recommend the deep dish pizza.  Very delicious.  Had to eat here twice on my vacation. A small pizza will be more than enough for 2 adults. The only downside is that a deep dish pizza takes about 35 minutes to get to your table. But the wait is worth it.

2.description: Out of all the Giordano's that I've visited, this one was by far the worst. Arrived at 2pm on a Sunday, and the restaurant was fairly empty. We were seated right away (party of 5) and drink orders were taken promptly. After that, the service went way downhill. We ordered an appetizer platter to share, and what came out was very disappointing. For almost $13, I'd expect more than two pieces of garlic bread sliced into bite size pieces and frozen toasted ravioli. Our plates were not cleared from our appetizer until the pizza arrived, and drink glasses went empty for quite a while. When the pizza finally arrived it was fine, but not good like I have expected from other Giordano's locations. The deep dish pizza also arrived to our table lukewarm, and we had to serve ourselves, unlike other locations I have visited. We finally spoke to the manager who stated they were understaffed. That is fine, but at least come by and let us know. He gave us a free dessert (the best part on our meal) but unfortunately by that time it was too little too late. We saw the server maybe 3 times the entire hour and a half we were there, so it's not like she was running around to other tables. I don't plan on visiting this location again as the food and service are much better elsewhere.

34.description: I've been here twice very recently with a friend (been here many times before that also). We ordered a large deep dish mushroom pizza (Large just so that I can have leftovers for the next day). It was great as usual. I just wish I could've had more toppings but wanted my friend to be satisfied ;). This location is my favorite because I find it more cozy than the one on 63rd & Cicero. The service is great. In fact, I wish the waiter would've just left my friend and me alone to enjoy each other's company and to enjoy the pizza especially, lol. :)

32.description: After finishing the Bank of America Chicago Marathon I was in the mood for Chicago Style pizza.The Carlton Inn driver recommended I try Giordano's since it was close by and I wouldn't have to catch the 'L' and return to downtown. I gave them a call and placed an order for a small stuffed pizza with cheese and jalapenos.When I went to pick my order up, the actual restaurant looked cool and the employees were friendly!The pizza itself was dense! Had I not been hungry, this would have been sufficient for 2 meals or 2 people. It was delicious! Just be prepared for a LOT of cheese! The crust seems to be a cornmeal based crust and the cheese is stringy.All in all - this location is conveniently close to the CTA Orange Line 'L' station and if you're looking to beat the downtown rush, eat here.

18.description: I have been to this particular location many times over the years, but today's visit made sure I will never return.I prefer to keep reviews "short and sweet", so here's what I experienced:We spotted 2 ants on our table. When we walked in the main dining area was closed off for cleaning (now I can guess why), so we were seated in a far corner booth to the right of the bar where, after 15 minutes, we noticed the insects. Waitress then moved us to the main dining area (pizza in hand). Insects = inexcusable.Pizza was burnt.Our glasses were dirty.The only good part of our visit was the very friendly waitress. I have always liked the food at Giordano's (expensive/overpriced as it may be), but I will travel farther next time to a different Giordano's location because this one has become just plain disgusting.

13.description: Both the staff & the manager at this location are super friendly & helpful. The value for the money, no one should ever go home hungry for sure! We always took food home. And the stuffed crust pie - OMG are you kidding me? We're going to order online & get it shipped to us here in TX b/c we can't do w/o it!

4.description: The pizza was amazing! I came to Chicago on vacation and heard that this is the place to try, so i did! Such a good decision. The crust is a mix between a pie and a croissant, something I had never experienced. This pizza has a lot of cheese and sauce - my two favorite parts. The toppings (olives and pepperoni) were a bit light, but that ended up being alright. The Parmesan fries were also delicious and much needed as the pizza took about 40 minutes to cook. Totally worth the wait.I'm not a deep dish expert, nor am I a Chicago food expert. But this was some of the best pizza I have ever had. And they have parking!!!

24.description: Poor service on 3 different occasions1. Ordered ahead got seated left after 30 min because no came to our table, guess they don't get the concept.2. Ordered lunch for my team one of the sandwiches had a nice long hair3, Clearly ordered a chicken sandwich but somehow managed tog get a mozzarella sandwich.Other observations, Manager helps out in the kitchen but he doesn't wear a hair net and I saw him pick asparagus off a tray with his bare hands. He also doesn't speak much English so this might explain the poor service.

6.description: My family always gets pizza from here, this is real Chicago pizza. We always get delivery, which takes about an hour. The day before valentines, I ordered a heart shaped pizza & it was the most perfect heart, both in shape & taste! A little pricey, but worth it

22.description: I have been to this particular location many times over the years, but today's visit made sure I will never return.I prefer to keep reviews "short and sweet", so here's what I experienced:We spotted 2 ants on our table. When we walked in the main dining area was closed off for cleaning (now I can guess why), so we were seated in a far corner booth to the right of the bar where, after 15 minutes, we noticed the insects. Waitress then moved us to the main dining area (pizza in hand). Insects = inexcusable.Pizza was burnt.Our glasses were dirty.The only good part of our visit was the very friendly waitress. I have always liked the food at Giordano's (expensive/overpriced as it may be), but I will travel farther next time to a different Giordano's location because this one has become just plain disgusting.

15.description: The pizza here is always great, but it's the service that is lacking. I can't remember accurately the countless amount of times I have ordered from this location in which I remind the representative over the phone to send me crushed pepper, they fail to do so.  The most recent occassion was this weekend in which I bought 4 pizzas, asked them not to forget the pepper this time and they said there would be a charge (not a problem) I get charged and I still didn't get any! Now yes it is only crushed pepper,  but cmon the repetitive let downs take a toll. If I have to leave my house to get my complete order I minus well visit Home Run Inn instead as it closer to me.

7.description: I remember the stuffed pizza was good every time my cousin was back in town we go here but just recently noticed its going downhill I'm not sure if it's just this location but the spinach isn't even fresh I remember it being so green this last time it was dark green almost brown

36.description: I've eaten here a few times with my family and friends. The spinach deep dish and special with sausage, mushrooms, peppers and green onion are my picks for deep dish. I prefer the thin crust pizza over the deep dish in general. The quality of the pizza is higher than dominos or pizza hut.

30.description: Simply the best deep dish pizza on the planet.  So good in fact that I will be having 8 pies flown from Chicago to Austin TX for a party in January.

3.description: Service was really bad. They are completely liars. Waste of my time I had to wait two or more hours waiting which I could had spent with my family. Yet they still didn't have my order ready.

14.description: WARNING! Take a look at the itemized receipt before paying. I was charged on items that were never ordered.

0.description: Every time I come here the girls are so friendly and helpful. They're always helpful when I need recommendations or advice on products. I read the other review previous to mine, and I get why this location does the back pack policy. All of the businesses around this high school do. Policy is policy. You don't like it, go to another location. It's simple.

3.description: I love the consome here! I also like the piña envuelta. The place is small but comfortable

1.description: I ordered for delivery and they charge $4? I think that's a lot! Just because I was hungover or else I would've walked 2 blocks to get it. Consomé levanta muertos  was good and spicy. The coctel vuelve a la vida was not what I'm used to. No flavor, there was more water than anything. Expensive. For large Consomé and the medium coctel I paid $19 plus $4 they charged for shipping.

0.description: Great Place!!!This has been my little secret place for a long time!!! The only reason I did not give it 5 stars is the service. They are great people but they are a family owned place. They really do not know about  professional service its not their fault. The food speaks for itself. It is awesome... I always stop by to pick up orders is Ceviche. It is the healthiest fast food seafood in the planet. I'm in and out in 10 minute and get to eat delicious seafood. I have always loved this place. It's not a hole in the wall. It's been around for a long time. It's not fancy at all... This is were you take your GF of 6 months after all the formalities are over LOL(Old Review on account with lost password)

2.description: Was at this place on sunday n honestly big disappointment very small place, food not as good as i would hear it was and very poor customer service regret not going to el mulle how i had originally planned......

5.description: Stopped by this place yesterday and was interested because it always seems to be busy on weekends.  I came to find out that it was likely more busy due to it being BYOB than food quality.  Don't get me wrong, my camarones momias were delish but the same couldn't be said about my wife's dish.  She ordered the garlic shrimp dish and some of the shrimps hadn't been prepped correctly.  There was still vein in a couple of them.  Come on people this is seafood 101.  And the avocados they served with our dishes were still green.  It's like eating an unripened banana.  And who likes that.  The tostadas bag table side was open when we sat down.  Not a big deal to me but my wife equated it to having someone else's bread bowl unfinished.  Overall it wasn't that bad but they do need to do better in the cleanliness department.

6.description: VERY hole in the wall but some great food.  I love seafood and have eaten at some pretty fancy places but this place always hits the spot and is very consistent.  I like the ceviche, camarones a la diabla, and caldo de camaron.   Pretty much all their shrimp dishes are delicious. The prices are not as expensive as other marisco restaurants. I usually do carryout bc getting a seat can be tough on the weekends. Also, BYOB .Overall, nice casual place to drink a beer and have some seafood at an affordable price.

7.description: Great place to get fresh and delicious Mexican seafood.  You can get some fresh ceviche to fancier pinaple stuffed with seafood. Its not fancy, it a great neighboorhood spot. Forget the large retail chain. Great attentive service. Great place to catch a soccer game

8.description: Great Place!!!This has been my little secret place for a long time!!! The only reason I did not give it 5 stars is the service. They are great people but they are a family owned place. They really do not know about  professional service its not their fault. The food speaks for itself. It is awesome... I always stop by to pick up orders is Ceviche. It is the healthiest fast food seafood in the planet. I'm in and out in 10 minute and get to eat delicious seafood. I have always loved this place. It's not a hole in the wall. It's been around for a long time. It's not fancy at all... This is were you take your GF of 6 months after all the formalities are over LOL

9.description: Great food, consome is my favorite. They seem annoyed when they take your order and when you get up to pay. 5 stars if they were a little friendly.

10.description: Totally a hole in the wall, but it sure is a tasty one! Listen, I dont even like shrimp, but the "camarones sarandeados" here are out of this world! This place is truly amazing and unique. They also sell really good ceviche to take on the go. Woohoo! As good as it gets!

4.description: I'm a big fan of this place. I always buy the shrimp empanadas dinner meal. Also, the shrimp ceviche & the crab salad are delicious. Small place. I always do carry-out. Waiters are friendly and professional. They have parking.

3.description: I love this place! Las Asadas is waaaay underrated. I'm super picky with my Mexican food and I love their asada!!! If you love your asada as much as I do, give this place a try!

1.description: 3 starts only for the tacos and 1 start for the price....First of all, every time I go to this place is dead... so makes me wonder if they are still on business then I go inside, see the prices and I remember why is sooo empty....The flavor on the tacos it could be tricky to put it that way.... I have come to this place and the tacos are delicious then I go another time and the their tacos are bland.... so it might have to do with the taquero or perhaps the time the cook the meat, the true who knows????? but yeah this tacos are on that $$$ level of price for a taco, that you never know for sure if you are going to the best taco... just like at mcdonalds when I was a kid always wanting to get the best toy from my happy meal...

2.description: I've been telling my guy I want to try this place out since he usually picks me up Mexican from somewhere on Archer.He ended up gettting me 2 lengua tacos and a steak torta for himself.Lengua Taco - I thought they were very tender. Although could be cut up a bit smaller.Steak Torta - My guy wasn't too impressed as he thought the bread wasn't fresh.The green sauce they gave was pretty watery.I'll still like to give their steak burrito a try and then give another review.

5.description: I love those tacos I recoddem  those tacos to you There the best tacos I eat those tacos a lot

6.description: Tried the Asada and Lengua tacos and I wasn't impress especially when they microwaved the lengua

7.description: Best tacos in the southside!!!! definitely taste like Carne asada anytime of the year.  We love their black salsa. The agua horchata is the best. If you want good tacos and fast you must come here.

8.description: The quesadilla tasted super stale the guy making the food didn't  wash his hands before making food nor did he use gloves. Overall the most greasiest quesadilla I had.

9.description: Although, this tiny little place doesnt look like much, doesnt take credit cards, and has few tables, it has the BEST carne asada tacos in the area. I've eaten at most of the taquierias around here and this place is the best. The tacos de carne asada and quesedillas de carne asada are my favorite. The salsas are really good too.

0.description: I usually go to the one on Western by Armitage but decided to give this location a try, their meat is super juicy and delicious. Most taco joints have rubbery, fatty, and non flavored carne asada but this place isn't one of those. Give them a try, you ain't be disappointed

4.description: This place does not have as good tacos as people say. I read the reviews and saw all the hype so I had to come in here and settle this once and for all. The tacos did not feel fresh and were kind of bland. The tortillas they use are just not good at all. It's like the super white tortillas with the funny taste. Then when they serve them they are wrapped in white paper which them leads me to the impression that these have been rolled up for a while and sitting in a steamer. All in all, I will never come back here for tacos.

3.description: Really great food, and they deliver. Underrated imo. Service isn't the best, but the food makes it up.

1.description: I've never eaten inside here but have gotten to go orders. Their al pastor tacos are flame! Not very greasy and they give you a lot of meat on the taco. .. This place is also inexpensive

0.description: Whoaaaa.Some of the best tacos in the city that I've had.  And I've been to some authentic dives in all sorts of neighborhoods.  The place looks inconspicuous but don't judge this book by its cover.  They have a few small tables for diners who want to dine in, however it is is pretty small on the inside.  Their quality and flavoring of their meat and the quality of their tortillas can't be beat.    The food comes out looking attractive and not wrapped in foil or placed in plastic baskets like most Mexican joints.

2.description: This is a small restaurant / stand, but great tacos, friendly staff and really clean,  well run place. Doesn't look like much from the street but try it, it's great!!

5.description: Any time I cruise through this area I need to stop in. This is a Chicago taco joint, so any type of "dining experience" is not even an issue. Stop in, order your food, watch it get made in front of you, and take it home. (Otherwise expect to sit at a tight counter or small booth, because that's how it works.) Anything "Asada" is fantastic, as is 'al Pastor'. Food is wrapped so tight that I usually drive another half hour and it's still piping hot when I get home. I just glanced down at the other reviews... yeah. Don't go to "The King of Tacos and Burritos" for oysters.

6.description: This place is definitely one of those hole in the wall type of places, but the food is amazing!  The tacos are delicious, the salsa and chips are soooooo good!

7.description: Best kept secret on s.side better than the overrated overcrowded Solazo . Tortas are fiiiiiire!!!

8.description: I give the torta de asada the 5 stars.  La carne has good flavor. Caution- it is on the soggier side (vs the crispy bread). If I want a torta this is one of my go-to-spots.

9.description: This place would be my go to spot for some tacos or burritos, but they recently hired this new older lady who cant seem to get anything right. Everytime I go to el rey my order has a 90% chance of being wrong. She is obviously  not meant to be a server. For that reason I dont even go anymore

10.description: very close to my place that's why I come to this place and this place is very good.good food=)

4.description: When I head to the city, you can smell the steak cooking when driving past here. This time I had to stop and give it a try....it was awesome!  Burritos, tacos and gorditas are a must have!!!!

3.description: My guy friend and i have a healthy obession/interest/curiosity for Antonio Banderes. We both have his perfumes/clognes male/felmale (i use both myself). We love his photos on the internet and the promotional ones especially for his perfumes/colognes. They are serious and romantic in a cheesy way. We love looking at them. It cracks us up. One of the last times i went there my friend and i decided to ask the manager if we could have the promotional cardboard photo of him and his current perfume when they throw it out. She was so sweet and said yes. She wrote our number and names down and said she'd call us, and that we can check back as well.

1.description: Heart Walgreens for it's in an out services and having the card really helps. They are all the same but I always find what I need here and the staff always ready to help you and greet u at the door even though they are busy with customers. A bit pricey if there is no sale so make sure u go with the sale paper.

2.description: Pretty good Walgreens. Clean and well stocked.Employees are pretty nice, but man there was this one cashier that was checking this one family money for legit-ness (if that's even a word). They were $20, but maybe they have counterfeit issues here.

0.description: Nice Walgreens to come to. Whether being to pick up  over the counter or prescribed medicines, to get pictures printed out, purchasing the newspaper or to use their red box and chase atm. They close at midnight. It helps to view their weekly sales paper because of the deals they offer and for their in store coupons. And if a item is not in stock they can issue you a rain check.I've always encountered a very friendly staff that greets you behind the counter as you come in or when your ready to check out.I want to acknowledge an employee specifically by the name of Juan Perez who was working the photo department. Recently I had some pictures printed out in a bigger size. When I came back to pick them up without my knowledge he added a discount code. He told me he noticed I didn't add the promo code during my check out and he wanted me to save some money. I guess I overlooked the promo code for the enlargements. Now that was very thoughtful of him, and for that I thank him!

3.description: Came in to pick up guacamole. Thank god it was only $3.50 as opposed to the one on Cicero which wanted $4.99. Eek!Tried their crab meat salad and it was a bit too salty.

1.description: Do not tell Pete that I cheated on him with Cermak.I usually go to Pete's market but  I needed something that Pete's didn't have and I knew that they have it in here.It was Friday in lent time and I wanted to make a shrimp salad for a family gathering. Well it is a b$#% to clean and prep shrimp. And my usual market does not carry cleaned deveined shrimp so I came here.They have it and it was reasonably priced. since I was there I took a look around and got some red bell peppers and onions for the salad along with some other stuff (not about to give you the recipe, quite good though)The place is nice and well stocked, clean and  service is helpful and nice.I would come here If Pete wasn't around

2.description: This is my spot to go for fresh fruits, veggies and meat. They always have my deli fresh and produce as well. Good sales when they got them but they got to work on getting better aguacates and limones in their store.

0.description: What an amazing store with great produce and meat selection. Clean store with good product display, friendly staff and good prices.

4.description: The most horrible experience ever! Bought corn and found all of them to be old and moldy. YUCK!

3.description: Came here to eat with the family,  as soon as we sat down the waitress brought a bowl of soup for my daughter. Thumbs up!We had a hard tortilla with beans as appetizers on the house...I ordered a guacamole as appetizer, never got it :/, I didn't said anything,  but the still added in the check, good thing the waitress noticed. .My plate was overloaded withl salsa and the steak was over cooked. .overall was a good and polite service. .

1.description: The inside is really nice and Horchata was good. one star.Soup for starters, they don't even fill the bowl halfway. Chips and salsa was filled not even half way either. Really? Ordered a tongue taco for my daughter. Where's the meat? No joke, I don't think that meat would even make a half a taco!!! Ordered enchiladas, they were so dry. I scraped some of the red sauce off the tortilla to tste the flavor which was good but it was on there like only to make the tortilla red, not even. Where's the chicken in my enchiladas? There was a big enchilada with no sauce and little chicken. Also ordered flautas for my other daughter. NO I repeat NO NOTHING NADA of chicken in these flautas!! My seven year old said she felt like she was eating only chips dipped in sour cream.  Very small portions of beans and rice on the side. My mom only enjoyed the horchata. To put it short..While I put the kids in the car, they both tell me they're hungry. We ended up wasting money on food that I wouldn't call food at all!!! I made chicken nuggets and fries at home and ate ceviche tostadas at home. So disappointing for a nice looking place. NUNCA REGRESARE!!!!

2.description: "Si el original Chavas Tacos en la Pulaski y 44"so that what I heard on the radio, lol I thought that it looked promising and could be good.'Few days ago, with time not on my side decided to check them out. There with a friend and we ordered Mixed meat molcajete, grilled fish dinner and steak tacos, it is chavas tacos after all.The tacos were ... not good enough to be called chavas TACOS, the fish was decent and the molcajete was actually pretty good. Service was nice and the place is kinda big and cool. That day there was a lot of hay on the floor, if it is part od the décor, super cool, if it is not then it was super dirty. I should have askedPricewise I would say that it is right on

5.description: Pretty righteous Authentic Mexican food!Had the tacos, chicken,  beef & pork. Fresh guacamole and really good salsas. I will return!

6.description: Great mexican food,  camarones a la diabla are awesome! ! I was in heaven lol hardly recommend. .

7.description: I went to the location on Grand/Western and my experience was wonderful. I have always driven by this place and I have said to my husband "let try it one day" and well that was two days ago. He had a meeting on Grand and my son and I were hungry. It was Tuesday and we do Taco Tuesday at our home so we picked this place. The place is very clean, and the staff greet you as soon as you walk in. The place was a little warmer but I am sure it's because they weren't ready for the temps that rose that day. Anyway, I ordered the taco dinner, and my boy got two chicken tacos. The food came out pretty quick and it was so fresh and HOT! My steak tacos were amazing. They were so big and full of meat. I actually could have made 3 more tacos with all the meat I was given :) I asked my son how he liked his food and he gave me the thumbs up. He loved his chicken and his guacamole. Everything was great. The only down fall was it was $18 for both of us.I felt that was pretty steep for two ppl. And he is only 6 so his tacos were very plain, and he drank water. Overall, it was a great experience and they even clean your area after you are done. I will definitely add this place to one of my top Taco places in Chicago. It was delicious! :)

0.description: Nicely done! Dope dinner really was the bomb and I totally enjoyed the authentic food for sure! I am happy that I stopped by and decided to give them a goings over. I saw that they opened a whole back but refused to stop due to not caring for rinky dink new places, but I was so surprised when I came in and saw that they had a big dining room.So the cook wears a cowboy hat (easy ladies and gentleman) and I love that he really gets down in that kitchen and you can see that he enjoys what he does. That's a plus! I order the sopes dinner with beans and rice and have to admit I was pleasantly surprised. I did enjoy the taste of real Mexico and not Taco Bell for sure. That's what I'm talking about, real Mexican food. Give them a try soon.

4.description: One of our shippers is close by. So I went for walk and came across this restaurant called. Camarones a LA Diabia. I just wanted to order tacos to go. It was nicely decorated and benches to sit on while you wait. I take it there is a line when they get busy and customer want to sit down while they wait for a table.  The main reason I wanted to write a review is that when I got back to my truck. I was surprise that the employee went beyond my expectations. I expected the tacos and sauce, but I found 5 slices of limes wrapped in foil. No one has taken the time on their own to put lime slices unless you ask for them with your order. The tacos were outstanding. Next time I have some more free time I will order a full meal.   Now I let the cat out of the bag, they will have to keep going beyond everybody expectations. Because it will be expected from them.

0.description: This restaurant used to be called Vina Del Mar, now i believe its El Cangrejo. My family and i used to go atleast once a month and i used to LOVE the food and the atmosphere. El Cangrejo who is now probably owned by someone else is OVERPRICED and they apparently charge gratuity for a family of 4?! Are you kidding me? Horrible! If you want good mexican seafood, go to El Muelle on 47th or Islas Marias.

3.description: Came here with my guy once. Laid back atmosphere. Nice place to sit and have some drinks. No live music the day we went.Owner was nice and friendly. (He gave me a fan.) Patrons are nice and friendly too.Would go more if I lived closer!

1.description: This place has an old school bar feel too it. The person checking IDs is no one other than Tony!!! Ha I got carded even though I'm way older but I will take it as a compliment!! The bartenders were also old school but they made bomb drinks!!! The DJ himself was older but he knew what he was doing!!! Had a blast and would definetly come back and chill here!!!

2.description: I went to this place over the weekend for a surprise birthday party, and was surprised myself.  Very roomy, the owner walked around to make sure everyone was having a good time, and if they needed anything.  Plus I think he was making sure there would be no riff raff coming in.  I like that.  Plus the drinks were reasonable, and they were's short cut if ya know what I mean.  Food was pretty good and the entertainment was great.  I enjoyed myself.  I think I'll be going back there real soon.  Parking was a scarce, but if you get lucky you'll get a space.  With the bar on one side, and the big room and stage on the other he really should hire some entertainment.  That place would be a goldmine.

5.description: Actually a nice place to get some drinks and a bit of dancing too - has a nice worn wood decor, which gives it a nice broken-in feel, and the DJ spins the wheel with some good tunes, sometimes even some from the 80s (OMG!!!).A bit cozy, so its not for your large cadre of friends and their friends, and easily accessible washrooms.  And since it is a small-ish place, it gets loud real quick.Still, a nice place to go to after you get kicked out of Guide's, and not too far from Midway Airport!Parking is in the rear, and on the streets too.

6.description: I love Tony'o's...although the crowd has changed from when I first started hanging out there. It is a great place to have a few drinks and get the night started. The music is great and Tony is a spectacular host. Most of the people who go are laid back...but there are some people to keep an eye out for. But security is super tight - always a priority here - and I have not seen any trouble. Everyone is respectful and it's always a great time.

0.description: The owner is the coolest guy I've ever met and he greets you when you enter and bids you farewell when you leave. Great karaoke Dj on Tuesdays and they even offer free food and the drinks are fairly priced all in all best place to hang out Especially on Tuesdays stop in and check it out

4.description: Was in town on business and Tony O's Studio 31 Lounge was reccommended. It really was a good time. The owner is very personal, the drinks are reasonable, and the crowd is friendly. Definitely a good place to visit. I went both nights I was in town!

3.description: Terrible customer service. Before I gave this review; I've ordered more than three times but no improvement.

1.description: I have been ordering from this location for years and have got to say that the management has improved. They were very nice the last time I carried out and you can't beat the price while feeding a family!

2.description: Honestly , I am being nice in giving one star. We order the pizza for pick up, once we got there, they had given my pizza to someone else . Patiently waited for an additional 20 min only so they can give my pizza to another customer again!!!!! Again waited.... Waited.... From the time I order to actually receiving the pizza was over an hour!!!!!  too upset to even eat!! This branch seriously needs a new manager , new employees !!!!

0.description: I always order from here when I am craving pizza. Order online to get the best deals..Out of all the pizzerias near my area this one takes the prize in arriving to my house the fastest!..Their delivery system never fails to let me down oppose to their other competitors who take 5 hours for a delivery. They deliver late as 12am-1am..The food itself tastes great..try the buffalo chicken sandwich with bleu cheese or spinach and feta cheesy bread....as far as pizza i don't get too creative i either order reg garlic crust with pepperoni and salami, or a thin crust with bbq sauce instead of marinara topped with cheese and chicken strips..big ups to management for having a good team, even when i do carry out they are always friendly and attentive..my family always ordered Pizza Hut, now I convinced them to order through this Dominos location
